Title: Anyone else imagine themselves in a public debate?
Text:
Winter is coming so are my hyperactive thoughts! :D 

  
Whenever I get caught in a thought cycle I imagine myself standing at a podium infront of a faceless crowd with cameras and everything. My opponent is firing enraging statements about how I am a terrible person for my beliefs and if I don't counter with arguments that prove that I am right quickly, I will lose people's favor. Then my life will be over and my reputation will be ruined. 

  
I have grown a lot since last year. I used to panic in these imaginary public debates now I find myself laughing at myself because thankfully I progressed a lot in my recovery since then.

Text: Hello good morning everyone, I'm fighting OCD about lead contamination, anyone here with the same problem?

Title: Alcohol & Caffeine
Text:
I have OCD and am an alcoholic. When I used to drink alcohol, I could down coffee and espressos like no other. Due to obvious reasons I haven't been drinking anymore for 7 months. It comes with challenges, but I am very aware that it is better for me and I am doing well in that regard.

However... Coffee. One cup and I am going through the roof. I cannot drink it anymore. And for some reason it seems even harder for me to stay away from coffee than stay away from alcohol. 

At this point it is frustrating to me. Yesterday I drank coffee in the afternoon. My intrusive thoughts were horrible, I got anxiety until I was trembling, nauseous and my heart was racing. It kept me up until 03.00.

With alcohol and coffee I felt like I had "a little moment" for me. A treat in someway. I tried drinking tea, lots of different kinds, but it is so flavorless compared to alcohol and coffee.

There are so much harder things in life, but I guess I just had to complain a bit. When drinking lots of alcohol and caffeine, I was less healthy, but I felt like I was able to give myself a break. I kind of lost that.

I guess I was wondering if other people miss it to or maybe have something similar or just a kind word for me..

Title: Can no longer make decisions, OCD related?
Text:
Hi. Lately, my anxiety has been much worse in a way I haven’t experienced before. I’m not sure if it’s OCD related or not, but I’ve become so dysfunctional. And it sounds so silly, because it’s over the littlest things that my mind starts malfunctioning. Every day feels like I’m just surviving through, trying to get past whatever fog has come over my brain. I can no longer make decisions, no matter how small they are. I will spend hours upon hours agonizing over choices and most of my day I’m in a state of limbo. I will stand at the grocery store in the same aisle for god knows who long because I’m unable to make a choice. I went to the store to get the same candle I always get. But I just stare at the number of sizes this candle comes in. And I stare and stare and go through mentally why this option may be wrong or why the other option might be wrong. Some of them had three wicks instead of two, maybe that should factor into my decision. I’ll sit in parking lots for 30+ minutes doing nothing but trying to decide what I’m going to do when and where I’m going to go. It’s the silliest thing but it has become so extreme that I’ve barely been eating. I’m a college student for context. “Should I make dinner now?” *takes out ingredients. “No, I should make this other dinner I had planned for later in the week. Wait, I have no time to make a dinner right now. Maybe I should make coffee and breakfast for dinner and stay up until I finish my assignment. Or maybe I should go to sleep now and wake up early and just eat then instead.” And I spent from 8:30 pm to midnight going back and forth, procrastinating my work, unable to make a decision about food, and stressing. Sometimes I’ll just sit down and think and think why can’t I organize my thoughts why can’t I just decide why am I so dysfunctional. I haven’t eaten today. I gave up, brushed my teeth and I’m in bed now on my phone. I didn’t eat much yesterday either. I feel like I’m in such a blur. These past two months, I had to stop and realize the seasons were changing and how it had started getting dark so soon. It seemed like I missed it all, bc I had been surviving instead of living. My brain just keeps shutting down. I feel helpless. 

I do have OCD but I’m not sure if whatever is going on with me is related? But it sucks hours from my day. Has anyone else experienced something like this?

Title: false memories
Text:
does anyone get the kind of false memory intrusive thoughts that make you believe horrible things happened to you, instead of the usual you doing horrible things? like you were molested as a kid?

i’ve been doing good, on good meds, but can’t get the intrusive thought of it out of my head. and the problem is, with this specific thing, i know that people live a lifetime in denial that it happened. however, logically, i know it didn’t. that the person who my brain is trying to say did it would never hurt me, and my mom is a helicopter parent who knew all of the signs to look out for. still, i can’t go to sleep because i just can’t get it out of my head. is there anyone out there who has also dealt with anything similar? or am i actually losing it?

Title: Does anyone else deal with serious anger and aggression with their OCD?
Text:
I’ve noticed the older I get the more my OCD evolves and it seems that the more grace and understanding I give myself the less grace and patience I have with the world around me. 

I get so irritated quickly now and it takes a lot of mental strength to calm myself down. One of my big triggers is when people lack consideration. I’m sure it’s a control related issue. If something doesn’t go how I pictured it in my head the gloves are off. 

Two recent examples that I just find so silly after calming down …

 1. I dropped a piece of glassware while on FaceTime with my boyfriend, he didn’t ask me if I was ok and I was about ready to never speak to him again and just move on with my life… even though I was clearly okay and didn’t need him to ask that??? 

2. At yoga class another student was breathing so loud and obnoxious I almost walked out of the class and even envisioned myself stopping the whole class to yell at this person or walking out cancelling my membership and never coming back after telling the teacher off. 


I’m just irritated by being irritated because it takes so much energy from me and I don’t like living that way. Does anybody have recommendations on how to cope??

Title: Finding support
Text:
Where I live, OCD is still very much looked at as someone who cleans a lot or a cute quirk because someone is very organized. There is not a lot of support for it. Friday I will start therapy and I am hopeful, but I feel like I would really benefit from meeting (physically or online) people who have similar issues. However, I wouldn't know how to start or where to look.

So I was wondering if there are other people also craving this, if people have found something like this and how, what kind of support systems do you use?

Title: I hate this stupid ilness
Text:
I'm so sick of this shit. I struggle mainly with compulsions, checking behaviour to be more precise

When I add songs to my playlist I need to check it's om the right playlist 2-20 times. Every fucking song, which takes a LOT of time. It needs be checked in the 2 table. Everything needs to feel right, no anxiety (which is basicly impossible), can't be distracted, no shifts in beats, done at the right time. Can't be after middle in the song 

So I got this amazing idea that I tested how it would turn out if I checked ZERO times. I saved A LOT of time. Then I filmed the 20-25 songs, checked if they were on the right playlists. The success rate was 95,8 percent. Perfect. Then I did it again with the next 20-25 songs, 100% successrate. Next 20-25 songs, same result. Next 20-25 songs, 100% again

So I was like "Okay So it basicly makes no difference, beside increased anxiety and using 10 times as much time. I know my ocd is just fucking me up now". But I still can't, and now my new compulsion is just filming me going through 20-25 songs, checking if they're on the right playiists. And I keep thinking about the 95,8% one time. What if it's my favorite song and doesn't come on the right playlists? I hate this So much. The uncertainty is so unplesant

I have overcome so many things. Depression, BED, weed and nicotine addiction. But this is the one thing that seems to stick with me

Text:

when i did f&b i almost dropped a very heavy thing near an  elderly person and i feel i should have been more careful. Its one of the reasons why i dont use the salary i earned even after some months

Title: help - ERP imaginal exposures don’t trigger me
Text:
Hi there, I have been suffering with quite severe harm/real event/false memory OCD particularly surrounding s*xual abuse/assault, this has been ongoing for the past few years and has caused me immense distress in my life, to the point where I stopped socialising with people and could barely leave my bed. I also nearly had to quite my job.

I have been suggested to try doing exposure scripts as a form of ERP, however I find it doesn’t trigger me therefore making the ERP useless. I have tried writing out and imagining my worst fears, but it doesn’t bring up much anxiety. However, I know this topic still triggers me because I will feel severe anxiety when if I triggered at any other random time, but i’m just not able to induce/reproduce that anxiety with ERP

What should I do?

Title: Anyone else here with the “Just Right” subtype of OCD?
Text:
Wasn’t sure what flair to put. But I asked this question a long time ago - like years ago - and never got any responses so I thought I’d try my luck again. Anyone else with “Just Right” OCD? How does it affect your life? Would love to hear about others’ experiences with this subtype. I often feel so alone and misunderstood. 

My OCD is very much compulsion-based as opposed to the more common obsessions-based OCD subtypes. I often feel the urge to do things “just right” as in an almost physical sensation to touch or press or move something until it gives me that “just right” sensation. I feel almost physically unable to pull myself away until the compulsion is complete. It’s extremely annoying because there is no way to reason with a sensation. It’s once taken me over two hours just to plug my phone in “just right”, back when things were extremely bad.

Please tell me I’m not the only one. I’m tired of living this way.

Title: Anyone Else Feel Like They ‘Forget’ What They Already Know? Pure OCD Struggles
Text:
I suffer from Pure OCD, and I often experience this issue where I convince myself that I don’t fully understand certain concepts, even when I do. For example, if someone says, “I was in a toxic relationship” or “My mom has anger issues,” I start feeling anxious, almost like I have to know specific examples to really understand what they mean.

It’s hard to explain — it’s as though my mind insists that I need perfect clarity on what “toxic” or “anger issues” mean, even though I already know. Recently, while reading a book where the author described being beaten by her mother, I felt this intense urge to come up with countless explanations for why her mother might have acted that way.

It’s frustrating because deep down, I know I understand these concepts, but my OCD convinces me otherwise.

Title: Can OCD lead to memory loss
Text: I had a better memory and creative thinking ability when I didn't have OCD. Now I can't even remember what I had for breakfast yesterday.

Title: University and OCD
Text: So I have ADHD and strongly suspect that I have OCD and have suffered from almost every type of OCD I’ve read about. When I was really young it was a lot more severe (washing hands until raw, whispering phrases to myself 5/10/15 times, turning taps off 15 times because I forgot to turn one off ONCE and also sexual orientation OCD). I am considering taking a year out of university because I physically can’t continue in this manner and I feel like I’ve never actually lived my life as I desired without crippling anxiety / obsessive anxiety and depressive symptoms. The ADHD combined with the (suspected) OCD genuinley makes my life a living hell and I keep acting really out of character at university and I can’t deal with intrusive thoughts that either everyone is looking at me and making fun of me, or that I’m going to do something embarrassing and everyone will know, or that everyone hates me etc. It’s literally so dumb sometimes. If I hear people laughing behind me I have to check that I haven’t shit my pants💀💀💀. I literally can’t approach people I’m interested in romantically because of that 1 “flirting vs harrassment” meme and the fact that I’m incredibly insecure makes me ruminate about the possibility of making a woman uncomfortable because my brain tells me I’m not attractive enough. This is kind of the beginning of me actually addressing the OCD and I’d like to know if anyone has any similar experiences with regards to taking time off or spending dedicated time to work on themselves or get help. Thanks!

Title: Psychiatrist doesn't believe OCD is a disorder
Text:
This is what Eastern European soviet trained psychiatry looks like

An old man telling you that OCD isn't actually a disorder, but just a "term" that is used (so I can't even get a diagnosis, which would be quite helpful, at the very least so I can get social benefits, because I have no job, money and am technically homeless!)

You get asked why you do your compulsions even when logically you understand that nothing will happen if you don't do the ritual

I'm in the hospital at the moment and can't switch doctors. Hopefully when I leave I can find normal mental health support, but I fear it will either be the same or too expensive

>!I am even anxious about making this post because what if somehow this post gets back to him (despite him likely not even speaking English nor knowing what Reddit even is) and then becoming offended and sabotaging me, which I understand is beyond ridiculous, but still makes me scared!<

I know deep down the things Ive done really aren’t awful and Im not a bad person for it but I can’t stop thinking I might be. I feel as if Im a cheater and a liar and a bad friend for the most minimal things. I don’t know how to escape the guilt.

Title: Contamination OCD questions
Text:
I'm just curious if anyone else experiences this the way I do. I feel like a common stereotype with OCD is to be really clean, and I'm like that, but not in the way that's often depicted. 

So MY germs are safe. If in some shape or form the "grossness" comes from me it doesn't bother me at all. However, if it comes from anyone else it disturbs me greatly. It's odd bc I didn't really realize I had this issue until I started living with my bf (I definitely had it looking back, just didn't notice it as much). But the thought of using the shower after him, eating off a plate he used, him getting in the bed when he hasn't showered, etc. causes me a lot of upset. However, I can do all that stuff and it's no big deal. 

He gets upset at me sometimes bc like he understands I have OCD and I have to do things a certain way but I do the things that I get mad at him for. So just curious if anyone else is like this?

Title: thank you ocd for these last few years especially
Text:
I'll be jobless and living with parents again soon. So much went wrong. It seems like I never have the ability to accomplish what I want. The hurdles get worse year on year.

I can never make up my mind either. I don't have much to lose personally at this point. The thought of turning my life around tortures me when it comes up. What can I realistically do? Everything is a question of money, which I don't have enough of. Trying to finance myself while I get to where I want - what's that going to take? Years? All the while being humiliated by my mother that I either can't support myself or I've chosen something stupid that she disproves of. It could be even worse, what if her health gets worse and then I'll feel compelled to take care of her. I don't want that kind of life - I don't love anyone enough to force myself to that degree.

I hate where this illness got me, I hate my pathetic existence, and how every time money is involved. Every minute of this is exhausting. Fuck this inability to decide anything because my personality is fucking dismantled at this point. It's time I stopped fooling myself with the notion that I'll have a normal life. No one around has understood or even cared enough to really ask whether I'm acting like a robot because everything feels like a trap and one wrong move puts me under scrutiny. But yes, I hate most of this, and if I grow complacent I'll continue being this in this dark, miserable place. 

I wish I could slow down at points, yes, and actually have relationships, or feel like I matter to someone, but fuck there's always this sense of dread approaching and all the fleeting happiness is artificial. And the peace, much like the temporary peace from compulsions is fake as well.

Title: It feels like I'm destined to suffer
Text:
I had ocd since I was 7 years old. I used to repeadtly read the textbooks from left to right because of the 'itch'. Reading and learning was an absolute torture for me at the time.

I couldn't even enjoy the shows that I was watching because I kept fixating on the little details whether they were good or not, or watching it at a certain angle to 'get the full experience"

I didn't even get to enjoy my childhood to it's fullest because I was frequently bullied by my childhood 'friends'. I hated going to school through 1st grade to 6th. Got made fun of for my looks.

Even then, now. In 9th grade. Though, it's a bit better now. Instead of them bullying me it's the girls this time. I swear I was literally predistined to be in this situation.

They kept saying shit to me like 'ew', and 'hey nicole likes you ahhahaha' and they just laugh like parasites. And, this one time. This girl touched the side of my ear intending to get a reaction out of me. Then, one of her friends said 'hey, he's gonna gonna fall for you hahahah". This isn't accurate but it was similar to this.

This happened recently... When I went near to the girl who touched my ear, she said. "EWWW DONT GET ME NEAR HIM HE SMELLS AWFUL". I literally put on deodorant and perfumed myself 4 times.

Mind you, there was a large crowd and literally everyone heard her. She even fucking shouted my name.

I exercise and spar frequently. I kept showing them frequently that I am capable. And still, they treat me like shit. Like, do I have to beat someone to prove my worth? Also,I can't even focus on what I'm exercising because of the thoughts I have, like. "Am I doing it right?" "I should angle it more" "I should push it in that certain position". And this in turn makes me rest mid set.

Everything just feels so fucked now. I get bullied everyday, teased, not getting taken seriously and I have this shitty ocd making it worse for me.

  
The only time when I'm happy is when I'm at home, and even so I still get these thoughts that plaque my mind which is just a hassle.

Title: Wanting to be in love, but feeling undeserving of it
Text:
Hello everyone! I am not diagnosed with OCD as Ive never reached out for professional help but I have been dealing with symptoms of OCD for as long as I can remember (not to self diagnose). 

I am a hopeless romantic at heart and feel as though I need validation from a relationship, but every time I get remotely close to being in a serious relationship my mind starts telling me that I dont deserve to be in one. I start feeling like a horrible person and that I would have to confess all my past mistakes to my partner so they can fully know who they’re with. 

Sometimes I feel truly unlovable due to past mistakes and my intrusive thoughts, and Im afraid thats been getting in the way of me potentially finding love. I am currently speaking to someone who I really like, and they want to take things to another level with me (Which I really want to do as well), but these thoughts are concerning me and are making me rethink things before moving forward. 

Do you think I should push myself into the relationship and try to ignore these thoughts? 

If you’ve made it this far, I thank you very much!

Title: I don’t know what to do anymore
Text: So I’m 15 and started getting symptoms of this about 2 months ago, before this I was already diagnosed with autism and ADHD and this all kind of started as a one-off thing of me getting a bit too anxious about washing my hands or anxious about getting sick, but then this turned into me overwashing my hands and my mom ended up saying it was just sensory and that it was autism, but this only got worse and now I have to wash my hands 3 times every time I do so and I do it over 20 times every day(I also write down the amount of times I wash my hands) to the point they’ve bled before and I feel completely lost, I feel like I’m being controlled by my own brain and can’t have any autonomy without having a panic attack, I sometimes feel so disconnected and I still have an underlying belief that I’m faking all of this and that none of it is real, but I’m spiralling out of control at this rate and feel like I can’t do anything without something triggering an anxiety attack, I see one missing assignment and it triggers an anxiety attack, I touch one thing without covering my hand with my shirt and I have an anxiety attack, I talk about my symptoms and I have an anxiety attack because what if I’m faking it, I don’t wash my hands right and I have another anxiety attack, and on top of that I feel like nobody in my life is taking any of this seriously and thinks it’s just autism, I really don’t know what to do anymore and I feel so lost at this rate.

Title: compulsive cleaning vent
Text:
Everybody always says how ocd isn’t just needing things to be clean and that’s 100% true but for me that’s actually what my ocd is and i honestly don’t see it a lot. I developed ocd about 4 years ago and it’s just gotten more extreme everyday. Before then i had a super messy room and showered every 2 days (I was 14 and had a pretty absent alcoholic father). Then i just gradually became more and more of a clean person. Especially the past few months it just keeps getting worse. I might sound kind of dramatic but it’s really hard to never truly feel clean. I shower every morning and night the morning takes 45min and night takes 1hour and 15min+. I have to do the same exact routine every time very thoroughly or i don’t feel clean enough. I have to do a bunch of stuff as a part of showering like clean my room and wash my water bottle. I used to wash my hair twice a week now i can’t go more than 2 days even thought it takes 3+hours to wash and dry my curlyish hair. When i get out i have to clean every single surface in my room. clean my vanity, candle warmer, candles, laptop, nightstand, dresser, nightstand drawers, lint roll my bed, even my phone and apple watch and vacuum every single day. When im doing my skincare i have my hair in a tight ponytail and repeatedly brush my hair back with a comb after every step because i cringe at anything getting in my hairline. I wash my sheets/comforter and even curtains every 6-7 days. It takes me an entire day every week just to deep clean my room on top of what i do daily. I can’t ever step on the floor without socks i step out of the shower into my socks. I use a new towel everytime i shower. If i didn’t wash or clean something myself it feels dirty. I have nothing on my walls and no nick nacks or decorations because having anything but a candle looks cluttered to me. Everything in my room is white so i can see if it’s at all dirty. I even clean my scale/treadmill every single thing in my room has to be cleaned with a rag with cleaner then a dry one. Even after that just seeing the little specs left from the rag bothers me. I wash my shoes, i clean my charging cords i scrub my brush and combs every-time i shower. I take every single organizer and the stuff in them out of my nightstand drawer and clean them. And every single thing i do takes me so long. It’s so exhausting having to do all this every day and still not feeling clean. I guess just wondering if anyone has similar experiences and if they stopped having so many conditions to being “clean”.
On top of all this also have other types of ocd, social anxiety, anxiety, major depression, and at this point maybe slight agoraphobia and my ocd isn’t even the worst illness so it all just works against each other.

Title: Somatic OCD making it difficult to read......
Text:
Apologies for posting again—shared something similar recently but didn’t get any responses, so I’m hoping I might get lucky this time. I'm 18 and I’ve developed this intense hyperawareness of my eye movements because of somatic OCD, and it’s driving me up the wall. *It feels like every time I try to move my eyes, it’s a huge struggle, like my mind is frozen and won't let them flow naturally across the page. There’s also this constant subconscious doubt in my mind, making me question if I’m doing it wrong or if something’s off.* Whenever I try to read, I can’t help but notice exactly where my eyes are going and how they’re moving over each word. What used to feel natural has turned into a slow, stressful task that’s completely breaking my focus.

Even just looking at a book feels heavy, like there’s some weird pressure there before I even start reading. I can’t just sit back and flow through the words. I know this is something I shouldn’t have to think about, but I’m stuck in this exhausting loop of trying to control it. It feels like I’m losing a basic ability, and I don’t know how to get it back.

I haven’t told my family about this because they’re not the most supportive, and honestly, I feel guilty even thinking about telling them. I’m just at a loss and don’t know who to turn to. Has anyone else dealt with this kind of hyperawareness? If you’ve found *any* way to make it easier, please, Any advice or shared experiences welcome :)  I feel so stuck.

Thanks for listening.

Title: Heavy drinker here. Only drink because it helps with my ocd and anxiety.
Text: I’m thinking about starting Zoloft and quiting alcohol at the same time. Dealt with so much mental and physical pain and stress feel like I can deal with any withdrawals and side effects from Zoloft if any. What you guys think?

Title: my story. can anyone relate?
Text:
hi all. 
i’m going to try to keep this short and sweet.
my father has had ocd his entire life, so obviously i inherited it. it didn’t affect me much, i mean it did, but not in ways that made normal life hard, until this past january.
it all started when i came down with the flu. i was stuck in bed for a week, my first day back out in the world, i remember feeling “off” in sam’s while shopping. after we finished shopping, we went to eat. at the table, my ears were still feeling full since i just got over the flu, so i stupidly popped them by holding my nose and blowing. i remember the whole restaurant just spinning. i had to lay my head on my bf’s shoulder until it stopped, lasted maybe 30 seconds. nothing like that had happened to me before. fast forward to the next day- i am driving home from starbucks when all of a sudden i get that vertigo sensation again while driving. i had to pull over and have my bf come drive me back home. that was my last “normal” day. ever since then, i have been dealing with crippling anxiety and ocd. it is SO MUCH better than it was in january probably til july, but it’s still here. i went to so many doctors but nobody can find anything wrong. i still think it’s an inner ear issue but im waiting for mri. anyways, my ocd is around food for the most part recently.
i had my phase of br@in tumor and heart @ttack fears but now i am CONVINCED every time i eat something, someone put L$D in it. it can be an unopened packet of something and ill still get this wave of dread wash over me like “oh ok if you can go an our after you eat this and you feel fine then you’re safe”. it is crippling. my brain even starts to make me feel how i think i would feel if that were to happen. it very confusing to some people ive told this to but its my reality rn. i don’t know how to tell my brain that food is safe.

It has been tearing me apart for the past month and I doubt this ever happened it’s just that thought of “what if”. Can someone please help me.

Title: How do i stop reading OCD?
Text: Each time i am reading something I have to read it in another tone in my mind and reread it over and over again when it just doesn't feel right, and i am currently playing a visual novel which makes it a pain for me. Any way to put those thoughts aside quickly even if it's for a short while?

Title: Impulsive buying/selling?
Text:
Does anybody else deal with compulsive/repetitive buying and selling as a part of their OCD? 

For example, I’ve bought and sold probably 20 cars in the last 10 years, all because I think something is wrong or feel like I need to, only to feel like I made a huge financial mistake and try to unwind it by selling it… only to buy something again.

You can replace cars with watches, guitars, clothing, etc. and I seem to have an issue with feeling settled in any large-ish decision. Often times I’ll attempt to “make it right” or undo it, especially if I didn’t get a good deal (or so I tell myself).

Curious if anybody else deals with this as well.

Title: anyone else?
Text: is anyone else unable to enjoy things and/or say you're excited for something because you're scared that you'll jinx it by saying it or even just thinking it? I do it even *during* the activity that I'm excited for, like I won't let myself be 100% happy about it and "in the moment" because I'm scared if I do I'll end up sabotaging it/ruining it and it will end. so I have to wait until it ended to say that I loved it and that I couldn't wait for it to happen etc, but I always end up enjoying it like 50% of how I would have otherwise because I'm too occupied being scared of it going bad because I jinxed it. i hate it so much I can barely enjoy things

Title: How to deal with OCD, ADHD and depression, when realized above 40?
Text:
Hello all, newbie here. 45, male, living in Denmark, born in the UK, married, two small kids. I'd like to ask the community for thoughts and recommendations.

I always considered myself unusual, but not in a good way, as a bit of antisocial and introvert. Strange thoughts and habits with an agitated beehive in my head all the time. I assumed this was normal and learnt to live with - until a few months ago, when I had to see a therapist, as I couldn't take it anymore. There were a series of bad events around me, and I finally crashed.

First, I got diagnosed with a moderate depression. Then digging deeper came a diagnosis of ADHD, afterwards OCD, and last a mild paranoid personality disorder.

For about a decade now I have a massive sleep apnea, well treated with a CPAP machine. I had two years of extreme cloudy brain and irritability while diagnosed. Afterwards came a year of insomnia.

With all this somehow I maintain a relatively normal life, working as a software engineer, having a stable marriage and raising the small ones. All the chaos is well confined inside.

The depression is slowly improving with a high dose of SSRI medication. I got Ritalin for ADHD, which did some magic. I honestly don't notice much, but people around me absolutely do. I became more tolerable and enjoyable as a person. They remind me if I miss a dose. I don’t know how my wife has been able to go through all this, we love each other.

I feel that the OCD (and somewhat the paranoid disorder) is the most debilitating. It can explain why I am so bad in relationships, why I don't have friends, why I always get distracted and engaged in useless activities, etc. Everything needs to be arranged around me in a set baseline and everybody needs to be precisely on time. Sharp focus or creative work are a fantasy. Often I try to keep my brain busy (like following through chains of thought) just not to be exposed to the brain noise. 

Worst of all is that I lost motivation generally in life, about a decade ago. It has put my career in decline, diminished personal life goals, lack of hobbies and so on. I just can't get myself to go to the gym to work out, even though it would be essential.

Understanding all this, I ask the community for ideas – how to deal with this situation, the thoughts, and obsessions. Am I too old to change? to relearn motivation, have a clear head, to build friendships?

Thank you all.

Title: I feel like I'm going to have a stroke.
Text:
Posting this here because I don't know where else to go.

I've been trying to get medicated for adhd, only to discover a stipulation that I should get an EKG if I have a heart condition. Now, I don't have any known "issues" with my heart, but my heart does have a tendency to beat harder and deeper in my chest from time to time. I, like an idiot, looked up "irregular heartbeat types". Found atleast 3 conditions with "linked to stroke" in them. 

Now, I don't think I'm at risk because I don't actually have any of the symptoms listed, or atleast they're never going on at the same time, but I'm still shaken. Not only am I afraid that I'll not be able to get medicated, now I'm scared that I'll just drop dead at any point. 

I don't know what to do.

Title: Fear of Commiting Sexual Assailt
Text:
I was sitting down recently and obsessing over what scenarios are sexual assault and which aren't, and a scenario where two people are in a relationship and in a bed together without clothes, and one gets on top of the other, who isn't showing any facial expressions, and then starts having sex with them showed up in my mind. And I was thinking over that, and at one point I was doubtful that it was sexual assault, assuming that the person on the bottom wasn't upset or reluctant and was just non expressive. 

And then I had a thought that was like "even if it is sexual assault, then that wouldn't disprove your belief in women's rights, it wouldn't mean women are creepier than men on average". The context to this is that my ocd makes me afraid that I will deny something is sexual assault if I believe that it being sexual assault will make the rate of perpetration between men and women equal, so that my philosophy (feminism and the idea of female disadvantage in society ) isn't threatened. So the thought I listed above was sort of a test. It was to see if my opinion on whether or not the above scenario is sexual assault would change if I believed it being sexual assault wouldn't threaten my worldview. 

But then I thought it would be sexual assault, so my view did change, so I "failed" the test. So now my ocd is saying I'm a potential rapist, because I'd deny something is sexual assault if it doesn't fit my worldview. For the record I'm not even at a point where this scenario would occur as I'm young and have never been in a relationship, but I'm afraid of being in a relationship and being a perpetrator.


How do I deal with these rumination spirals? They feel real

I also have realized that around full moons, my period, and lack of sleep which is all currently happening. A full moon happens soon and also my period comes soon so it s absolutely through the roof. I just need advice on ways to remind myself that these are just thoughts and they won’t happen.

Title: moral ocd has me spiraling.

Title: I think I realized where it originated
Text: I think I figured it out. One half is my mom who always wanted me to double check everything (closed windows, locked door etc). On the other hand…my dad was my ultimate goal when it came to personality. He was always nice to everyone and always ready to help (don’t get me wrong: he wasn’t overall perfect. He didn’t take care of his health at all for example). After he died (when i was 13) I wanted to be like him personality vise. He seemed like such a great person character vise. That’s why I’m so scared and paranoid to hurt people accidentally (physically or emotionally). That’s also why I’m scared to damage things (like accidentally (without realizing) scratch a car or other things). That’s why I spiral down in these overthinking nightmares. It doesn’t make it easier but it feels like I made a step in the right direction. I guess I’m scared he would be disappointed/ hate me. I’m 23 and it’s still so important to me

Title: Does anyone else do this?
Text:
To preface I want to say I'm in a very happy, healthy marriage. My husband is incredibly supporting and understanding of my OCD.  Okay, getting in with it – I will very rarely get INTENSE celebrity crushes, because of that, it makes my ROCD spiral, and I am dumb enough to give in. 

Here's how the whole process goes — I will make myself imagine that celebrity with someone else — get vauge feelings of jealousy — feel like an AWFUL wife because of this 

I know eventually my crushes on these people lessen, I know they're real people and I'm only seeing what's on the surface, but God the guilt I feel after MAKING myself imagine these scenarios kills me but I can't stop. Does anyone struggle with anything remotely similar?

Title: Blaming random things on my failure
Text:
Anyone else? In school I would use the same pencil for the entire year, because I thought if I used a different pencil, I would fail. I also stopped watching a show I really liked after 7th grade, because that year I failed a few classes. And I thought somehow the show was the cause of my failure. I wore the same nail polish, and refused to do my makeup different, because I thought changing any of these would cause me to fail.

Now I’m in the workforce and have received treatment for ocd. It is nowhere as bad but I still do it with some things. There were a few months where I wrote a book before going to work. After finishing the book I decided I would never do that again, because I got yelled at during work a lot during that time, and now I think that writing before work will cause me to underperform. 

To be fair, that was during the holidays, the busiest and most hectic time for a salon. But my ocd finds comfort in blaming random things for my failure, if my failure is out of control and I tried my absolute hardest. Because I need an explanation for everything. Being what I consider as a “failure” is impossible to me in my eyes, so maybe it was because of the nail polish I wore, since I can’t figure out any other reason.

Title: Lines of OCD: A Global Art Collaboration to Make the Invisible Visible
Text:
Hi everyone!

I'm a Dutch art student with OCD, and I'm working on a part of my graduation project that aims to make the invisible struggles of OCD visible in a deeply personal way. I’d love for you, people all around the world, to help me show what OCD feels like, using a simple line on a blank page.

**Here's how you can participate:**

1. Grab a small white piece of paper (preferably about A4 size) and a (black) marker.
2. Draw an abstract line that expresses what OCD feels like *for you*. There’s no right or wrong way – let it come naturally.
3. Take a photo of your drawing.
4. If you feel comfortable, sign your initials in the bottom right corner.
5. Send me the photo in a private message (since sending an image is not allowed here).

I’ll be collecting your line-art, removing the backgrounds digitally, and arranging them into an ever expanding grid to create a collaborative artwork. The goal is to visually express our personal, often hidden experiences with OCD.

Thank you so much for considering participating and the effort! Let’s turn our experiences into something visible and impactful. I will be posting the result in early spring, as I try to collect as many line-art as I can.  
Primarily this project is aimed to be digital, but in case it will end up being a physical experience in any way, of course I will share these results with you too :). Feel free to ask any questions down below or privately. Thanks again everybody that feels resonance to join, (my OCD ironically made it difficult to post here, but here we finally are, haha).

View the examples I made here for reference:  
[https://imgur.com/a/T0kedfW](https://imgur.com/a/T0kedfW)

last year I confessed to a friend and they told me that its not as bad as I think it is. I had felt validated and comforted and somewhat forgot about the whole situation up until a week ago. Title: I’ve become so depressed I believe I never had ocd and I convinced I am a monster
Text: Hi all. I am a 26 year old man who has been diagnosed with OCD and MDD as well as GAD. My first bad bout with OCD was when I a small child (shoes being tied evenly and head shaking). My fear of germs got so severe that I was washing my hands 100 times a day if not more. My mom threatened with taking me to the doctor for it and that scared me so badly i was able to get rid of the OCD at the time. Fast forward a decade and I thought I was cured (lol) so I got a job servicing porta potties not thinking about it. That resparked hypochondriasis within me that eventually led to contamination and all that good stuff. That went on for 3 or 4 years (started seeing a therapist around two years into it) but was never able to make progress. I eventually developed intrusive thoughts (sexual) regarding underage people. Those thoughts scared me so badly I finally talked to my therapist and convinced myself to get on medication  (Prozac). Took a few attempts to find Prozac but it helped. Prozac began helping and thought I was out free. So I started smoking weed again. I also struggle with addiction issues (weed) and use it to cope and forget about my problems. The following year or so was amazing. I was able to live and enjoy life while smoking weed, which I never thought I'd be able to do. But at some point, I began experiencing what I believe to be serotonin syndrome, so my dumbass thought it was a good idea to continue the weed and discontinue Prozac.  The next 8 months or so I unknowingly fell down into a deep depression, and my ocd symptoms essentially completely disappeared. I also stopped smoking weed again. Eventually, the depression got bad enough that I began trying to find natural supplements to help me get out of this depression. I tried Lions mane mushrooms, which caused my intrusive thoughts to return, so I stopped. I also tried microdosing shrooms to see if that would help, and it just caused my intrusive thoughts to return as well. At that point,  I had enough, so I went to my doc (GP, not a psych) and restarted Prozac. I was on 40mg first time around, but restarted with 10mg in hopes it would  be all I needed. I made it three weeks with Prozac until I was anxious enough that I thought I should stop (no intrusive thoughts, however) just a lot of anxiety from a big issue I was dealing with from work at the time, which I feel may have been the reason there were no intrusive thoughts, but I may be overthinking. So I also stopped Prozac. Then I tried sertaline at 50mg. By day 4, my hypochondriasis was popping up and I had the worst intrusive thoughts I could've imagined that night. So I stopped that as well. But by this point, I had convinced myself that it's no longer my OCD/anxiety and that I am actually this monster my brain is telling me I am. So I began drinking alcohol every night to feel some semblance of peace, but used weed to get away from alcohol because alcoholism runs in my family. I just recently quit weed once again, probably for the 30 time at this point in my life. I restarted going to therapy but I absolutely cannot shake this deep feeling in my core of me being a monster. I can't get the intrusive thoughts under control and I feel like an utter failure in every aspect of my life, and I feel like I am not worthy of anyone's help. Don't hangout with friends like I used to or do hobbies I used to enjoy. I don't know what to do at this point. Even talking to my therapist about my problems just makes me seem like worse of a person to myself. Suicidal ideation has come and gone, but I'm so convinced that there is no hope and I am this monster my brain makes me out to be. I don't know if I'm venting or asking for help, but I appreciate anyone who took the time to read through this shit show.

Title: Tips for stopping rumination?
Text:
Does anyone have any tips or recommendations to help stop ruminating? Ruminating is my worse compulsion and it is extremly hard to stop even though ruminating is like throwing gas onto an already giant fire. Ruminating always leads to worsening anxiety and sometimes leads to panic attacks.

So far I try to squeeze my hands as hard as I can and that can help disrupt the ruminating because it hurts. Another thing I have been working on is meditating "leaves on a stream" to also help putting ruminating off.

If I stay busy and work on a physical task that helps the most, however I can't just tinker and build stuff to take my attention away all the time. However I was thinking of getting one of those fidget toys to see if that would help.

Any thoughts, tips, or recomendations?

Title: Feeling inadequate with my OCD
Text:
Just a vent.

I always read here that people have thoughts 24/7 and they don’t get a moment away from their thoughts, and I compare that with myself and feel awful. I get intrusive thoughts quite often, but it’s never 24/7. I feel like I’m faking it or don’t have it as bad as others. Some may say I’m lucky, but I don’t feel lucky. My pain feels invalidated by other’s pain, as if I want to feel even worse than I do. 

Feels like I don’t deserve to kill myself because it’s not even that bad compared to someone else. I know this is irrational, it all is, but the inadequacies I feel are driving me insane. In my head, if I’m going to have a shit life, I want it to be the worst kind of shit it can possibly be. I can’t stand having someone having more pain than me, and that ego annoys me. 

I’m just tired and feel like I deserve more pain.

Title: A guy is breadcrumbing me and it's triggering me like crazy
Text:
So I have OCD and I've been able to kind of manage it with 5 HTP. I haven't been in therapy in a while.

A guy I slept with started to breadcrumb me afterwards so I can't actually move on. I keep feeling like something is missing, something is not complete, and I'm trying to fix it over and over again. Keep playing things over in my head. I check my phone like a thousand times a day seeing if he sent a message. I know being breaadcrumbed is hard but it's even harder when you have OCD. I wish I'd shut the door on him when he first breadcrumbed me but now I feel like I. MUST. HAVE. HIM.

Any advice would be much, much appreciated. I don't like online therapy and I will be at a very reclusive place for a while so therapy is unfortunately out of the question, although I'm aware that I desperately need it.

Title: Intrusive thoughts from the past
Text:
I've noticed that I've been having intrusive thoughts about people from my past. Last year I had a lot of thoughts and even had false memories and went crazy for days, months. My psychiatrist prescribed risperidone, but I was taking Revoc and Depakene. After about four months, the medication wasn't doing me any good and I had to stop. The thoughts came back stronger two weeks ago when I was at a pizza place with my boyfriend and I saw a guy I'd talked to about four years ago and who lost me on the first date (thank God because later I realized he was a jerk and not a good fit for me). Lots of thoughts like: "You think he's cute," terrifying images and intrusive thoughts about other people I've talked to. I feel like if I don't tell my boyfriend these thoughts, I'm automatically cheating on him, that I'm a traitor and everything bad. On Sunday, this damn human being sent me a message apologizing for being a jerk and I immediately blocked him, not only for what he said to me, but for being a bad person and for being terrified of people like him. Now, intrusive thoughts come to me that I liked receiving the message (far from it, I know I didn't like it, I want to distance myself from people who hurt me), and the guilt for these thoughts keeps coming up and with intrusive memories, that I never want to remember again, remembering things like: insecurities, memories of the messages on my cell phone, the bad feelings I had and the harm he did to me at the time. I'm feeling like a cheating girlfriend, but I never felt anything for him, just neediness and I'm in the loop now of convincing the thoughts....

Translated with [DeepL.com](http://DeepL.com) (free version)

Title: Relationship OCD got so bad after breakup
Text:
I (20M) was with my now ex (20F) for a year and a half. It was a really intese relationship (also my first real relationship) with a lot of ups and downs, but i really loved her. During the time we were together i struggled a lot with retroactive jealousy OCD and obsessions that were centered around her in general, which often prevented me from being at peace in the relationship.

I initiated the breakup because i felt like i needed a break and i wanted to explore more. After a month (during which we both saw someone else) i changed my mind and realised i wanted to be with her. We met again a few times and she made me think we were on the same page and we would get back together (she said she loved me, missed me, invited me to sleep over, said she wanted to try again), just to later reject me  by text in the most heartbreaking way possible. It hurt me so much.

It's been three weeks no contact and i feel like i'm going insane. The way the breakup happened and the fact that she's dating someone else now (the one she saw during our break) are killing me. Every obsession i had during the relationship is now back stronger and i can't even process anything properly because of this. I get constant intrusive thoughts about what went wrong and why, what we could have been, wether we will get back together (and wether i would actually want it or not), wether she was "the one", her and her new bf. One of my main themes is sex, i wonder if i will ever find someone with whom sex is as great, and the intrusive thoughts about her having sex with her new bf are a different kind of pain.

I spent the whole relationship worrying about her past and now i keep worrying about what she does after the relationship. And i keep overanalyzing everything without getting anywhere, just like usual with OCD. I'm so tired and i just want this obsession to stop. I can't function right now, i spend my whole days ruminating and crying. I also miss her so much in every aspect and i still can't accept that the breakup happened, even tho i wouldn't want to get back with her after how she treated me and how she didn't give a shit about it.

I wrote this post mostly because i needed to vent. I'm in therapy already and i have talked about this with my therapist but i felt like i needed to write everything down. Any advice / support is really appreciated :))

Title: Advice on immense guilt from being sick
Text:
Hi everyone, this sub has helped me so much and I’m reaching out to see if anyone feels the same way or has any advice.

Whenever I call in sick, I feel an immense amount of guilt. To the point where I usually just go to work or school while not feeling 100% and then it takes longer to recover. If I do something productive like go to school/work while sick, after the task is done I feel like I can finally let myself rest. When I’m sick on my days off I feel so relieved that I don’t have to tell my work. 

I have recently learned about hyper responsibility as a theme in OCD which honestly makes a whole lot of sense because I thought I was just an intense perfectionist. I feel like I need to be perfect all the time, especially at school (I am in my last year of my bachelors). If I make a typo in an assignment I will agonize over it, or if I feel like I have done something to annoy my professor I literally will stress so hard I cry. It is so so hard for me to rest when I don’t feel like I “earned it”.

I have been sick a lot this semester (probably because I once again cannot let myself rest) and I have had to call in sick to work in hopes of getting better for a presentation I was supposed to have today. I woke up feeling absolutley awful and emailed to let my prof know and she was very understanding about it but I cannot shake the feeling of immense guilt. I was supposed to do my presentation earlier in the semester but my prof has been sick the last few weeks and I’ve had to move it around a few times (which has absolutely done numbers on my responsibility OCD). 

I’m just wondering if anyone else with this theme of OCD can relate. My friends tell me it’s okay to rest and take time when you’re feeling sick but they don’t get how that sounds like a foreign concept to me. It literally just does not work in my brain. 

OCD has been the most difficult thing I’ve ever had to deal with (I’ve been to therapy for my harm OCD which has definitely helped), and any advice would be appreciated. Or if you’ve experienced this it would just be great to feel less alone in this. TIA :)

Title: What are some OCD signs you displayed as a child?
Text:
I’ll go first:
• Graphic intrusive images while I was eating or before bed 

• Intrusive thoughts regarding my classmates / friends (imagining myself randomly kissing them, imagining them naked and feeling extremely disgusted and worried by my own thoughts)

• Worrying about people being able to read my thoughts in class and seeking reassurance by thinking “cough if you can hear my thoughts” and then being paranoid about people not coughing on purpose so that they could continue to read my thoughts and then panicking about them reading my intrusive thoughts and desperately trying to think of “innocent” stuff such as candy and puppies

• Collecting empty fountain pen fillings in my pencil case at school and refusing to throw them away

• Obsessive rumination around a guy I crushed on for 6 years in elementary school, literally feeling consumed by my obsession with him and not being able to think about anyone else

• An extreme fear of a natural disaster happening, to the point of crying 

• Excessive and extreme worrying around my stomach growling in class and forcing myself to drink 1L of water during every break

• Following a very specific routine before school 

• Throwing tantrums and feeling extremely anxious when said routines were disrupted 

• Repeating sentences and words continuously in my head for days / hearing a sentence from a song or a TV program and having my brain repeat that in my head for days and not being able to make it stop 

• Prayers getting disrupted by hearing profanity in my head and thinking my prayer was invalid and having to do it again 

Some of these I still struggle with as an adult, but nowadays my OCD revolves around other stuff

Title: Venting/Need Advice
Text:
First time posting on Reddit, hello!! I don’t personally know anyone else with the disorder so it’s hard to find commonality in my personal life or anyone to relate to, so I thought I’d post here. Apologies if this is the wrong place to post something like this, I’m going through a lot so it’s kind of just word vomit. For years I’ve had suspicions that I have OCD and after seeing a therapist for about a year, I was diagnosed a couple months ago. I had originally started seeing her because I unfortunately suffered the loss of a parent a few years ago and finally decided to go. I was doing well in therapy but I had started EMDR this past summer which exacerbated my symptoms and made everything worse. There are a lot of beliefs I have about myself and the world around me that limit me greatly, but I could never figure out where they came from so that’s why we started that treatment. I can only afford to see my therapist every two weeks so not much work was getting done and I just consistently felt like I was on the verge of a breakdown as we were basically working on what seemed like an open wound in my brain. 
Now, it seems like things are only getting worse. A trigger can send me into a hermit state for weeks and I’ve been told I need to go back on medication (I was previously medicated as a teenager after being diagnosed with depression but after losing my parent I lost health insurance which forced me to stop) or I could be hospitalized. Being faced with this makes me feel even crazier than I normally do. I am still functioning the best I can, I maintain hygiene and work full time. I’m trying really hard to not be an asshole to myself. I used to be very active and have hobbies, I would create art and be able to clean and do things so easily, but somehow in the past six months it’s become impossible to do anything besides what I require of myself. I am exhausted. I have my appointment to see about medication near the end of the month and I’m really really hoping that it goes well, and that my shitty insurance will at least cover the prescription. It doesn’t help that multiple generations of my family are mentally ill too but only believe it’s due to an absence of prayer. It feels very lonely. I’m 23 and I feel like I’ve lived my entire life already, I just want to be able to experience what life actually is instead of going about my weeks sticking to my rigid routines I’ve made like some kind of robot. There are a lot of other things that took place in my life as a teenager before the loss I suffered that definitely contribute to problems I have now, and I actually significantly cut this post down, but this is already a novel and I don’t want to subject anyone to more or break any rules here. Again it is my first time posting anything on here and I apologize if it’s a lot, but I greatly appreciate anyone who takes the time to read it. Any advice on how you guys are able to calm yourself down in any way, and especially any motivating factors would be so, so appreciated. 

TL;DR OCD has become debilitating and need advice on how to maintain things while awaiting medication

Title: Anyone else got worse OCD from taking SSRI?
Text:
Some while ago I took 50mg Sertraline because of OCD. Not much, the recommended dose with OCD is 200mg as far as I know. However I noticed my OCD got worse instantly after taking it for 2 reasons: 1. I had constant racing thoughts, I felt like I had taken speed 2. I had less anxiety. Previously, I have learned that my compulsions are bad, so I got anxious about doing them which has saved my life a few times already regarding e.g. having money. But then, without anxiety, I had no fear of doing the compulsions anymore, it felt really, really strange. One of my favourite compulsion is buying things and returning them. So, what I did when I took Sertraline is buying dozens of things, as if I was manic, and returning so many things after realizing what I have done. So the compulsion only got amplified, not reduced.

This did not seem helpful. I have learned that anxiety is a valid emotion to feel, and when you not only feel anxious about not doing a compulsion, but also about \*doing\* a compulsion, to me, this is better than doing the compulsion because of a state of having no fear. I can see reasons for why Sertraline didn't work in my case. My OCD isn't fear based, it is under-stimulation based. So all Sertraline achieved was not feeling anxious about the consequences, but it didn't address the under-stimulation part. I can see Sertraline working when the OCD has its roots in anxiety, because it did work! Sertraline reduced my anxiety, I loved talking to people without anxiety, I had no social anxiety anymore! But the racing thoughts when I was alone, plus no fear of my compulsions anymore, which made the entire concept of \*resisting\* the obsessions futile, was enough for me having to stop taking Sertraline.

Did anyone have any similar experience regarding SSRI and OCD where SSRI kind of made the compulsions worse, because you did not feel fear anymore regarding the consequences of your compulsions?

After a lot of work, for the last month or so I have greatly reduced my compulsions. I'm sleeping much better now and I'm being much more productive during the day.

However, I now seem to exist in a constant state of general anxiety. Not an unbearable one, but I can feel anxious nonetheless. This is also having physical manifestations such as occasional nose twitching.

Is this normal? Maybe the path is OCD > Anxiety > Freedom?

Title: Parent with pre-teen suffering from OCD
Text:
My son started exhibiting contamination OCD related symptoms at the beginning of this school year.  We believe that his generalized anxiety and the angst of moving to a new school (and middle school) bubbled up into what can best be described as "contamination" avoidance.

We've been seeing a therapist and we have made progress but it seems we're plateauing.   There's no crises at school and he has found a way to make it through the day, but I know he's just creating habits and living/hiding it.

They set goals every week, but my son seems to forget or ignore them.  (He's ADHD, slightly on the spectrum, very smart, and very stubborn).

From my perspective, the only time he seems to put forth any effort is if we're there to encourage him to fight, or show our disappointment when he doesn't.

When he's challenged at school, he'll immediately give in and wash his hands or the article that is tainted or touched by others.   He'll get a wipe to wipe off his backpack, hair, paper, whatever.    When we talk about it, he apologizes and says "I need to do better.  I will do better".

And then doesn't.   The next day is pretty much the same.  "Good days" happen when he's not challenged (i.e. nobody touches his stuff).  "Bad days" are when something happens and he gives in immediately.

We've tried "just wait 5 minutes" or "only wash your hands between classes" but he doesn't seem to do that.   Without us there, he immediately soothes.  We've tried starting small, but he "forgets" or finds another reason.   Even when talking about it afterwards, we can't get him to agree that he's being irrational and that there's nothing there to cause the issue.   

The only time I feel I've seen progress is when we have a meltdown at home over something and he gets forced into confronting the discomfort without relief until he calms down.    After that, he generally seems to be able to tolerate whatever was intolerable before.   

I'm about to reach the end of my rope on supporting him per the therapist and doing what I've been told is unhelpful:  forcing the issue when I can control his environment and behavior.  I'm at the point where I'm going to create exposure sessions and not give a choice about response until he's able to calm himself down.

Talk me out of, or into my plan.    Or provide another one.  Or provide your perspective.

Because otherwise, I'm about ready to give up and let him navigate it on his own and let him live with his choices.  I know that's a shit plan as a parent, but I'm just getting tired of burning money and watching him do nothing but set his future self up for failure.

Title: big win :) Food!
Text: so I have "Just Right" OcD and my partner and I were at Longhorn for lunch yesterday. I picked up a cut of bread and put butter on. but it wasn't just right to me. instead of panicking and putting more butter on, I made myself fight the compulsion and eat the bread anyways :) I had put the right amount of butter on but the bread was so warm it melted and looked incomplete. This is the first time I've managed to not do a compulsion :) the first few bites tasted like ash (response to the trigger) but after that it was amazing!

Title: Rumination over upcoming medical procedure
Text:
Hello, 

If anyone has any advice of words to offer, please have away at it. 

I'm not 100% sure if I have OCD, but a lot of my symptoms line up, and I've been diagnosed before with it, but I have also been diagnosed with other anxiety disorders too. What I find most is that I get stuck ruminating/looping/checking things/diving into internet searches/intrusive thoughts/fear... all that. I'm hoping people here can relate more than on another sub... 

I have an upcoming medical procedure. It's considered "routine" however this will be my first time doing it, as I have avoided it for many years because of discomfort for a variety of reasons. 

Right now, my mind is stuck on the procedure, and how there is a possibility of bad pain. This procedure has mixed reviews. Lots of people seem to get through it fine, no pain, only discomfort. But, lots of other online reviews have said it is horrible and excruciating, so it seems like it is a 50/50 chance of whether it will be agony or okay. And with those odds...I'm freaking out. I don't like those odds. I don't like gambling at all. I NEED to be prepared this, but I don't know how I can be. 

I've read all the stories, read all the articles, read the recommendations and do's and dont's, talked with the doctors, talked with a few people I know, talked with my therapist, and I still feel so fucking terrified... 

I know the anxiety will probably make the potential pain and potential for a worse outcome WAY more likely, but I sincerely do not know how to calm my mind right now. I'm in tears over this upcoming appointment every day leading up to it. It's torture. I hate waiting and uncertainty. What's even worse, is that after THIS exam, I MAY have to have another one which is considered WAY more painful and invasive...but I don't even know if I can get through the first step... 

My symptoms and anxieties and everything have been flaring up SO badly in the weeks leading up to this appointment. I haven't had a flare up this bad in a few years...so I feel like I've forgotten how to control the despair and fears of uncertainty... 

But the thing is...this isn't some scary thing that MIGHT or MIGHT NOT happen. This is a scary thing that IS DEFINITELY HAPPENING and is SCHEDULED already. I am going to it SOON and have to endure whatever happens unless I get up and walk out. Which I may do anyway. 

Please if anyone has tips for how to get a grip on this, send any tips my way...dm if you want... I'm open to ideas. I'm struggling. I can barely work, eat, bathe... Every day at work I find myself losing hour after hour to endless researching things about this medical procedure... I just feel like I NEED to be prepared the best way I can... And I don't know how to do that other than reading people's experiences...and those experiences are not helping my anxiety at all... I don't know what to do. 

I really want this procedure done with so I can move on to have a surgery I need, but... I just don't know if I can do it. I'm so scared... I will be loading up on anti-anxiety pills before hand, but...even then... I just don't know. I'm so miserable right now. Every day is spent thinking and ruminating about this...over and over and over... and over... and over... 

I can see all the ways it would go terribly. However, I can also see some ways it would go decently. I'm just afraid of letting myself consider that good possibility because if it DOES go badly, I will be that much less prepared, having gotten my hopes up for better. I think if I prepare myself as much as possible for any potential pain, I will do better... But that also makes me more apprehensive and scared in other ways. 

I don't know. I feel like I'm relapsing into how I was a few years ago, when my mental health was very, very bad. I don't want to fall back to that state, but it feels like I'm on the verge of it happening...

How does anyone else manage their increasingly distressing symptoms when faced with an upcoming (likely) painful (also uncomfortable due to the nature of exam) medical procedure? 

  
TLRD: Upcoming Dr. appointment. Chance of bad pain during it/also it will be uncomfortable in general as I have to be undressed. Anxiety at a high, not sure how to help. Ruminating daily all day every day, disrupting my life. How do you handle these symptoms with upcoming scary medical procedures? 

Thanks...

Title: Does anyone else feel undeserving of gifts?
Text:
I feel so unworthy of presents.

It’s really hard for me to accept a gift because my OCD makes me feel like I don’t deserve anything good. 

I appreciate the thought behind them so much, but I end up feeling guilty and unworthy because of my intrusive thoughts/feelings/impulses and compulsions. 

It’s something I’ve struggled with my whole life.

Title: What do I do???
Text:
My husband's depression is a trigger and on his low days I spiral so bad. I'll think he's leaving me, he's gonna hurt himself, I'll think we're doomed, and I can't help but cry and feel heavy. 

I'll feel convinced of so many lies. And then i can't stop ruminating.

Last night he called me out on it and im convinced even more he hates me. I'm convinced even more he wants to leave me. I saw a horoscope for my sign and it said "be ready for an unexpected loss in dating and creativity" now im even more convinced he's leaving. 

How do I stop this how do I fix this? He's right and I need to do something. I'm medicated but when he's low my brain goes absolutely batshit.

Title: Managing hormonal based spikes in symptoms without birth control?
Text: I'm very early into my experience with actually trying to manage my OCD, and have noticed that my most symptomatic weeks are related to being luteal, but I have other medical issues that make me uncomfortable turning to hormonal birth control as a way to try and minimize the impact my cycle can have on my ocd. Is this something anyone else deals with and has alternatives for? I spend so much time dreading that week or two and obsessing over "getting bad again" and I'm almost certain it's a self fulfilling prophecy

Title: I can't do certain things because they are "so likely to happen"
Text:
A mention - The title has a mistake. The actual title was meant to be - "because they are NOT so likely to happen" 

Hello! I've been diagnosed with OCD. My OCD causes me to overthink of "the butterfly effect". It tells how small thing could lead to a huge catastrophy. Here's an example of a Situation I have had: I accidentally misspelled a word. The word started wandering in my head. Because I was thinking about the word that I had ACCIDENTALLY misspelled/typoed, I fell on the ground since I wasn't paying enough attention to the road I was walking on. --> I got a wound on my skin. I knew I'd need to put a plaster on it, but I thought "no, I can't put." because, --> If I hadn't accidentally misspelled the word ---> I wouldn't have been paying less attention to my surroundings ---> So I probably wouldn't have fallen, you got it. There'd also be other examples but I'mma not make this too long. And I guess this is a combination of overthinking and OCD and Magical thinking and ruminating, but doesn't have a more specific name. Interesting enough. But how could I cope with this type of overthinking? What do you guys think? Thank you in advance! (I hope this message has no typos so my overthinking brain wouldn't have to think about it all the time)

Title: Impulses
Text:
I work in a school and I sit in a staff room with 20+ professionals. I live in fear every lunch break that I will shout something inappropriate out or somehow my phone will announce something bad… anyone else??

Living like this is exhausting

Title: Would you be weirded out by this? (TW: self harm)
Text:
I try not to talk about SH on Reddit but I am really worried about this thing.

I have dermatillomania so I was using a knife to pick at my nails. (Ik this is weird I just hate the feeling of dirt.). I only did it twice there was no blood and nothing on the knife. I brought it downstairs to clean it in case there was dead skin. I needed to use it to cut my meds. I cleaned it in the kitchen. But then on the way back up I saw an acquaintance who seemed weirded out by me for some reason. I then realized I had a knife in my hands. *Just* a knife and I can’t remember if it was facing inwards or outwards but then I realized she could have assumed I was going to hurt someone or myself. She knows I live there and was going to the floor my dorm is on so I don’t know if she assumed I was going to kill someone or was just a crazy murderer. Either way no police ever came so I am very privileged for that. I am just worried I should knock on her door and apologize or something.

Edit: I am going to get a pill cutter tmrw and throw the knife away or safely dispose of it 🥲

Title: Confusion/fear about groinal responses (POCD)
Text:
I’ve been dealing with the groinal responses for a few months but they still freak me out sometimes. The thing that currently is making me scared was how I had gotten intense groinal responses from intrusive thoughts (like tingles in my pelvic region and even down my leg and up near my chest) and then moments later I had regular (like non POCD sexual images) appear in my head of my girlfriend and I felt something kind of similar

I got scared from this because I felt that since the feelings between the two situations were similar that means I truly do enjoy both in the same way (meaning I would have also enjoyed the POCD thoughts).

Title: Is there light at the end of the tunnel regarding medication?
Text:
I am desperate, Ive been putting it off for so long because Ive been utterly hopeless. Its bittersweet as Ive made the most success cutting off addictions, mainly maladaptive daydreaming which was something I heavily struggled (im talking hours a day daydreaming) for most of my life, years spent in a fictional world. I finally fully managed to stop it and its been that way for months. I also managed to fully cut out doomscrolling and social media, I managed to stop eating nothing but sugary junk food. All without therapy and medication. So its not like I feel incapable, yet my anxiety is next to near impossible to fucking live with.

It is crippling and I dont know what to do. There is nothing that I can say to make it soubnd as severe as it feels. I have no friends, I live in isolation. I go to work, I come home. I might go to the gym if I push myself to. I sit in one spot and if Im not sitting in one spot Im pacing around, I sit in one spot because I cant move otherwise. I do things over and over and over again. I listen to the same music, eat the same food, the same youtube videos, the same everything. Again, I cannot put into words to tell you how bad it is. I feel like nothing I say is enough to relay how much hell this is for me. I take little enjoyment from it. I find other stuff I like to do but I never do it for whatever reason, the anxiety is too bad.

I am not a depressed person. The irony is that all my life Ive been prescribed anti depressants, anti psychotics, and mood stabilizers all of which never worked- and all of which were times during my life I was facing extreme stress from external factors that despite knowing about they never tried to help with. Once I removed most of those stressors, I am a normal person with a stable mood and no depression. But my anxiety kills me. It causes depression, it causes all my problems. I want to die. Its never ending torment, me being hyperaware of literally everything- the worse being the existential dread that refuses to go away. Over and over and over AND OVER AND OVER again, the same shit. I try to make a goal where I would do one thing outside my comfort zone daily, something as small as listening to a new song or taking a walk, but its too overwhelming. All I do is sit here, sometimes im not even doing anything Im simply sitting here ruminating on things too paralyzed to move. It makes trying to go to work hell or do anything hell because when I move any part of my body the anxiety feels like Im being held at gun point.

Im worried medication is too good to be true, Im worried that they wont even prescribe me medication for anxiety because for whatever fucking reason they never prescribed me it in the past as a minor even though they gave me an OCD diagnosis. They gave me an OCD diagnosis yet never treated me for it ort told me about it.

I cant take it man. Ive broke down so many times because of it, at one point I had to go to Urgent Care while at work because it was so bad- only to find out the people at Urgent Care cant prescribe medication, and that I should go to the ER. I felt like crying at the time, I felt like screaming. I never went to the ER because simply being out there was too much for me and I couldnt imagine waiting there for potentially 3 hours. Whats worse is that a lot of my OCD, a lot of it I have no awareness thats its OCD-related until after the episode is over. It is horrible, I cant believe theres people out there that get cured of OCD entirely, Ive struggled with this all my life without help and it baffles me how much pain and suffering Ive been in since I was a little kid caught up in repetitive loops feeling helpless and destroyed with no one to care or try to help me and not knowing what was going on other than feeling broken. Years and experiences I lost out on due to abuse and trauma, sure, but mainly due to OCD because of how I reacted to it all.

I need help so badly. I feel so fucking hopeless. I end up overeating on food and I feel out of control, all because I want to calm down. It makes me feel unfocused, unmotivated, everything. Its literally the cause of all my problems, then everything else is just the effect of it.

Title: My favorite hobby has become a nightmare
Text: Gaming has become so difficult for me because of my OCD. I’m having a hard time pursuing what I love because of this. I have compulsions and rituals that I have to go through just to do what I love and enjoy myself. To make things worse, excessive hand washing is the major problem. Without performing a specific ritual or excessively washing my hands, I’m having a hard time touching and using my controller, steam deck, pc etc. I’m always scared and anxious about anything happening to my things until unless I perform a specific ritual or compulsion, and it’s really exhausting. Because of this, I’m losing interest and becoming lazy. Not just for gaming, but other aspects of my life as well. I’m always scared and afraid of touching things, and then excessively washing my hands to ease my anxiety. It has become exhausting and a complete burden for me. I don’t know what to do.

Title: chronic pain is feeding into OCD spiral - what's the best way to manage?
Text: so, i have OCD focused primarily on bodily sensations and fear of illness/injury. i also have shitty neck and upper back muscles from years of poor posture and deskwork. i'm currently going through a flare-up, and i've realized that whenever this happens, i'm essentially experiencing an OCD spiral as well - my physical pain creates obsessive thoughts that i'm stuck on all day every day for the 3-5 weeks it takes me to get my back in noticably better shape. i'm in PT for the physical part and i've just started counseling for the OCD, but what can i do day-to-day to actually like, cope with the OCD? is anybody else here in a similar situation, and if so, what helps you get out of the spiral? my brains pretty fried at this point lol

Text:
