Title: My harm ocd - how do I break this?
Text: I have severe harm OCD. Been diagnosed 8 times. 4 months of constant rumination without even realizing it (trying to solve the thoughts to me brought me some peace bc it felt like I could stop myself from doing them…until it backfired and now I can think them consciously and still feel like I’m going to do them). Except now, whenever I try to feel something positive about the loved one it targets, I get a horrible feeling. Literally all the time. Like the minuteI think of them, it rushes up from my stomach and it’s this awful feeling I can’t explain. If I say I want to get better, and get my life back with them…same feeling. I try to accept the thoughts and feel better accepting them feeling like I’m going to do them, than fighting against them and I’m scared I will. It desperately feels like a desire. Hearing words, thinking any thing about anything remotely close, being with my loved one…it all feels like I want this. And am just stopping myself. What the hell do I do? Do I just give up? Is that feeling real? Or if I just push past it will it stop and I’ll get my actual love and desire for them back?

Title: Contamination OCD Strategies
Text: I (21F) was diagnosed with OCD when I was 17 and I have done a few rounds of ERP for moral OCD and I take medication. I have some contamination OCD but it’s nothing major. Sometimes if I’m particularly vulnerable it can get bad. I am staying away from home and I know my hosts took care to make the room very nice and clean for me but I found rat poop in the closet and wasn’t in a head space to deal with it well and I almost had a panic attack about being in proximity to it but I didn’t. This morning I was feeling better and I cleaned it up with paper towel and some spray. However, my sweater was on the floor in the closet a little bit. I don’t think it touched the poop or was in the rat poop corner but it was in the rat poop closet and for me, it’s contaminated. I know what I should wear the sweater but the idea stresses me out and I don’t know if I’ll be able to feel comfortable in it. What are some strategies I can use? I don’t want to give in and wash it because that’s like letting it win :(

Text:
I hold my mouth like my both hands are covering my lips and nose like a mask and keep my mouth wide open and roll my eyes to each other and I'm in a state of excitation while I'm doing this activity and i always do it in washroom where no-one sees me and I think about stuff/situations basically i ruminate in this manner and when I'm trying to study or do something that requires focus and I feel happy/excited due to anything like someone compliments me or anything i tend to repeat this activity more often

Title: when visiting some places I connect them with events from the past
Text: For example, I was at a local restaurant today to buy a pizza, but I remembered that I visited the same pizzeria years ago not long before my great-grandfather died. now I'm afraid that my great-grandmother (who is alive) could get hurt because I visited this restaurant. I know that its just ocd, but in my case it helps me to realize it when I know that I'm not the only one who has been in similar situation , which somehow makes me think that it's not just my type of thinking and that more people with OCD experienced something similar. Has anyone ever had anything similar or knows about this type of ocd? Thanks a lot for any help

Title: What if you’re the product of your SO OCD?
Text:
Long story short- my husband developed OCD 4 years ago. He began having sexual intrusive thoughts about other woman. 
He was panicked, freaking out. He would tell me every thought he had. It could be nothing of consequence and then something horrible. Or it could be about me- my flaws, doubts as to whether he loves me. 
Years later, and after 6 months of therapy, he claims it’s much better. But it’s not. He struggles interacting with any other woman even marginally attractive. 

And there’s something different between us. I can kind of put my finger on it- but he’s generally very awkward unless we are talking about a topic that is completely separate from anything romance related or personal. There’s no sweetness without awkward or it ending quickly. And that’s rarely. There’s no confidence in his love towards me or desire for me. He still shows desire for me- but it’s almost always unserious. He’s very childlike in his interactions. Always making up a voice for speaking about intimacy, making jokes, etc. And I know I’m attractive and desirable and I know he loves me. I just don’t understand why he can’t be “real” if that makes sense. 
If I’m wanting to be romantic or talk about us or even talking about general relationships, attraction, etc.. something changes in his demeanor towards me. 

I guess my question is- is this how it’s going to be forever? Can more therapy help? He says it can’t help and gets very angry when I bring it up. I’m trying so hard to be understanding but I don’t understand at all what the problem is.

Title: Research: Take part in Psych study about online and offline behaviors (USA, 18yo+)
Text:
What is your Study: The Psychopathology Lab at The New School is looking for volunteers to participate in a [research study about online and offline behaviors.](https://newschool.qualtrics.com/jfe/form/SV_3UddR7Z1Ec76obs) (IRB Protocol Number 24-072-1244) 

Lead Researcher Name: This study is being conducted by Margarita Bulatova

Lead Researcher Credentials: a master’s student in the psychology department at The New School, 

Institution Name: The New School for Social Research

Advisor (For thesis level): Dr. McWelling Todman.

Will this work be published?: possibly

**You must be over 18 years old to be in this study**.

Compensation:  Your participation in this study is completely voluntary. 

Method of study (In person, online): If you choose to take part in this study, you will be asked to answer a series of online surveys

Time required: Your participation will take about 20-40 minutes.

Link for participation:  [https://newschool.qualtrics.com/jfe/form/SV\_3UddR7Z1Ec76obs](https://newschool.qualtrics.com/jfe/form/SV_3UddR7Z1Ec76obs)

Due to the subject of the research you may find that participation in this study will present you with an opportunity to process past experiences in a way that is meaningful to you. However, we understand that reflecting on your past experiences may elicit difficult feelings. At your request, we will provide mental health referrals for dealing with any distress you have related to the discussion of your memories and experiences. If you are currently experiencing thoughts of self-harm and/or suicide, they should contact one or more of the following mental health providers, either by phone or via text: Dial 988 for the Suicide and Crisis Lifeline, The National Suicide

Prevention Lifeline: 1-800-273-8255, and Crisis Text Line, text 741 741.

Please feel free to share this post and my contact information with anyone who might be interested in participating in this research study.

Email to contact for questions: If you would like additional information about this study, please contact Margarita Bulatova at [bular364@newschool.edu](mailto:bular364@newschool.edu). A request for more information does not obligate you to participate in this study.

Title: How can i make myself do things differently?
Text:
I'm pretty sure i have OCD. I'm not officially diagnosed, but it seems likely based on my behaviours.

One of the aspects of this is that i need to do things in a specific order. This usually isn't a big deal, but there's one part of it that's been annoying me a bit.

When i have to clean my pet bird's cage.

I have two pet birds, a cockatiel and a budgie, that i love more than almost anything else. They're very happy birds, and love being around me and other people they like, though they're a bit scared of sudden movements.

They're extremely spoiled, and have a lot of items that we specifically made/bought for them. This means more cleaning.

Just to put it into perspective, i'll just add a few things they have. Two large cages (they only use one, the other is used more as a play area or spare cage), a bird playground, a backpack carrier, a small cage, multiple play areas set up in my room etc.

When i clean the cage, i have to do it in a specific order. The problem with this is that the order i have to do it in is extremely inconvenient and makes it harder to clean.

Is there any way i can make myself less anxious about doing it in a specific order? I want to make my birds more comfortable, as they don't really like when i clean their cages, toys etc.

TLDR; i have two spoiled birds that have lots of areas to clean, OCD makes me need to do the cleaning in an inconvenient order, need a way to clean it differently without being too anxious.

Title: Anyone else experience a rare compulsion like this?
Text:
I feel like this is completely unheard of.

I have a thing where everytime i go to the bathroom, I have to count by multiples of 2 until I reach 20. I have to do this either twice, four times, or until 10 or 20 or 80. Then on the last number, I have to think of a clear image of something without thinking certain thoughts. If I mess up I have to restart. This goes on and on. Basically using hyperphantasia. 

I just spent over 2 hours going pee. 

And the worst part is I have to smack the back of my head everytime I mess up. 

It's getting to the point where my mind CANNOT visualize ANYTHING anymore. Making my compulsion impossible. But I still have to do it.

I have to do it while peeing, then washing my hands, then turning off the light. Please someone make me feel better I've wasted my entire night.

And I'm worried exposure therapy won't help me. I can't shake my compulsions and I can't challenge them, they threaten me.

Title: Rabies OCD (it’s a stretch)
Text:
🙄 my OCD always manifests in the most “final destination” ways, like a ridiculous thing would have to happen for my fears to take place yet I ruminate for hours. Example I’m dealing with currently… 

I have a cracked heel and it was bleeding. Threw on some socks and open-toed sandals. (I wasn’t dressing to impress) 

I walked past what I’m 95% sure was a dead bat on the sidewalk. For a WEEK I have believed that brain matter or saliva from this dead bat was kicked up into my sandals and through my sock and into my cracked heel, which would fall into the category of “broken skin”

Title: how do you eat healthily if your ocd affects your diet?
Text: hi, so i've been struggling with constant weight loss my entire life due to the constant fear of contamination (especially meat) and overall just general disgust towards food because the moment i chew it, it becomes waste for excretion. i have a preference for soups for this reason. i've never been bothered so much by it because i'm a college student with no time and budget to worry about it, but recently i realized i can't always put it off for the sake of my health. i've been underweight (16>18) for forever but i keep throwing up what i eat. i just want to eat normally. i know some of you has felt like this, i'm wondering if you guys know of ways to battle it?

Title: Constant Mental Gymnastics
Text: Help. For the past week, I have had constant thoughts and mental gymnastics about a specific thing, and it's driving me nuts. For the last day, I've deliberately fought back, but I still have the unresolved pressure in my chest. It feels like I'm swaying around the threshold, and my brain strongly wants to gravitate back to those thinking patterns all the time. I have attempted to distract myself with social media and video games to ease it, and it has worked slightly. What can I do to stop it?

Title: Unexpected setback
Text: Under evaluation for OCD, and today something happened that triggered it massively. I have been fighting it for months, finally started to be calmer and feel ready to tackle the small things and work my way up, and instead I have one of my major triggers to work through today with no meds, no therapy support, no preparation. I have so much to do and my day is on hold because I cant push through this fear that everything i touch is bad. I cant escape the feeling that "all my hard work following compulsions was for nothing" now, but even with that thought, I cant see how the compulsions were useless - instead it just makes me angry that something unexpected would ruin the sense of safety id painstakingly  built up with them. i hope it can at least act ad  some sort of ... involuntary exposure therapy, and not just a scary event that makes things worse, but i dont know how I would accomplish that. Does anyone have any words of support or tips on how to make it through this without going back to square 1 again?

Title: Has OCD made you a super negative person?
Text:
My fiancé and I have been talking a lot about how OCD has impacted me & even our relationship & I guess I never realized the impact of my negativity/fear towards everything on the people around me. It’s hard to explain but it almost feels like I can’t even comprehend that it’s deemed negative because to ME the ‘problems’ are so real that I almost get frustrated that people aren’t seeing this. 

Has anyone been able to overcome this or at least make steps to be better? I feel as though anytime I’m optimistic or happy my OCD goes into overdrive - I can’t seem to find a tolerable balance.

Title: OCD is so bad this time I’m terrified and need major help
Text: Tonight my ocd seriously about sent me to a mental hospital. For weeks now it’s just been back and fourth with depression, intense almost flashback type of thoughts, constantly in an anxious/scared state and I’m coming to the end of my rope here. I’ve been struggling with this bullshit for 4 YEARS now and I’m just now at the point of trying medication. I’ve held off for so long thinking I could handle it without medication since I’ve had a few periods where the thoughts didn’t bother me and I could easily identify them as ocd and move on with my life. This time it’s completely different. About a month or two ago I got triggered by something I saw on YouTube which was about my biggest ocd fear which is developing schizophrenia or going into psychosis. That’s always been my biggest fear ever since I had a bad experience with weed years ago and for some reason I have it so ingrained into my head that I won’t be able to live if I end up developing one of those illnesses. I struggled badly and was having panic attacks again almost daily after I saw that YouTube video but eventually I got past it and my ocd moved to something else. About a month ago now I had a really weird couple of days where my body just wouldn’t sleep no matter how tired I was or what I tried . I ended up checking into a mental clinic to get checked out and after what i told them about my sleeping problem and what not they just recommended me to a psychiatrist and tried giving me tips on what to do if I’m having a panic attack (like I don’t already know) . This was partially my fault because I’m terrified of telling someone about my real ocd issues in fear they won’t understand and either lock me up or misdiagnose me since ocd is still really misunderstood by a lot of “professionals” I just signed up for a therapy session with nocd so im planning on getting real help soon btw . But there’s something else I’m fearing aswell, my ocd has seemed to latch onto the idea that I may actually be bipolar and it’s pretty much convinced me that I am. Ever since those couple days of not sleeping I’m constantly worried I was in a manic episode and since I’ve waited so long to get help I’m heading towards a really bad road. I have lots of mood swings throughout the day but I feel it’s mainly depression related from my constant ocd thoughts. Basically one min I’m afraid of being bipolar and losing control, then when I get over that I’m worried about developing schiz or psychosis, then when I move on from that it’s something else and it’s just a never ending cycle. I’ve read and watched just about every video that’s out there about ocd and how to try and sit with the uncertainty and uncomfortable feelings but everytime I do my thoughts start racing and telling me it’s not ocd and that I’m doing more damage by not doing anything about it then going to get help. Eventually I spiral and freak out until I can calm myself down. I also seem to really struggle with the idea that ppl are going to think I’m insane so I never talk to anyone about these issues. That’s also why I’ve been hesitant on therapy for so long in fear ppl will judge me or misunderstand what I’m going though and just label me psychotic. I really really really need some advice because my therapy session isn’t for another few days and idk how I’m gonna make it till then. I’ve even been having a lot more suicidal thoughts recently (I’ve never hurt myself or ever thought about planning it out) but the depression this is causing almost seems like I won’t be able to take it anymore and flip out . Any advice would help because I’m severely struggling here this is worse than I’ve ever had it in my 4 years of dealing with this shit.

Title: Psychiatrist said I’m normal
Text: I had a visit with a psychiatrist and he seemed very dismissive of my symptoms. I told him about how I get certain parts of songs stuck in my head for days, how I need to do things like step on cracks on the sidewalk multiple times until it feels "right" or I get anxiety and a overall feeling of guilt/discomfort. It's not just with cracks on the sidewalk, it's with anything and I don't know until it happens. Sometimes I lay awake at night with songs in my head that won't let me sleep or reliving every past mistake I've made in my life. If I'm singing a song on the radio I get anxiety if someone interrupts me before I get to sing the whole song, the incomplete feeling makes me upset. I'm not saying I have OCD but it hurts to be dismissed and told that these things are normal because I would really hope that not everyone has to deal with this. If you have any advice or any idea of what I may be going through, please let me know. Thanks in advance.

Title: Leaving this subreddit
Text:
I’ve been in the process of trying to recover im ready to start living my life how I want and facing the uncertainty’s along the way so I’m leaving this subreddit I notice I tend to kinda use this subreddit sometimes as like a crutch when I’m feeling doubts and wanna reassure myself what I’m going through is Normal ,

sure I feel uncomfortable sure I feel uncertain but I’m learning now the freedom I’m seeking is in the feelings I’m running away from sometimes This shi feels like hell is swarming my mind but if I wanna get better I gotta js live through these feelings im ngl my body has literally shaken I’ve felt some of the most uncomfortable feelings literally started crying at one point but I’m gonna continue pushing through these feelings I don’t care what feelings I gotta face anymore and if I can apply this mindset to life I feel like I’ll be unstoppable 

mindfullness is helping me a lot through this I just focus on things around me and let the thoughts do as they want I notice when I do this I get moments when I forget about the thoughts and I feel like if I keep going eventually those moments will last longer 
Almost like a glimpse of what recovery must feel like 

A beautiful thing I’m noticing is certain thoughts still linger but they don’t have the pull they used to on me ,the thoughts definitely aren’t beautiful but a year ago I would’ve let those thoughts pull me in ,now I look at them and just let them be so I’m definitely growing 
Along the way 

For the most part I can say the feelings have subsided the anxiety is gone but the doubt is still kinda there I understand this is normal I’ll accept the doubt and keep pushing forward I hope you guys know how strong y’all are facing these nasty thoughts day in and day out you guys are warriors man I believe in you guys even if in this moment you can’t feel it ,I believe you can do it I’m no different than y’all at all believe me I felt like giving up.

Title: Does anyone else fear that other people will hear your thoughts even though it’s impossible?
Text:
I tend to worry that other people will hear my thoughts and what goes on in my mind despite it being impossible. Whenever I’m having intrusive or inappropriate thoughts I feel like someone is watching or listening when really it’s just my anxiety. I fear people will hear my intrusive thoughts in public, at school or on tv and will get scared, shame or make fun of me for having such thoughts. But in reality nobody can hear my thoughts except myself. 

Idk if this is common in OCD or what but I’m curious to know if anyone else experiences these feelings that other people are watching you or listening to your thoughts when having intrusive thoughts.

Title: Obsessing over  certain things?
Text:
Does anyone relate to this? 

*trigger warning* ‼️ 

I don’t stop ruminating over how things look in my house. Change in location, a move or change in anything makes me think it a set up to my death. Like basically I think because we moved into a different house this house isn’t close to my personality so therefore it is more fit for my family which means I am going to die soon and this will be their home without me. 

OR my daughters room isn’t suiting her the way I see it should, so that means she will die and one of her brothers will probably have her room since my two boys share a room now 🤦‍♀️

Here’s another one, we just started going to church and now that we all feel connected I believe that the church has been put into our lives because it’ll be easier access to one of our funerals, specifically mine and that the church will somehow surround themselves in support to my family when I’m gone because we became members of the congregation and they like us. 

My OCD feels so complex and exhausting I have other things I do, rituals in the day to possibly limit these things from happening. Drastic changes would be moving into a different home (can’t do that) or literally stop going to church, I’m at that rate now where I would do that if I could. This is debilitating. I stopped Zoloft 6 months ago. I’m waiting on seeing a psychiatrist, it’s taking forever, I’m on a waitlist at the moment. I feel like time is running out. I hate this so much. 

Can anyone relate? Sometimes I feel so alone with OCD like an anomaly, it’s so weird!! 😭

Title: understanding my partner with OCD.
Text:
my partner and i have been going through a bump in the road recently. this resulted in a much needed conversation revolving around wanting to be understood, and the necessity of changing our perspectives. 

i have ADHD that has affected me in my life, especially our relationship, more than i ever realized. my partner has OCD that plays a heavy role in their life, way deeper than what is visible on the surface. i feel my ADHD has been down played to “you need to focus more, ITS NOT THAT HARD“.  or  “ i hate to repeat myself, IF YOU CARED you would have heard me the first time”. 

i know i’ve been doing this to their  OCD as well. i’ve said things like “you just need to stop overthinking everything!” and “ OCD doesn’t seem that bad, i’d love to be as organized as you”. they’re such a well put together person who stresses about things months in advance, while i wait to the very last minute to start. they get upset when i leave out fine details when telling a story, but i can barely align my thoughts into a coherent timeline. they’re  so clean that it feels like walking on eggshells, whenever i come home  im not allowed to sit on our bed while  “wearing outside clothes“. 

it’s hard for me to understand this thought process when these episodes of obsessing over the smallest of things happen in waves. these waves are far and few between, but when they happen, it’s intense, and confusing, they will wash their hands “normally” for months, then without warning, start washing their hands so frequently and aggressively that their skin will crack and bleed. it breaks my heart seeing them get this way, it leads me to ask “why are these things so important to you now, when it wasn’t a concern the past few months?”

i know they require so much support, but i need to understand them first.  we  desperately want to save our relationship, and realized this is going to take a massive amount of change and growth. we both desperately want patients, understanding, and acceptance  from each other. while they’re off researching ADHD, icome here to ask WHERE SHOULD I START IN MY JOURNEY TO BETTER UNDERSTAND MY PARTNER WITH OCD? ANY GOOD BOOKS?

Title: Can't stop checking my doll for imperfections/blush chipping
Text:
I'm supposed to rest for work tomorrow, but I spent a few hours checking my doll for imperfections and blush chipping. It sucks. it's a custom hand painted doll. 

There was some yellowing on the surface of the doll, at the edge of the blush so I wiped it off with wet wipes. then I thought the blush seemed uneven. Looked at it from various angles and it seemed like the sealant on the blush was uneven from some. So I wiped those parts gently. She's my favourite doll so it bothers me more than the rest. 

Today I kept taking photos to check if the blush chipped off. It's frustrating. I think this post belongs here rather than the doll community, because I have been advised to stop collecting custom dolls as it seems to be doing more harm than good. 

Idk I want to send her for a touch up on the blush parts. It would hurt me to have the whole doll redone instead. 

How do I stop checking? I want to chill out and watch Netflix but there's the ringing thought at the back of my head. (My pdoc says I don't have OCD, he actually asked if these things cause me distress and I said yes) He just said I have obsessive traits.

Just woke up from a nap and this is the first thing that happened. Going to not shower or change, but will likely clean each dish I use for the next few days. I just thought this was funny.

Title: Fear of developing TS
Text:
Hi everyone

I’m 31f and have had OCD for about 8 years now. I’ve had three ‘flare ups’ and I’m in my third currently. The first two were schiz and existential OCD, and they got better with time and medication. 

This time I’m absolutely terrified that I may develop Tourette’s or a vocal tic as I’ve read that it is linked with OCD. Does anyone have any knowledge on if people can develop a tic from OCD or is it just my OCD latching on to something new?

Any advice welcome.

Title: anyone have problems getting rid of stuff?
Text: this applies to both physical things and other things like photos. i hate tidying because i get scared to throw things out. it could be a random worksheet from 4 years ago and i'll convince myself i still need it for some reason and i can't throw it out. i don't like deleting pictures because i'm worried i'll regret it or need them later, but now my phone is barely functioning because i have no storage 😭 i also have a problem where i save almost every single tiktok/instagram post i see because i might need to come back to it later, and if i don't save it i feel like i'm losing it forever and what if i regret it??? i have so much stuff that logically i don't think i need but my brain is like, telling me that i should keep because either a) i'll need it later or b) it has some deep symbolic meaning??? like say there's a leaf in my room that got dragged in from outside, my brain will tell me it's a sign from the universe and i can't throw it out or else things will go wrong. i realize now that i sound a little bit insane but i don't know how else to explain this other than i know it's not realistic but i still sort of believe it? anyone else?? 😅

Title: Compulsively wanting to apologize
Text:
I have a feeling I’m not the only person who does this, but does anyone else feel like they need to apologize for literally the most inoffensive thing? Like I could say hi to a friend and immediately want to say “sorry for bothering you”. I rarely actually do it (close friends know it’s a sign of my anxiety going haywire) but even having that feeling that I need to, drives me nuts! If I don’t do it I spend hours thinking about how I could have offended that person and need to do something to make it right. 

How do I stop thinking like this? It’s exhausting and embarrassing

Title: I think I still have OCD
Text:
When I was a young child I used to tap everything at Walmart, repeat what I said under my breath, would do things until it “felt right” also would be constantly worried about my health and a whole slew of things I can’t really recall but I know my mother said I had it, never was put on medication 

I should also mention in my teenage years I used to spend 30min-2hrs staring at something random and just deep in thought thinking about my life and going down endless branches of thought then restarting and taking a new path until i forced my hand into some open ended answer 


But nowadays (only 20yrs of age) i do believe I still have it but my mother made me believe it was either minor or nonexistent because I didn’t physically exhibit traits but one glaring thing I did notice that finally think is attributed to OCD is my mind triggering my Fear


When I’m outside in the dark I’m always mentally picturing someone or creature lurking nearby waiting to come to murder me, and the closer I get to safety (ie inside) the faster I run and the more my fear peaks 

When I’m in the shower i always get mental images of something right behind the curtain waiting to murder me when I’m eyes are closed

Even right now when I’m trying to sleep I picture a tall lanky creature just standing there right behind me 

I always thought it was stupid that I’m “afraid” of the dark, I like the dark and I realize my fears are stupid but my mind just runs free constantly spamming jumpscare images and different frights to get me acting up, and this is only when I feel vulnerable, 

Another thing is that I was just thinking  that maybe I might have split personality disorder (whole other can of worms, I don’t think I do, I just used to have a voice I would pose as a opposing view to try and work through different thought processes and bounce ideas off of) but my mind just slow at first but quickly turned full steam into constant repeating of “we’re in your mind” and then i started getting spammed with jumpscare images in my brain and I started tearing up a bit so I went from comfortably trying to sleep to now my mind is trying to peak my fear whenever I close my eyes 



I think all my OCD signs were snuffed out by people calling me out (my brother told me to stop repeating stuff under my breath saying I should work to stop doing that, the doctor told me about anecdotes about people who stress about their health, ect. And I was a pretty shy kid, I think I slowly changed all my manifestations into mental ones and here we are now)

Title: I'm not sure if I'm asexual or have a low libido or OCD has scarred me for life
Text:
This may come off as a compulsion...but I'm 3 years into a somewhat post-OCD life thanks to ERP. I'm just really curious what y'all think/if anyone has felt the same way of being somewhat a sexual person - having OCD for years but - afterwards have an odd relationship with sex 

Backstory:
I remember as a kid liking sexual/sensual stuff that made me feel aroused. Around 8 or 9 I started developing OCD tendencies and by 14 or 15 I became trapped by OCD, particularly, sexually intrusive thoughts. I grew up in the south and viewed sex low-key as a thing only "bad teenagers" did but around 16 I started thinking I wanted to have sex. Due to my intrusive thoughts I was older than most people when I had my first kiss -> having sex because I was sooooo scared a thought would pop up when I did anything at all sexual with a person. It became less about desire and feeling like I just needed to catch-up with my peers. Once I was having sex, it was something to do to have a decent body count to, once again, fit in with what I thought my peers were doing. Sex was/is alright...but I am a woman with female anatomy and it takes me a while to finish by clitorial stimulation so maybe that's why I'm not crazy about it unlike the people with penisis who (in my experience) are in heaven as soon as their penises are slightly played with...but also the intrusive thoughts that happened during sex did not help me experience pleasure. ANYWAYS, it felt like a thing I did low-key just to have something to talk about with my friends. I'm now in my late 20s and haven't had severe OCD for three (3) years now thanks to ERP. I don't have intrusive thoughts when I have sex anymore...but I don't care for sex.

I'm not sure if anyone else has had OCD who are okay with their thoughts now but still don't have a positive relationship with sex. Maybe I am asexual (fraysexual in particular because I feel like my attraction does fade but maybe that's all relationships??) or I have a low libido or OCD has made me have such bad association with sex that I no longer like it. Like I still get in my head but with random thoughts instead of an OCD cycle. I feel like it's so hard for me to connect my brain and my body without having some form of anxiety. I do weirdly like to feel aroused and sensual but passed that I'm lost. 

Thanks!!

Title: Compulsions don't cause relief even short term (I guess it has before for short time but I noticed alot it doesn't)

Maybe I'm confused but I just read compulsions are usually like trying to alliviate anxiety and cause relief so why are mine opposite?

Title: Can anymore relate?
Text:
Hi! I'm living with Mild Autism with ADHD and here are my things about me that I want to share:

* I want things to be perfect and organized too, even though I’m also messy—especially when I’m writing. When I write something, it has to be on the line, otherwise, I start to feel uncomfortable. Whenever someone messes with my book, I get really frustrated, and I also get frustrated whenever someone types a proper noun in lowercase.
* I started having intrusive thoughts when I was 11. At first, I thought I was crazy or something. Even when I told my parents, they were scared of me, and I felt like a person who might potentially hurt someone. I realized this last March, and I felt a bit less worse. To this day, I still have intrusive thoughts about someone hurting me and the worst are the ones based on things I've done in the past. (Real Event OCD)
* I don't care about germs.
* I'm afraid that someone might one day expose me for past actions I no longer engage in but have felt guilty about for so long. Worse than being exposed would be facing legal consequences. I feel like I'm not even a human.
* Sometimes, I have intrusive thoughts about others driven by my insecurities, and it feels awful. I’m not even sure if these are still just intrusive thoughts at this point.
* I'm an overthinker to the max. I’ve had an all-or-nothing mindset for a long time, and I often experience meltdowns, which are incredibly embarrassing

I’m not even sure if this is OCD. It feels like it might not be, and that I’m just using it as an excuse for my difficult past. You’re definitely not alone in this situation; I used to think I was alone, not knowing anything about OCD. I thought it only meant being obsessed with cleaning. I’m glad I realized I’m not alone in this. While I can’t say for certain if this is OCD, I can definitely relate to many people with OCD.

Title: OCD is so exhausting.....

Guess new illness just dropped, and it's getting into the cold months aka everyone's fucking sick, so I'm going to lose my mindddddd im exhausted. I'm in therapy and on medication but ocd has hands yall. I'm just tired. 
Ik the flair says no advice but idrc if I get any--the "just venting" portion is why I chose that. 
Wish people didn't romanticize this disorder all the time so I could talk about it without people being like "oh I'm so ocd too" like girl stoppit. 
Anyways I'm just tired, it's 3am and I work tomorrow so I'm going to sleep now, just needed to get that out.

Title: Does it get better?
Text:
feels like no matter how well i get, i am pushed back tenfold. prozac for the most part has kept me stable, but it feels like this is all conditional and temporary. that i've only got months left. some sort of impending doom. 

if it's not false memory, it's always something else. finishing off whatever semblance of self esteem i've got. constantly doubting if this is ocd. despite the fact i am diagnosed. wishing i could go a day without thinking, or at the very least with grace towards myself. 

these past few months have been hard. lots of life changes without being able to acclimate. on top of maneuvering uncertainty. it feels unfair, yet i can't help but feel self defeated and as if i deserve it. 

i hope this truly does get better. not just for myself, but for those who are currently battling this ailment. 

just needed to vent, thanks.

Title: Deleting things and then questioning if they’re really gone?
Text:
So I know deleting and resetting things is common amongst us. Deleting browser history, photos, social media accounts, game save data ect. and factory resetting your phone, computer, console ect. because everything feels “tainted” or you want to “start fresh”.

The problem I have is that after deleting something I question if I did it properly, and need to keep checking to see if it’s really gone. Sometimes I end up repeating the process of deleting or resetting something multiple times and STILL don’t feel satisfied.

I keep checking and checking and checking until I exhaust myself and give up.

Is anyone else in the same boat as me?

Title: Newly Diagnosed with ocd
Text:
I've always had OCD tendencies but I never got checked out as I thought it was something I could deal with myself, but now as a F26 with a very stressful full-time job, I am starting to really struggle.

 I have my first therapy session next Tuesday, and I'm currently on fluoxetine (I only just started) but oh boy does this suck. My ocd relates to food contamination, getting sick from food and germs, and I am currently unable to eat a lot at all, mainly just porridge with water, soup, and bread, and maybe a baked potato or something very simple for dinner. 

I just feel so alone in this, my family and friends know the basics but not how bad its getting, and I'm afraid to tell my work what is going on. I just wonder if there's a light at the end of the tunnel, has anyone experienced anything similar?

Title: Pure ocd
Text: Is anyone’s mental compulsions more like a reflex?

Title: Can OCD cause you to experience DPDR?
Text:
First of all, I know I shouldn’t be posting this as it’s just going to fuel my OCD but this is the scariest thing I’ve ever experienced and I don’t know what else to do.

Basically, some months ago I started struggling on and off with existential OCD, which was coupled with brief episodes of derealisation that didn’t last very long, mostly because I wasn’t focusing on the actual feeling and moreso the obsession was still with the existential thoughts. But I had a derealisation episode earlier this week and this time the feeling won’t go away. I’ve felt this weird feeling that everything seems blurry and dream-like for the past 5 days non-stop and I‘m terrified I’m going to feel this way forever now. I can’t stop thinking about it and googling it (it’s replaced the existential theme it seems) and I’ve seen so many things online that say people have had to deal with this for many years and I’m literally the most frightened I’ve ever been in my entire life. Most people also seem to have got it from alcohol or drugs or trauma and I’m scared because I haven‘t so I don’t know why I’m feeling this way. So basically, I just need to know… can anxiety such as that caused by OCD bring this on too? And will trying not to ruminate on it make it go away?

Again, I’m sorry for posting this, I know it’s probably not helpful for me, but I feel like if I understand why I’m feeling this way I can move towards being more comfortable with dealing with it.

Title: i’m exhausted. can’t take it anymore.
Text: my obsessions have become crippling this week for some reason and i don’t know why. my compulsions aren’t calming me down at all like they normally do and i find i’m spending up to an hour doing them with 0 reassurance or relief. i’m exhausted. i don’t know why this is happening. i don’t know how to stop it and right now i don’t know what the point is of living. right now i’m petrified that i’m going to burn to death in my bedroom because my radiator is boiling hot even though it’s meant to be on the lowest level, i have my fan on to cool me down and i’m terrified a fire will start and the mess in my room- which i’ve been unable to clean due to my ocd being so fucking time consuming- will only cause the fire to become bad really quick and the fan will oxygenate the flames. i know i’m being crazy. i can’t calm down. my back hurts and i’m starving but i can’t eat because of my ocd. my eyes hurt, i’m so fucking tired but i’m freaking out internally and i don’t know what to do because no compulsion will calm me down and i can’t stop thinking that i’m going to burn to death even though it’s probably fine. i’m fucking tired. this isn’t a disorder anymore, it’s an incurable  disease and it’s debilitating. and the worst part is, even though i’ve always had ocd it suddenly got immensely worse the second i hit 20 and as such this is all new to me and i don’t know how to cope, my therapist referred me to someone new but that was months ago and i’ve had 0 confirmation of it. this is new to me. it’s not fair. i don’t know how to cope. i can’t even open up to my family about this because my parents are extremely dismissive, apparently my brother believes he may have ocd too and my mother replied to that by rolling her eyes and scoffing at him. some of my compulsions are gross and embarrassing and i can’t open up to anybody about them. this week has been awful. nothing is helping. i refuse to take meds. i’m so tired and scared.

Title: Romance Anxiety
Text:
I’m a 22yr female and ever since high school I’ve always been so anxious when it came to crushes and romance and I never understood why. Not a “butterflies in the stomach” kind of anxiety… like I feel physically unwell and can’t eat and want to immediately ghost someone the second there’s any reciprocated interest towards me. I don’t know if it’s a lack of control thing or maybe guilt that makes me so anxious? I’ve never kissed / slept with anyone and I’m starting to get insecure about my lack of experience, especially when all of my friends aren’t virgins.

 I also get so easily icked out by men… I’m bi but it makes me question if im just lesbian because of my pickiness towards men? Anyways lol … I think there’s also another level of pressure because im  a late bloomer and have high expectations which is a good thing to have, it’s just harder. 

I’m mostly curious if anyone else has anxiety about romance and also has OCD and if these two may possibly be connected? And if you have any advice on it?

Title: Can't do this anymore...
Text:
I cant do this anymore. Since the start of this year I cant act normally or do the things i wanna do on my own at all without feeling that the 3 people I know are watching me through my eyes. 

These 3, are people who have a huge impact on me. (In a good way) 

Although one of 3 of the people
Is someone I seen on Youtube....By watching him I was able to relate to him and it felt like we had a "bond" since I viewed him like an ideal older brother or father. I can see their judgemental facial expressions while their watching me.

I also perform compulsions when the thoughts get too "Loud"/when they get too judgemental Such as:

1. Covering my head to hide my face
2. Shaking my head
3. Lightly tapping my hand or feet on the ground/table
4. If they get TOO LOUD than usual, I'd sometimes talk to them. e.g 'SHUT UP' 'DON'T YOU EVER JUST SHUT UP'
5. I do get the thoughts of getting violent like smashing my head against the table/wall or even punching but I never act out on them.


After I do these compulsions they don't ever go away they just get reduced or "quiet"  
and their always there 24/7 even as im typing this. These people activate as soon as I wake up from bed.


One time I was trying to do push-ups but completely refrained from doing it as soon as I noticed their reaction. It's kinda like a voice in my head as my social worker calls it sometimes...


Its hard to do the things I want to or be interested in the things I like without feeling that the people watching me through my eyes are making fun of what I like. I just want to rip everything out of my head I don't want to think of it anymore. I just want to live one day in comfort without having to do it for the sake of the people in my head. I just want to enjoy things like I used to.

Title: Hey friends! Just a question!
Text:
Hi everyone, I am someone in love with somebody who has OCD. I believe it’s contamination OCD (his compulsion is hand washing, he’ll do it excessively until he gets frustrated) and often asks for reassurance that his hands are clean. He’s in a country where it takes a while to get help, but he’s in the process of getting it. 


I’ve read that you shouldn’t feed into it and reassure people who have OCD because it encourages it or something, but I don’t know if that applies because he says he believes me if I tell him his hands are clean. I don’t have OCD, so I’m not entirely sure. Can someone help me out? What’s the best way I can support him through this? 


I hope you all are doing okay. Thank you. x

Title: ocd and schizophrenia comorbidity
Text: i think the comorbidity is more common than people get told, a lot like ocd and autism (which i also have). it's such a shit thing to have together, though, because so much gets amplified by whichever of the two isn't the main culprit. i get contamination triggered by food that looks off to me, and the schizophrenia delusions come in and tell me it's poisoned and i don't eat for days. i get the feeling that someone is after me from the schizophrenia, the ocd tells me it's because they heard my "terrible thoughts" (aka intrusive thoughts), or because i didn't do xyz compulsion and now i've set off some catastrophic event. i still remember the elevator breaking after i had just rode it when i was still in high school and thinking it had to have been my fault, with the schizophrenia veeeeeeery helpfully supplying the idea that it was meant to be me and someone else just "took my hit" or something. it probably isn't just me, almost certainly isn't, but it's so annoying and inescapable that it's become so easy for me to feel like i'm trapped in some torment cycle that no one else can see. the only time i get any relief is when i'm in that no-feelings-just-eternal-numbness phase of the schizophrenia and my mind is too blank for the ocd to get too uppity, but even then, it isn't gone. nothing to really do about it, just have to get it off my chest because it feels so unfair and i can't really get out and about to get my mind off of it due to being physically disabled — it's just a lot. i still go through the motions and do my best to say on top of college and my job and stuff. i'm not in a crisis, just exhausted and having one of those moments where i just need to yell into the void a little. if anything, hopefully maybe someone with similar issues sees this and gets a little solace out of knowing it isn't just them. thank you for listening either way <3

Title: I think I have POCD I’m deeply scared
Text:
I’ve always been scared about being a pedo and have had scary events in the past where I questioned if I was one, but yesterday on my bus ride home from school I was sitting at the front and this kid was sitting in the seat across from me. I thought nothing of it. I tried to shut my eyes since my music wasn’t working and my thoughts started drifting to my girlfriend and a sexual thought of us popped up and I got like halfway aroused by the thought,but remembered I was on the bus and thought of something else, but before I did a thought popped up encouraged me to keep thinking of the thought of me and my gf In said sexual act. After it I felt so ashamed of why I thought I something like that in public and I literally grabbed my bag and scooted all the way to the bus window and buried my face in my bag till I reached my stop. I know it was a thought about my gf but I can’t stop beating myself up about it cause I’m some way I feel I’m a monster. Especially because of the second thought urging me to keep it honking of the scenario on my head. 

TLDR : thought about my gf sexually in public and now I feel like a pedo.

Title: Please help me if you’re on a medicine that works or take lamotrigine
Text:
Hi,

Background: I've tried every medicine under the sun, lamotrigine is like my 15th so don't suggest anything rudimentary like Zoloft or Prozac. Been there done that .

I have severe ocd and just started lamotrigine (100mg). It has kind of helped me with my ocd by lessening the misophonia and groinal responses I have developed around my sister (had a delusion about her that developed in my teens that caused it. I don't believe it anymore but the misophonia and groinal response remain.) I have another theme where I feel the need to define every word I hear , read, use, etc ; and that has improved a lot. 

It has all kind of gotten worse these past few days which is super disheartening because I thought I was on the road to recovery. I was wondering if anyone's ocd has gotten dramatically better on this medicine, and what dose they're on.

I'm being honest, I'm experiencing a lot of mental pain right now because this is not the only disorder or issue I have. I am trying to stay strong , so please give me any advice you can. My ocd issue around my sister makes me feel like a monster and I really need to get rid of it for my sake but also for the sake of our relationship because I love and care for her immensely. Thank you , and if you are in any distress I am really sorry and hope things get better.

Title: Treatment research
Text:
Has anyone tried zofran and an ssri? My prescriber said there's been strong research on the combo successfully helping ocd. If it helped or didn't help, let me know which ssri you tried with it. 

Much love 💕

Title: Weeks without fighting the intrusive thoughts/feelings ruined
Text:
It has been literal weeks since I was fighting the thoughts. It’s super hard for me not to fight my intrusive thoughts because it feels like if I’m not fighting them - then I believe them (I know this fear comes from the OCD), but it’s so fucking hard not to respond sometimes. Especially when the feelings are like as if I do believe the intrusive thoughts - it makes it so hard not to fight back the thoughts. Well I messed up, and I did fight them back - stereotypical “no I don’t believe that because of x,y, and z. It made my OCD ten times worse, and I had a panic attack. I’m feeling setback now, and lost like I don’t know what to do.

Can anyone relate?

Title: I’m going to do something irresponsible and I need support
Text:
I have terrible health OCD and anxiety. H5N1 has been spotted in the wastewater in my state and I’ve been afraid of it for a long time. I am a very COVID conscious person and my vax and PPE is always on and updated. But aside from continuing to mask, there’s nothing I can do about Bird Flu so I am going to mute it on all my social media. Turn it all off. 

I know it’s irresponsible to bury my head in the sand but I can’t handle being constantly triggered by fear. I hope you guys see where I’m coming from. Thank you

Title: Could deliberately saying bad things about myself for others to refute be a form of seeking reassurance?
Text:
I've never thought of it as reassurance seeking but now I suspect it might be? I almost always never directly ask anyone I know for reassurance I don't know why (maybe because of my stupid self-esteem that wouldn't allow me to ask for help), but I will say bad things about myself when the occasion allows such as "I'm such a \_\_\_\_\_\_ (e.g. narcissistic, selfish) person" or "I'm terrible at \_\_\_\_\_\_ (e.g. writing)" or if someone compliments me I will reply with "thank you for saying that but I'm really not" "you're too nice but I really am \_\_\_\_\_ (bad adjective)". 

The people I'm speaking to will almost always reply with some form of "No, you're not \_\_\_\_\_\_ (bad adjective)" or "No, you're \_\_\_\_\_\_ (the opposite)". And then I'll reply with "thank you for saying that but I'm really not" "you're too nice but I really am \_\_\_\_\_ (bad adjective)" again 😭😭😭

I can't even tell whether or not I actually think I am bad though?? I think I might not believe I am actually narcissistic (or any other bad attribute I say I am), but this might just be me convincing myself because I am narcissistic? But I also do think I am a bad person??? I also apologize excessively.

This is either a weird way of reassurance seeking, a self esteem issue, or I'm just a plain egotistic narcissist who wants to hear other people praise me... Or it could be all three... I mean I might not even have OCD lol (my psychiatrist says I do, but I might have fooled myself and him) and if I don't have OCD and if I don't believe I am bad, then the only option left is...

I also question lot whether or not thinking too much about whether or not I am selfish/narcissistic (aka all the thoughts above) might also mean I'm a selfish/narcissistic person 😭

Title: Has anybody had this type of intrusive thoughts?
Text:
I was recently told I may have OCD by a psychiatrist. I’ve had intrusive thoughts pertaining to just about everything; however, I recently started having some intrusive thoughts that I really need to go away right now. 

  
There’s a long history behind it, but basically, I haven’t been the best girlfriend I could be to my boyfriend in the months that we’ve been dating. In fact, I’ve been pretty shitty overall. Nevertheless, he loves me, and I love him, and I’m trying to fix everything. The harmful actions I did to him in in the past have caused me to have intrusive thoughts where, out of a fear of losing or harming him, I end up, counterintuitively, thinking negative things about him as a person. These are things that I do not believe at all, and I want them out of my head. 

I just want to have a clear mind and experience this relationship, with this man I love so fondly, in a peaceful and happy way. 

  
Has anybody had intrusive thoughts like these? If so, how did you deal with them?

  
The only tangible solution I have for this issue right now is that I recently started taking sertraline, but thats about it.



Thanks :)

Title: Avoidance ocd
Text:
So in June I would get these horrible intrusive thoughts and for some reason I made a pact that if I ever drink alcohol or smoke the intrusive thought would actually happen(I don’t know why I did this). 

Till now I haven’t touched a sip of it out of fear of the intrusive thought happening. Also if I’m around cigarette I’ll slightly obsess over whether I’ve broken the pact through second hand smoke. It’s like even if I wanted to do these things I won’t out of fear of breaking this pact.

Title: Alcohol makes it much, much worse.
Text: Here’s your reminder that alcohol makes your symptoms worse. I drank a lot last night, and my existential OCD and overthinking is at its worst. Don’t drink guys, it’s not worth it. It feels good in the moment, but only makes things worse the following day.

Title: My experience with OCD
Text:
So I’ve been on meds (sertraline max dose) for almost a year now and honestly I’ve seen improvements on a lot of my unhealthy habits(?)

I’m currently in sophomore year and looking back at 7th-9th grade I’ve had really really bad dermatillomania. From scalp picking, ripping open bug bites and keratosis, and ripping ingrown hairs, to just picking at finger skin (it’s still not good but it’s progress) I think I’ve been good!

I had therapy for a good year and it’s helped so much, it wasn’t for my skin picking of course but when things were clearing in my head space I became less manic about my skin and have been able to focus on my health. Although I’d definitely say I don’t have as much experience as any adults here I do want to suggest that if you have any sort of problem, it’s just an obstacle you have to face and you can get through it!!! 🐟

Long story short, I have OCD and am thinking about getting a cat and I’m looking to hear some experiences of other people in this community! Thanks in advance. :)

Title: Misdiagnosis
Text: I was misdiagnosed as psychotic 2-3 times. And the thing is, I wish it were a correct diagnosis because mental illness other than psychosis does not feel different from personality failings while psychosis is biological, something that just happens to you rather than being a behavior, so getting that diagnosis made me finally feel clean and free and like it was a medical thing rather than my fault. And being told that it’s actually just OCD after all that makes me go into despair again. They said it’s OCD with delusions but not psychosis which I don’t fully understand. Anyway I feel so unclean now.

Title: Obsessed about building collapse and bridge collapse
Text:
Out of nowhere, I’ve developed some rather severe phobias. I’m curious about the origin of these fears. I’m particularly afraid of driving over bridges and being in buildings on the second floor. It’s quite irrational because logically, I know I’m safe. However, suddenly, I feel scared.

I’ve even started having panic attacks even when I’m at the mall on the second floor because I’m afraid the ground will collapse beneath me. This fear is getting worse and not better with exposure. I’m trying the DARE book for exposure, but each time I attempt to confront my fear directly, I experience traumatic panic attacks.

Title: Should I ask my therapist of I have OCD?
Text: To start off, for a few years I've had horrible anxiety. In the past year I have had a lot more rising up. Whenever I had a conversation with someone, I would rethink the conversation for hours because I thought I was rude or said something wrong. Now, when I think things, I go 'What if someone cause read my thoughts and the tell people" Then I get extremely anxious. Over the summer I drove myself to thinking what if the world isn't real. I couldn't eat certain foods because they were laced. When I take pills that aren't my normal ones, I think I will die. I repeat the words "I am safe, I am secure, I am loved" all the time when I am scared. I check my neck to make sure I have a pulse. I tap my fingers all the time over and over with the phrase "Wake up" and if I don't something bad will happen and it doesn't work if there is anything between my fingers. I have so many unwanted thoughts. I am scared that people know what I do on my phone even if there is no reason they would know. I have to sleep with the ceiling fan on or it's wrong. I feel like I am falling apart and I am not sure what to do because even though I think I might have OCD I think what if I'm pretending I am having these symptoms.

Title: Hair twisting/photo checking hair
Text:
I should mention I’ve never been diagnosed with ocd, I just know I am a habitual fidgeter since I’ve been a kid. To add context I shaved my head in 2020 when I was at a low point. Since then I’ve fixated on my hair that has made friends/family comment on it. I’ve taken over thousands of photos multiple times a day to assure myself my hair was intitally growing in even. Then it spiraled into checking my hair to make sure everything was even consistency and length. Where I feel it’s thin I can’t stop myself from raking my fingers through it, subconsciously and consciously. 
It’s beginning to take over a good portion of my mind and time. I have to cut it to bob length since it was so upsetting. I want my hair longer but I don’t know what I can/should do to help my brain move on from this feeling I’ve had.

Title: Intrusive thoughts about getting intrusive thoughts
Text:
I find myself trying to go about my day, and I constantly worry my brain will choose something or someone I interact with to latch onto and create an intrusive thought about.

Or if I'm enjoying myself, I worry an intrusive thought will pop up and ruin it, which usually causes it to indeed show up.

When I am not trying to deal with the thoughts, I worry about them showing up and I try to predict when it will happen. I don't want to do this either, but like intrusive thoughts themselves, I can't control it anymore.

Any advice is welcomed. It feels like my brain refuses to NOT worry about something, anything, and I just want it to end.

Title: breakup and moving triggered OCD
Text: Hey guys. Recently I (f, 24) started ruminating real bad again, after I experienced a lot of change. I went through a break up, lost my previous friend group as a result, moved out from my parents house to a new city for university, made a lot of new friends and (like this wasn't already enough) started to question my sexuality. Actually everything changed in my life and I'm starting from scratch. And now that I'm slowly adapting I'm suddenly really uncomfortable and anxious. It is so weird sometimes. ACTUALLY I'm very happy right now, I managed to leave a toxic relationship and my life really changed for the better. I love it here! But somehow I'm stuck with this specific pattern, where I constantly and obsessively check in with my emotions and thoughts. I always question how i'm feeling at the moment. The thing is I know how OCD works, I know that the constant questioning influences my mood and disconnects me from the presence moment. However the last few weeks I just can't stop the thinking about the thinking about the thinking. It makes me so sad to ruin beatiful moments, just because I keep repeating "you feel weird right know, don't you?" in my head. Right now I'm at that point, where I start to experience derealization and depersonalisation again. Last time I felt this way, was 2-3 years ago. Probably I'm just struggling to process all the change that is going on in my life rn. Any tips to calm my overwhelmed mind? I just want to enjoy again! (sorry for the grammar, not a native speaker)

Title: Medical OCD, worried that I am dying!!!
Text:
This is not a joke, regardless of how dumb this all sounds maybe to you, it feels very real for me. I just am hoping for some reassurance or anything ...ANYTHING that came make me feel better to be honest, that I'm working myself up over potentially nothing and am assuming the worst.

Back in September I was (happy) anxious over something, my appetite waxed and waned a bit, but I still ate (pretty) normally. I noticed one day at work that my pants felt a little looser, my belt also felt a little to. This started a snowball effect of panic for me for the last month and a half. I went home, and weighed myself, I was 147. My normal was somewhere around 149-151. My waist was 31", which is around normal. All of my normally tight pants were easier to put on, so I know something changed right? For the next week or two, I just kept an eye on all of that, weight, waist, and clothing fit. Always fell somewhere between 147-149 and waist was always 30.75" - 31.5". Then I noticed at work that my belly button was soft and ill-formed. It wasn't taught or defined looking, it was soft and squishy, I also noticed below my navel, my lower abdomen was like...flat, and I could suck it into my body, so then I really freaked out. My stomach in general was more jiggly and malleable and not taught and distended like it usually is, for example, I could put on a tight pair of pants that the act of cinching the pants made my navel squish. I have rolls around my waist where my ribs are that I could pull on and poke when I sat crouched, and my breasts felt floppier. Then the next day I noticed the skin under my breasts felt crepey, or loose, like they've been deflated, and my nipples felt floppy and not hard, but it was all only even evident when lying flat. Then its just been one thing after another, my nose feels softer and smaller, like the head of my nose is shrinking, feel like my earlobes are dropping, the corners of my mouth are looser,  my shoulders feel bonier, my butt seems like it may becoming softer? I look pale, My skin is EXCEPTIONALLY soft right now, I mean everywhere, it is like BABY soft. And my skin everywhere feels like, loose from my skeleton or like more plump/saggy(?), my nails feel thinner, my hair seems thinner, my hairs pluck out easier.

Again, my weight is still 147ish, waist pretty much the same, I have had diarrhea off and on, my appetite also is off and on, and is highly dependant on how nervous I am and time of day (for example, I wake up anxious, food is a struggle, feel confident towards dinner and starving, gobble 4 slices of pizza). I FORCE MYSELF TO get to 1200 calories a day so the appetite thing shouldn't matter fyi.  

My BF, who sees me every day says I'm losing my damn mind and he's felt and looked at EVERYTHING I'm worried about and always says "it feels like it's always felt' or "it feels normal" or "you're hyperfocusing on things that were always there that you never paid attention to before". I took photos of my face, same angle, place, lighting as a photo from 4 months ago and my face looks pretty much exactly the same, lips, nose, folds, shadows, etc...but every part of my body FEELS different, and I know for a damn fact my stomach is flatter and weirder.

I've pretty much had to budge on going to a doctor now (even though I have white coat syndrome) cause I've never been this paranoid and concerned about pretty much any disease in my life, and I am someone who was diagnosed when I was 17 with a hypochondriac disorder. That being said, all because I am a hypochondriac doesn't mean I am impervious to disease, and that's what keeps my up at night. 

I'm worried about Cachexia, << this is like my kryptonite rn, I'm deathly afraid that my body is wasting away and I have undiagnosed cancer. Cachexia is often the FIRST sign you have cancer, and is associated with terminality. It's progressive muscle and fat wasting WITH OR WITHOUT WEIGHT LOSS, and regardless of eating, causes appetite loss, loose skin, body changes, skin changes, nail brittleness, etc. 


Again, I have a scheduled appt, I'm freaking out tho in the meantime. After reading this, and what I am worried this is, does it seem like I'm dying? Is there any reason to think this is NOT cachexia? Any reassurances?
