Title: High functioning OCD
Text: So I was recently diagnosed with high functioning OCD and I was asked if I wanted to try to self manage or try medication. Does anyone else here have HFOCD and how are you managing ? Also, what is it like ?

Title: What medication effectively treats OCD?
Text:
Therapy is touted as the most effective solution but it will never truly remove obsessive and compulsive tendencies from your mind. It can help you manage them more effectively but that's about it.

The pharmacological route is also not ideal. Drugs come with side effects and there's no treatment that works ideally either.The SSRI's are pretty much useless for many OCD patients. The only thing that seems to work until you build a tolerance is a high dose of opioids or benzodiazepines so you just don't care about anything that much. But that puts you on a fast track to running your life so I don't recommend.

In your experience, what medication substantially reduces or eliminates OCD symptoms?

Title: Contamination OCD
Text:
Hi all,

I have OCD in other parts of my life that I’ve managed to work around (mostly around checking  on something repeatedly) but I’ve always had a separate thing around food. 

I was doing okay around it but today while sifting a brand new bag of flour  I found larve shell casings. Immediately threw it out along with the item I was baking but now the thought of eating anything is making me gag. It’s not healthy to have this mindset and I try to fight it but it’s so hard not to inspect every bite of food I take.

I don’t have anyone to talk to about it so I’m asking for tips and tricks for how you all deal with COCD issues!  TIA

Title: Doubting that it's even OCD
Text:
I've been having pedophilic thoughts for just over a month now. I'm starting to doubt whether it's even OCD anymore :( 

This may be a little TMI, but I have never "fantizised" about children like I have with adults. I also don't plan on it. But the thoughts I get tell me I really want to do something to loads of poor children, or that I'll lose control and molest one. Doesn't matter what they look like. From 0-17, if its a minor, my brain is going to do something unpleasant and make me feel like I want to sexually assault it. I hate it I hate it I hate it. It feels so real. I don't like this at all. I wish it would go away. 

Like, when I kind of "forget" that I'm getting intrusive thoughts, I can look at kids normally, be around them etc (except I might find them kind of annoying because I'm not a big fan of kids anyway). But then I remember 'Hey kids are making you anxious' then BOOM. Intrusive thought. This happened last night. From 1pm-2am I was fine!! Then I was on Instagram reels at night, saw a child, got an intrusive thought about performing a sex act and have been ruminating on it since. I hate it. Why is my brain telling me I like this. I don't want to. I've been around kids before. DIDN'T FEEL A GODDAMN THING. LITERALLY DIDN'T EVEN FEEL COMFORTABLE HELPING ONE GO TO THE BATHROOM. Literally right as I'm writing this I got an intrusive thought about how I should have gone in the bathroom with her because I would have liked it. WHY. SHUT THE FUCK UP.

Part of me is feeling like 'Of course it's OCD. You never thought like this before your anxiety was triggered' but I'm scared I've had a sudden revelation or something and I actually do like kids. I'm also looking at the past and wondering if I've been attracted to children in the past (I'm 20, and I've only been attracted to people my age or older but I'm doubting that now for some reason). 

This might initially sound homophobic but I promise it isn't. I'm scared that I am a pedophile and it's similar to how a lot of gay people think. Like, if you come from a homophobic family they might think 'I don't want to be gay. I hate this.'. I'm getting this but with pedophilia. I don't want to be a pedophile. I'm literally in love with 2 male celebrities twice my age. I feel like I'm going crazy and if I am actually a pedophile I'm going to kill myself. This just feels so real and I don't like it. I'm continuously gaslighting myself, saying that I do like it and that this is what I want BUT IT'S NOT. I JUST WANT TO BE NORMAL. 

Even as I reread this I'm telling myself this sounds too much like a pedophile disorder than OCD. I want to cry so bad

Title: extreme fear of death
Text:
i need help. i’m 20F and i’m having the worst  surrounding the topic of death. it’s debilitating, my heart beat keeps going up and i’m constantly crying and my appetite is low. 
i’ve had a phase like this a year ago and it randomly came back just recently and it’s been a week now of me feeling like this. 

im terrified of death. i don’t want it to happen. i don’t want to stop being aware.i want everyone i love to stay and i cry immediately when i think of the fact that i will be dead forever, my brain crashes when i try to imagine what it’s like to be dead, to be nothing. it’s impossible to imagine it and it freaks me out. nothing is calming me down. i’m reading through many reddit posts of people going through the same fear and i’m reading advice from reddit and nothing has calmed me down. 

i just want something more to be out there after my life. i don’t want it to be nothing, that’s terrifying. i want one of those theories to be true like living my life on loop, any afterlife, reincarnation, religion, something. but i know that these theories come from us humans needing comfort and needing to feel like there’s “something more out there” but in reality and scientifically, there is not. i’m terrified of no afterlife. i’m tired of being terrified of something that is out of my control and  i just need help. how can i start looking at death in a positive way? how can i work towards accepting it? i have people i love that i never want to leave.even if i didn’t, the thought of me not being conscious forever is taking a toll on my mental health. please help me

i am not professionally diagnosed with OCD but i have had many OCD symptoms throughout my life.

Title: As someone diagnosed with autism I'm having trouble getting people to take my concerns about OCD seriously
Text:
I'm diagnosed with autism, ADHD and anxiety. I have some issues I suspect might be OCD. They might also not be OCD, but I feel like I'm having trouble even having this conversation with anyone. It's an even bigger problem for my autistic sister, who I will elaborate on later. 

Lately I have been blinking excessively in response to feeling anxious I'm not paying attention. So it can happen when I'm doing something like playing video games, which just makes me do worse. I spoke to my therapist who said it was autistic stimming. I really don't think that's correct. I know what stimming feels like, it feels soothing. This feels the opposite of soothing. Also, unlike stimming, I can attach it to a very specific anxiety and thought pattern. 

I also have obsessive rumination about past instances where I was mistreated or abused. It's a serious problem that interferes with my life and my friends, no matter how compassionate and patient they may be, are tired of hearing the same thing over and over. When I raised concerns about OCD, my therapist said it was an "insult to my trauma." Of course she may be correct and it's trauma and not OCD, but I don't see why she can't at least take it seriously. I spoke to my neuropsychologist briefly who didn't take it seriously either, but I could try mentioning it again. I have a couple of friends who believe I might have OCD and one of them is diagnosed with both OCD and autism. 

My sister has autism and this has been an even bigger issue for her. She's not entirely independent and to make a long story short I have a kind of unclear and unofficial caregiver role over her which I'm not entirely happy about. To be completely frank I want her to get treated in part because her obsessions interfere with my life. She has an obsessive fear of contamination and excessive worry about doing things "correctly." For instance if a glass object breaks she has persistent worries about broken glass being in objects for days after, even after thorough cleaning and inspection. My parents claim she is not in emotional distress and merely "does not understand" which is an interpretation I strongly disagree with. During her most recent neuropsych I spoke to the evaluator who did not take my concerns seriously enough to test her for OCD. After the evaluation was done I wrote a long email listing incidents where she behaved like someone with OCD, and she admitted I have valid cause for concern but said she can't test her for it and referred me to an independent OCD clinic who also rejected her as a client.

Another frustration I have is the general internet conversation about "intrusive thoughts." It seems impossible to have a rational conversation about telling apart an intrusive thought from unpleasant urges. Like if someone says they want to punch someone in the face people will respond "that's an intrusive thought, it's normal, everyone has it" except that's not true because sometimes people genuinely just feel a desire to punch someone in the face. 

So in summary here are the issues I want feedback on.

* I want to be able to tell apart autistic rumination and anxiety from OCD obsessive thinking and nobody has been able to help me, and I'm not sure what to do.

* Even if I do not have OCD I want to figure out what this fucking blinking thing is and how to stop it. Isn't it possible I could have an OCD symptom without having full blown OCD? Or maybe it's tourettes or something I have no idea. I do NOT believe it is autistic stimming. 

* If anyone has advice on how to get myself and/or my sister a high quality official evaluation for OCD I would appreciate it. 

* If anyone has any resources that are intelligent and in depth about the subject of intrusive thoughts versus non-intrusive thoughts I would be interested.

Title: How can I support my brother/ what can we do?
Text:
Hi, I have suspected my brother may have OCD, apologies if I am wrong, I have done the most research I can because it runs in the family and would like to be educated, I remember my grandmother had it and his behavior reminds me a lot of her. I want to help him because my parents are not willing to help him emotionally as it takes a lot of their energy for which I understand but I know my brother needs support from somewhere. He is so ashamed he cannot talk about it with anyone outside of immediate family, so any advice is greatly appreciated. Ever since he was little up until now (he is 16) I have noticed a lot of behavior linking to OCD but to not make this post so lengthy I will only include behavior from the last few months. Recently he came to my parents and me and told us he has been having a lot of intrusive thoughts that make him extremely uncomfortable and question his own morals or identity, I had to tell him what intrusive thoughts were and how I have them too so I can somewhat understand what he is going through. His thoughts consist of very awful things, the worst you can think about like incest,bestiality,pedophilic things, etc. He says it makes him feel dirty and he constantly washes his hands up to his elbow to the point where his skin is very irritated with rough patches and red skin, he also uses an abnormal amount of soap or bodywash in the shower and uses very hot water. He is afraid of contaminating anything he touches when he has these intrusive thoughts, he told me he is afraid that he might be attracted to his cousin because he follows a woman on instagram who looks kind of similar to her, he is also afraid he is a pedophile because of the intrusive thoughts he gets when he sees a child. I have tried to reassure him the most I can, telling him he is not a bad person because he knows he is NOT attracted to children and he does NOT want to date his cousin, he says his brain is messing with him and convincing him that he is the worst person ever for thinking these things even though he knows he is not a pedophile or into incest. He is restless and extremely stressed for the majority of the day and night because these thoughts dont leave him alone and he fixates on them, I don't know what I can offer him because he refuses to look for help online even anonymously, he has ADHD but my parents decided not to medicate him because he had a heart murmur that has healed up when he was little and they were afraid it would be harmful. I am 18 years old and do not have the money nor can I convince my parents to get him medication or therapy because he also does not like those things. Be honest and let me know what should be done, I don't want him to feel alone.

Edit: He also VERYYY often asks for reassurance, and he doesnt seem to stop for hours sometimes. It's like he never actually feels reassured I feel like he eventually stops because he feels guilty for asking and not because he feels better.

Title: The worst thing ever has happened and I literally don't know how to cope and how I'll get over this (TW for contamination OCD, bugs, spoiled food)
Text: So yesterday I was in the living room and saw 2 white worms on the ceiling. My OCD is too extreme I couldn't even imagine being in indirect contact with them so I vacuumed them as good as I could and sanitised myself afterwards. But this morning, there were at least 15 of them on the ceiling. My mother left her food to rot in the shelf and she didn't even tell me she left a bag of food open, without any protection. Though, I tell her all the time she can't do that because it makes me spiral and today, she made my worst fear happen. We literally had an invasion of these worms in the shelves in which we keep most of our food. They were crawling everywhere and I made her clean the whole thing. Told her to sanitise everything and throw away everything that was prone to having worms in it. I led me to be unable to walk in the kitchen or in the living room and now, I don't even know how I'll even manage to step in these rooms. Everything just feels to unsafe and contaminated without any solution to solve this. I don't know what to do. I'm so angry at my mother. I'm done with her never being careful. In what world is it even okay to do that and have a whole invasion of worms in FOOD WE CONSUME??? I'm done. I want to die. I just can't cope with this. Everything is spoiled and ruined forever now. Sorry if it doesnt make any sense but it's the worst I've even felt. I'm sure I swallowed a worm accidentally since she was so uncareful and I don't see how I'll ever be clean again after that. She ruined everything. She ruined my life.

Title: You Can Talk to Me
Text:
Hello!

Throwaway account for obvious reasons. I wanted to make this post to invite people who feel hopeless or like they have spiralled too far down to ever be able to be the same, to talk to me.

I have been dealing with OCD, mainly POCD, as well as a other similar branches of OCD for around three years now, and I have seen it all. Whatever you may be holding inside, which is breaking you down day by day, I am here to talk about it, and hopefully give you some sense of relief and logic to help you see it from a fresh set of eyes. Remember, your brain is at war with you, and it is targeting your weak points.

Just to briefly summarise my situation; when it originally started, I did not even know I had OCD, and was naturally petrified. After about 1.5 years I finally got help, and for the past year I have been working towards recovery, but it is a difficult path with MANY dips, often reaching new extents to my OCD which I had never even dealt with before therapy, Anyways, I know first hand what to do, and what NOT to do, including what therapists will often recommend you. I think I am more than qualified to know what works and what doesn't.

Anyways, this is just an invitation to DM me if you feel hopeless or alone. I know you have heard it before, but you are a victim - not the bad guy. When therapists first started telling me that, I hated to hear that. I thought: "How can you possibly call someone with these thoughts the victim, and even worse, how can you feel sorry and sympathy towards me?" I hated it beyond words, but now I am getting to a point where I am usually able to convince myself that that is the case.

Well, that's all. DMs are open if you think it could benefit you. One of the best tools to recovery is to be involved in the community, and hear it from people who understand your struggles.

I worked through my trauma, but I still suffer with intrusive thoughts daily, and most of them aren’t even centered around the trauma thoughts. Is it possible for PTSD and OCD diagnoses to be confused? Or is it possible for one person to have both? I’m just trying to wrap my head around everything

Title: Prozac/fluexotine
Text:
Just started this med at a very small dose about a week ago.

I’ll say my compulsions have subsided but I give that mostly to therapy. My anxiety I guess has decreased but my obsessions- I can’t tell if they have increased or stayed the same and I’m reacting different. 

I feel more sadness over them now and still some fear. For reference, my ocd currently revolves around traumatic events where I see myself as the culprit. Bad choices I’ve made etc. I still feel the ocd fears - will I go to jail in the future will I be hated, etc. But, now the feeling is more dread and sadness than anxiety and trying to figure things out.

I guess I’m wondering if this is normal? Is this something that improves once I’ve been on the medication longer? This is my first time being treated for my OCD.

Title: My experience with OCD right now is at it's best
Text:
I'm aware of my OCD and its presence appearing quite often around people. I think it's one of the reasons why I'm a loner cause when I'm alone I'm more relaxed. I got better with medications for my mood swings. Prior to the right diagnosis I'd been only labeled as OCD with depression when in fact I have OCD with Bipolar disorder.

The road to where I am right now was tough because some people whom I shared my thoughts with knowing my weakness would exploit it if possible because of competition or some other insecurities of theirs. There's bound to be conflicts and people who would exploit ones they see as weaker. The only solution I have is to not take it personally and become stronger. The point I'm making is I am stronger than those triggers because self-awareness.

I let my emotions take a passenger seat and my logic and mind the driver. A monk whom I respect once told me, "Thoughts are combinations of good and bad. You just have to throw away those that harms you like taking out fishbones when you eat fish." Simple as that train your mind to disrupt the old habits.

Thoughts we have that causes OCD, rumination and patterns of behaviors to cope those compulsions are a norm to others. Someone else without OCD will be able to discard it as some unimportant thought. You can overcome it like them when your way of thinking is rewired or you have more control over your mind.

The key is self-awareness people do this differently for me I like to read, write and meditate (I force myself to cause it helps). Others might enjoy drawing, running or other sports. Those moments where you're alone with your thoughts while doing something to keep focus on you can gradually be in control of some part and not let your OCD rule all the time. This helps me a lot having Pure O-OCD where my compulsions are thoughts to counter the OCDs.

Nowadays my OCD is no longer a big part of life. Although I still have it I would say I'm able to discard it faster than I used to. As for people disrupting my peace I try to see it as normal part of life because everyone goes through it and sometimes it's not a problem with me but rather the provoker's own problems.

This ability to let go more easily I would credit it to both Buddhism and Stoicism because they teach me to focus on the important things in life and let go of the rest. Also not to take things personally and be aware of the importance of a peaceful mind, spending time wisely and some sense of direction in life.

I hope by sharing my story it would inspire you and give you the strength to overcome your battles.

Title: I Don’t Have OCD
Text:
No, I’m not asking for sympathy or reassurance or attention or anything like that, I just really need to get this off my chest right now. 

I’m a liar, I’ve always been a liar, since I was a kid. I am selfish, and ungrateful, rude, manipulative, and dangerous. 

I’ve had these horrible thoughts since I was around 7, I’m 15 now. I think I just wanted some kind of excuse for why I was so horrible, so I could tell myself that it wasn’t really me thinking these things, I could just blame it on my OCD. I did extensive research on OCD, I’m scared I might have placeboed myself into having symptoms because I wanted it to be true so badly. I needed it to be true, because if it wasn’t, then I was just a disgusting, vile human being. 

It’s been just about a year since I was diagnosed, I was at a CBT appointment today, and my therapist wanted to work on separating me from my OCD. I just broke down. I am so selfish, stealing this spot from someone who actually needs it just so I can make myself feel better about being a monster. Because the truth is, there is no me separate from the OCD, it’s all just me, I am the monster. I’ve convinced myself and all the people around me that the explanation for all my weird thoughts and behaviours wasn’t my fault, but it is. I’ve just been too scared and ashamed to admit it this whole time. 

I don’t know what to do, and I think maybe I should just stop taking my meds because they’re just encouraging my sick game.

Title: I'm a composer, and I wrote a duet for flute and piano that aims to shed some light on OCD
Text:
This piece is a theme and ten variations for flute and piano that attempts to describe my experience with OCD through music.

The piece starts with a beautiful melody, the theme, which represents all that is meaningful to me. The variations gradually alter this theme in various ways, ultimately turning it into a corrupted version of itself. This represents how OCD twists and eventually corrupts the things we care about. Parts of this piece will sound ugly, because OCD can be ugly. I chose the title "Grumpy Brain" because that is the name my wife gave to my OCD.

Does this piece resonate with you? I would love to hear your thoughts, and I hope you enjoy "Grumpy Brain."

Title: Distinguishing between OCD and normal hygiene
Text: So I have a question I’d like more opinions on. Before asking I should say I am diagnosed with OCD and my struggles are mostly related to cleanliness/contamination. I wanted some third party opinions about kind of a debate me and my mom had today. So what happened is one of my dogs did the thing where they scoot their butt across a rug, and I wanted to clean the rug before I would step on it again. My mom is arguing that not being able to step on the rug without cleaning it first is a sign of my OCD worsening, while I’m arguing that it’s normal for someone to want to clean the rug first even ignoring the fact that I do have OCD. I have trouble with these situations because I realize that the OCD may be warping my perspective but at the same time I think that’s a normal boundary to have without bringing OCD into it.

Title: getting paranoia/delusions about other people, i googled for ages and hav eno idea if this is cause by OCD, can someone just tell me that i'm not alone
Text:
my problem is i also have GAD diagnosis and i can't tell the difference between GAD OCD or if it's something worse. my main example is i'm convinced my father is a pedophile. im getting false memory of my childhood trying to remember which version is true. i sit and think really hard for a long time over things my father has done weighing over the "evidence." there was a news article in my country recently about a man who killed his mother because he became convinced she was a pedophile and he was diagnosed with schizophrenia. i have no idea if this is caused by my OCD or some kind of delusion or even worse that the "evidence" is true 

i also get intense images when i walk past people in the street that they are going to push me into the road or stab me and some days i can't see a single man in the street without imagining him SAing me and getting really lost in it imagining how i would fight him off etc. i have to walk down a river to get to work and i get so scared every time someone walks past i always walk on the inside so they cant push me in. i picture it so vividly in my head sometimes i even start imagining my funeral and what picture of me they'll show on the TV news. i know people with HOCD get these thoughts about themselves hurting people but it's not HOCD because it's always other people hurting me or and its not POCD because i'm not the "pedophile. but everything i google just comes up with POCD and HOCD. can someone please tell me that they get these thoughts too and the same mental compulsions. i just have no idea what is causing these i feel delusional and crazy.

Title: scared of having cancer
Text: Hello, I have contamination OCD along side other themes. I started to wash my hands with bleach a few years ago. First it started of with incorprating thick bleach when washing my hands, I was using more and more each time. Then I changed to bleach spray and added dishwasher tablets. A year ago I stopped the bleach i'm not sure how but I guess the fumes/smell & my hands were really bad its great I did but the dishwasher tablet is still with me. Something about the granules make me feel like its scrubbing dirt off. Now I go through so many pods a day its out of hand. I thought of trying sea salt and thought that wont do anything. Randomly as I had the thought of how much i'm poisoning myself as I clean certain things with bleach and gives me headache. I checked whats in dishwasher tablets it seemed ok but I kept thinking I could literally get cancer from all of this. The headaches and dizziness. I thought of maybe using salt for the granules, to feel like it cleans. I know that would burn my skin. I thought of 'nail brush' but I would need so many new ones a day can't use the same ones. I'm wondering if I should just use a dish sponge which I sometimes do, the green scourer part to wash my hands. I would need like so many sponges a day but I don't mind that. I really don't know... I think i'm just killing myself...

I feel like I don't deserve anything because my past mistakes but my OCD is not that bad, has anyone been through this? I feel like I was lying and faking all the intrusive thoughts, all the compulsions and panic attacks.

Title: Third different psychiatrist: same diagnosis, different drugs. Stuck with the fear of starting medications.
Text:
Yesterday I went to a psychiatrist, after the first one in June and the second one in October.

Everytime I got out of the office I was compelled to look at the side effects of the drugs they prescribed me and get scared, especially the potential sexual side effects and the weight gain.

June: Xanax 0.5mg + Ability 5mg
October: Effexor XR 75mg + Abilify 5mg + Xanax 0.5mg
November: Paxil 20mg + Xanax 0.5mg

I have a partner, and my OCD is about obsessive retroactive jealousy, repetitive intrusive thoughts, images and mental movies about her past of which I asked too much about, and she realized later how pathological my curiosity was, but it was already too late given all the intimate details I was already aware.

Sex with my partner is still great though, and I have a good physical shape, I would define myself as an athlete with a fit body. I am really scared to lose both my physical appearance and my sexual capacities.

I know that refusing to take medications is a part of my OCD problem and my constant research of drugs side effects is a trick played by my OCD need for certainty, but I really don't know how to get out of this. 

My partner says that whatever the sexual dysfunctions would be, we would sort them out because we love each other at a much deeper level than lust. I want to trust her but still, my pride and my ego still makes me scared of the meds.

Has any of you taken the medications written above? Or has any of you faced sexual dysfunctions and/or weight gain as side effects of others drugs? How did you manage them? Because knowing that even if they appeared, there would be a way to get around them, or fix them, would make me more motivated to start.

Title: Finding a non erp therapist?
Text:
I just got diagnosed with OCD over the summer, even though I now see have definitely had OCD symptoms since childhood. I started seeing an OCD therapist and the education has been amazing, I didn't realize so many things were compulsions. But some of the things she's said or suggested are rubbing me the wrong way. I am in recovery from an eating disorder and a lot of her ideas are just reminiscent of eating disorder treatment, just do the exposure and sit in discomfort and you'll be fine. Ultimately that kind of treatment only led to relapses for my ED. What helped was looking at things deeper, validating worries. Less CBT style, maybe more of an IFS lens, I'm not sure? But not being so dismissive and invalidating?

She's also dismissive if she thinks something is an eating disorder thought vs an ocd obsession. She's very black and white, which doesn't feel good to me. I don't know if that's specific to ERP.  

Does anyone have suggestions for finding an OCD therapist who doesn't use ERP? It's just really not resonating. I feel like every OC organization says erp is the only way, but it is not feeling right for me.

Title: Why won’t they prescribe me clomipramine?
Text:
I’ve been suffering immensely due to OCD ever since I was forced to stop taking sertraline a year ago (it was making me act crazy and I even got arrested for reasons I will not specify).

Now my OCD is at its very worse, I have frequent meltdowns because I can’t handle my intrusive thoughts anymore, I’m upsetting my family with my constant anxiety attacks, especially at night, and I‘ve even given myself 2 black eyes from literally punching myself in the face.

They’ve told me about clomipramine a few times, yet they still won’t fucking prescribe it. Instead they just keep increasing my mirtazapine/olanzapine which I’ve been taking for several months and DO NOT WORK IN THE SLIGHTEST. I’ve begged them to let me try clomipramine but everyone keeps saying “oh but that’s not the way it works, we have to keep seeing if your current medication works” when it VERY CLEARLY DOES NOT.

I’ve read about experiences with clomipramine on this sub and they all seem pretty positive. I can’t take another week of this living hell and I’m convinced that clomipramine is what I need. Yet they just will not prescribe it to me.

Title: First time father with OCD - crazy levels of overthinking and anxiety.
Text:
Hey there, we recently had our first child. A little daughter after many years of trying. She was over 4 weeks premature and spent a week or so in NICU. We have her home now the past 5 days and to say my OCD has kicked in horribly would be an understatement. 

I am constantly overthinking and catastrophizing the worst possible things that can happen. She has reflux so is not sleeping well at all and sounds under pressure when she is down in her cot. The hospital were happy tor discharge her but I can't help thinking she is not ok. For example I have spent the last two nights wide awake from 1am to about 8am just watching her in her cot to make sure everything is ok. I won't be able to keep running on very little sleep so I will have to try correct this. I also have other first time father concerns like feeding and winding her but I'm trying to get on with that. I really want to do as much as I can and not leave it all to my partner but I did go missing today doing other work around the house to avoid doing anything with the baby. It's not that I'm lazy, it's just that I'm actually terrified. My partner is great and she is so understanding but I really want to make it easier for her by pulling my weight and getting stuck in. 

A history of bad OCD and now severe lack of sleep is creating a perfect storm of overthinking and crazy levels of anxiety. As I said my main concern is when she is down in the cot and breathing. It's crazy the dark places your brain will go when it's the middle of the night and you're just watching a child you love so much try to sleep. Not easy to admit this but I've been very upset a few times since she has come home due to worrying so much. 

I need to try calm down about it, was even considering contacting my doctor to try get Xanax, etc but then again I don't want to be taking anything while trying to stay sharp and awake watching my child. 

I appreciate any help or advice for anyone who has gone through this? From fathers or mother's.

Title: Teen Crisis (NSFW)
Text:
I am on an alt account bc my family uses reddit and social media quite often.
I am 16. I am quite a socially anxious person and have been diagnosed with OCD. Despite me going to my schools 'wellbeing support', I find it useless (perhaps I'm just not into therapy or smth idk). 

My parents are very open to mental well-being, but I despise talking about it because it makes me incredibly anxious and nauseous.

Everyone I look at, my mind tells me to kill. Previously, I didn't believe I could, but now I feel like I could like 'snap' (idk if that's the word). I think its also because I have been more internally angry/irritated, but I don't like to express it, because I'm generally known as a nice person in school. I think about harming myself and that I feel like I'm suffering because of these thoughts.

My mind is telling me that my friends have abandoned me because we haven't talked in a week, and now I'm believing that. My head is telling me to hate them, but I want to trust them, but I suck at trusting people. At the same time, it feels like they have abandoned me.

I'm so sensitive bro, I literally cried after my mum gave me food that was filled to the top of the bowl. I hate when people do that, I'm not a big eater, and it feels so wasteful. 

This probably makes me sound like a bad person. At this point, I'm just ranting, I just don't know what to do. This sounds so self-abnoxious, sorry. This is also like my first ever reddit post, so this is probably too long, sorry. I can answer questions if you have any and I've probs broken some rules on the subreddit aswell, sorry.

“I am ace and repulsed. I am not aromantic. I watched an animated show where there was hand holding, hugging, kissing (it is animated though)

Romantically, I may want a spouse who is also ace and repulsed. I may want to do some of the things (that are not inappropriate) that were in the show. What does that mean?

I have OCD, some of which has to do with false attraction and feelings.

Thank you, I am sorry about confusion.”

Title: Obssesion with parents' health
Text: I was diagnosed with OCD at 12 years old. Now I'm 17. Last two days I've been in my worst OCD crisis in months. It all started when I was finishing my Baccalaureate's investigation work (Bachillerat, Treball de Recerca where I live), which I already struggled to finish because of my obssesion with things being perfect and complete, when I listened to my parents talking about my mother's illness (since 3 years ago doctors have been trying to diagnose her without a conclusive diagnose) so I searched information on the web about a disease called OPD that I suspected she could have (I PRAY MY HUNCH IS WRONG) and I'M SPIRALING since then. I started to literally shake, cry, have dark fantasies and wouldn't sleep and asking A LOT of questions to my mother about her general health, medical historial. Tonight I feel slightly better than last night but only because I tried to overcome my compulsion, which wasn't giving me the answers my mind wants. Since then I got no peace of mind. I'm still feeling anxious and cry silently alone sometimes. My mother has the medical tests till NEXT month. I'm desperate. Please, is someone out there who is/have been in the same or similar situation?

It just feels like I can't live normally, I can't even leave a room without these compulsions I have to go back in and out to make sure I have done it correctly 

Any advice to help? I really am trying to beat this

Title: I need some help about one topic that could some people trigger (ocd/pocd)
Text:
I'm 18 years old student and I have girlfriend. She is 17 years old. In my school I have a lot of friends, from my class and others. But last few months they make every day jokes that I'm p*dophile.

(This joke was randomly made by my friend because I'm an 'adult' as 18 and my girlfriend is still kid as 17.)

At first I just laughed about it, and just found it as dumb joke. Of course its not something to laugh about, but earlier I just didnt cared and just laughed.

But when I heard it every day, almost five times at school. I started to feel uncomfortable. Even other l students in different classes knew about this joke, so they used it too.

It started to be uncomfortable, and the worst thing was when I questioned myself "Am I that what they say?"

So last two months I did every day research about POCD and pedophilia. I was damn afraid and still that I am. I started to feel anxious and felt like my brain still tells me "Yes. Yes you are." 
I'm really stressed and uncomfortable by this. I never acted by some intrustive toughts. But I still have them and I feel so ashamed and horrible.

I really don't know what to do and how to stop that intrustive toughts.

Title: DAE freak out over calls and texts not being answered?
Text:
There's been a few times when my husband is away for either work or with friends, I message him around a time we would normally talk and he doesn't reply. I call, no answer. And idk how it gets to the point where I'm suddenly calling over and over and using location to find him because I scare myself into thinking he's hurt or dead. I just get this I NEED TO KNOW thing.

In the end he always answers within at most 6 calls and he asks if i want to talk to whoever hes with and they also let me know everything is okay, that he's okay.

It happened tonight again. He knows I struggle with this sometimes and he is understanding and apologizes for not answering right away.

We both keep our phones on vibrate and I know I'm sometimes bad with not realizing he's calling me either when I'm busy doing something.
I feel ashamed of myself for reacting that way.

Title: Took a Diagnostic Test: It Explains A Lot / Sleep Help!!
Text:
Not diagnosed on paper, but my psych and I did a thorough diagnostic, which showed me on the low end of OCD.

Not to be dramatic, but OCD is ruining my life. I did not see or realize that it hurts my quality of life the way it does. And it took me a week or two to really understand and see it in my life.

My main fixation at the moment is Sleep. I have PTSD, and I have been struggling with nightmares for over a decade. This past year, I have also developed nasty allergies that worsen at night for no known reason. Even though I’m getting both treated and the treatments are improving those issues, I have become absolutely terrified of sleeping.

Even if I’m really tired, I subconsciously do everything I can to stay awake. I tell myself it’s not that late, find productive things to do (suddenly remember I have to do something urgent tomorrow and feel the need to do it tonight, etc.), doom scroll, look at the clock, feel guilty and doom scroll some more. I am almost always tired but I can’t seem to move past this and go to sleep.

I’ve already developed a sleep disorder from this. I go to bed very VERY late, and get up very late too, sometimes way past 8 hours and into the 12 hours sphere. I still wake up horribly exhausted and am not productive into way further in the day than I’d like.

I’m scared and I want to sleep peacefully again. I used to have the skill to fall asleep within 5 min, and now it can take me an hour or so. I’m a grad student that is stupid busy, and this is not sustainable for me. I’m also scared all the time. It’s exhausting.

TLDR: I am afraid of sleeping and compulse. Please help me find a way to relax before bed and go to sleep.

Title: Does your reassurance ever backfire?
Text:
Hi!

So I have a cat and she is my whole, whole world. Today she is acting funny and feeling sick. I can’t afford to take her to the vet right now and I have unrelenting guilt about it. I know it’s not my fault, but my intrusive thoughts tell me it is over and over. I keep ruminating on the most awful things possibly happening to my baby. So while I check my other options, I am reaching out to friends and family for reassurance. But when I told them she’s been acting strange they say “oh yeah that’s not good” “somethings definitely up” etc. and idk what else I expected them to say but it made me feel so much worse!! Now it’s 1 am and I refuse to sleep because I have to watch her till morning. Have you ever had reassurance backfire? Thank you!

This does eventually go away when I feel better, but it does return. Like after having a bad experience in someone’s house it just gives me the same feeling I used to get when I was scared of getting contaminated with diseases but instead being in the place just makes me feel guilt contaminated or dirty. I’m not sure if this is emotional contamination OCD or just depression or PTSD though. Let me know if you experience this and how have you dealt with it? It might also have some religious undertones i’m not sure about this either.

Title: Crisis. Coming off Olanzapine

Repetitive intrusive thoughts play 24/7 to the point where I'm very afraid I will lose touch with reality. This theme hasn't bothered me in years but seems to return when I come off certain medications, the last time I was hospitalized.

Title: OCD About Bed Bugs?
Text:
Well, this is a relatively new obsession that my brain has grabbed onto. As a disclaimer, I have never had bed bugs. I'm just afraid of ever finding out what it's like having to deal with them on top of everything else.

  
I recently purchased a secondhand sweater online from an Etsy shop that deals in selling vintage/pre-loved clothing. The item arrived, I took it out of its packaging (double packaged, no less!), and then left it by the washer to eventually wash when enough of a load accumulates. Now, I can't stop thinking that I should have washed it immediately, just in case there was a hitchhiker... It's likely too late now, but ugh. It's all my mind can focus on.

  
Anyone else with this same fear?

Title: Guilt and empathy
Text:
Hey all, just looking for support. I saw a similar post earlier but I wanted to but something separate out a bit more tailored to my own experiences.

I think about people in my life like my partner, my parents, and my brother and I think of their sweet and innocent sides and every bad thing I or anyone else has ever done to them just rushes through my head. I just feel so bad. Not just guilt, but an overwhelming feeling that - no matter what - I can’t take those things back and they will always, always have had to go through those things.

There are other facets to this that are harder to put into words, but I hope this gets my point across. My OCD tends to trick me into thinking I’m a sociopath and on one hand, it’s good to be reminded that I have love and care in my heart, it’s also this debilitating, hard-to-explain guilt.

Just need to get that out there. New to this community

Title: being obsessed with morality, existence, and purpose has fucked up my mindset entirely
Text:
i literally do not feel connected to anyone. everyone feels alien to me. when people do bad things without guilt i don’t fucking understand and i just try and try to get it, to literally no avail. 

i so stupid things just to avoid hurting others or being immoral. i throw myself in the line of fire for others, and yet i tell myself that i don’t do so at all, that im selfish and horrible. i’m terrified of being selfish. i’m terrified of being horrible.

i can’t focus any of the time, and the fact that i can’t fucking communicate this to anyone makes it even worse.

it’s to the point nothing feels real. i’ve questioned everything to the point that nothing matters to me even though i want it to. the only thing that terrifies me most of all is being alone in the future, because i put all my value in a romantic partner seeing worth in me.

even then, it’s never something sweet. to me, i have to constantly work, obsess over working, i have to be better than everyone else, but im not. i’m a stupid, lazy, useless fucking kid. i don’t know what i’m doing. i’m just sick of this shit. 

do other people, normal, well adjusted people, spend every MOMENT of their lives asking themselves “why am i doing this?”, “what sets me apart from an animal?”, “why does anything i do matter if im not changing anything in the world?”, “why does anything matter if i don’t FEEL anything doing it?”

i have no passion, no hobbies, no intent. i literally live like i’m dead. the only thing i care about is being loved, and it’s foolish and immature.

Title: I worry that something bad will happen if I don't pray every night, extensively, in detail.
Text:
For years, I thought this was simply religious indoctrination at play. However, after joining support groups, I realised that the obsession with the Genie Fallacy, believing that a tragedy is sure to come if I don't complete my rituals, is not novel or exclusive. 

In my place, would you just continue to pray or focus on embracing uncertainty? 

For context, I chant for around half an hour per day. The past week, I've been sick, so I stopped chanting out of sheer exhaustion, and now I'm wondering if this is another thing that I need to remedy.

Title: Fear of Wasting Money
Text:
(Age 25 female) I have OCD and this is my current situation.  My fear of wasting money has developed over the past few years. It takes over my life and it's on my mind 24/7. I've realized how much pointless money I was spending in my life on little things that added up to never having any money. So now I don't spend any unless I can justify that it's worth it. I am happy to spend a lot of money on something worth it, but every time I spend money and it feels like a waste I do everything I can try to get my money back. I return things to grocery stores multiple times a week after considering if what I bought was worth it. I spent 6 hours in a clothing store the other day to make sure everything I bought I wouldn't regret. For my friends wedding I kept the tag on the dress so I could return it the next day. I cannot fathom spending money on something that'll just sit around. I don't want any gifts from anyone unless I'll definitely use it because the thought of anyone spending unnecessary money makes me feel sick. When my mom and husband spend money I give them endless reasons of how we already have something etc..I have a methodical list in my head of everything we all own (my mom lives with me and my husband) and whenever either of them want to buy something unnecessary it makes my head spin. My husband makes $22 an hour and whenever he spends that much on something unnecessary I always remind him if it's worth an hour's worth of hard labor work. The other night he wanted a glass of wine at a very fancy place it was $18 for glass. I looked up the bottle and it said it's $20 for the same exact bottle when it was listed as $95 for the bottle at the restaurant. I would have been happy with him getting a glass of expensive wine if it was worth it, but the moment I found out how much of a scam it would have been I convinced him otherwise. 
Whenever I buy anything that I can no longer return and it isn't really worth it I think about it every single day until I can think of how to make it worth it. For example my husband came home with paper cups. I tore into him about how we have a million perfectly good cups and that we didn't need to spend $6 on paper cups. He said that it was too late to return it since he already used one. So I now am trying to think of as many ways to get the money worth. Making a designated cup to give my cats water,  plant watering cup, mouth wash cup, paint water cup, etc... If I cannot justify a purchase it eats me alive and I grieve the precious money that could have contributed to something we truly need in the future. I feel anxiety every day thinking about how much money I have lost in my life. A huge thing I massively regret is how much I have tipped in my life. If I calculated every tip I have given out it would actually make my head spin. So I have stopped tipping entirely. I always write a note saying I don't have enough to tip. I only tip if service is so extraordinary that it's like a little thank you. I used to tip people in fear that If I didn't they'd spit in my drink, but now my fear is that I'm giving a tip only when I can justify it in the same way as justifying all of my purchases. I wasn't always like this, and I miss not calculating every transaction my household makes.  I miss not crying because I cannot make decisions in grocery stores trying to figure out what is worth the value for health and satisfaction and not over paying. I miss getting unnecessary snacks and actually enjoying them. Now snacks just taste like a gluttonous waste of calories and money.

Title: 18+ ⚠️OCD is ruining my sexual life
Text:
ONLY 18+ ⚠️
NO MINORS.
Hello everyone, so I am 18M and as most people do, especially at this age, I am always in the mood to masturbate or have sex. I use to be someone to masturbate everyday, masturbation for me has always helped with relaxing and releasing sexual tensions, and, it’s pleasurable of course. This is where things start to take a turn. I was diagnosed with OCD as a young child, around 12ys old. However I didn’t start taking meds until I was 16. These past few months my OCD has been at an all time high, mostly when it comes to being sexual. Every time I masturbate it becomes a debilitating process. After I “finish” I have convinced myself that my semen is everywhere in my room and I have to hose everything down with Lysol and wipe it down completely, this includes my bed sheets, tables, dressers, everything. It’s so fucking annoying. I really wish I could just masturbate and call it done like how I used to, but that’s just not the case. It takes me about 30 minutes to clean up, even though there isn’t any visible mess, I think it’s lingering around my room, and then what if I track that mess around my house and it goes around my family members, and then that makes me a weirdo because I was being selfish for no  cleaning up. then I’m even more gross. I can only masturbate like once a week because I hate having to do all of these ritualistic things after I masturbate. I can’t even enjoy it even more, what used to bring me pleasure, brings me fear and anxiety. If it was up to me, I wouldn’t masturbate at all, but the hormones of a teenage young adult are never ending. I just want to be able to please myself and not be in so much fear. I’m just exhausted and need to rant.

Title: My OCD is so debilitating
Text:
I'm a 19F, I was diagnosed with OCD around 5 because I obsessively washed my hands until my nails peeled off but I was showing symptoms at as young as 3 and did exposure therapy that was successful but beyond that it went untreated.

I have recently had an extreme flare up in my OCD after having it take a backseat in my mind for around 8 years. It is incredibly hard to deal with since I had developed little to no coping mechanisms as a child (I would normally just have panic attacks/meltdowns whenever I would get intrusive thoughts or severe anxiety when I was a kid) so I have noticed that's how I am reacting to it again despite being 19 now. 

Everytime the intrusive thoughts flare up or the routines I have made are even slightly broken I get flooded with awful, anxiety ridden thoughts and break down and cry. I have no idea how to deal with it and feel like I am trapped in my adult body with the mentality of when I was a kid.

It's like just existing is enough to scare me now, I have bad agoraphobia and can hardly even leave my house without having a panic attack. I had bad existential dread related intrusive thoughts when I was little and it's like they've come back just to ruin my life even more.

I should also mention I have MDD and am currently taking my first antidepressant. If I break routines and do as I please I get more depressed but staying within the confines of the mental routines I have made for myself make my OCD worse. I don't know what to do... I can't just do exposure therapy when the thing freaking me out is my own brain, I just feel extremely scared and hopeless right now.

Title: How often is OCD and anxiety related?
Text:
Like of course a person could have both at the same time, but at what point does OCD distinguish itself from anxiety?

Can OCD hide itself behind a veil of anxiety?

Title: Isolation
Text: I was diagnosed with ocd a couple of months ago. The more that my therapist and I talk about it, the more I realize that it is so ingrained in almost everything that I do. I’ve always been very “spiritual” but all of the magic has been taken away now that I am realizing how much of it is really just disordered thinking. I have a lot of urges specifically with my appearance as well that I feel as if I cannot control, I cannot leave my house or the place I am staying if I don’t look good. And they are interlinked in my mind and because I am not doing my spiritual rituals, I feel ugly. Not just like “oh I don’t like my outfit”, no it’s like I want to crawl into myself and I don’t feel welcome inside of my own skin and if I look in the mirror I have to fix every single thing that I am not pleased with. I spend thousands of dollars on clothes and skin care and my hair as well and I genuinely feel trapped. Lately, I have been isolating myself and avoiding taking photos because in order for me to feel okay being perceived I HAVE to do my hair and my skin care and my makeup and yoga and take my vitamins and do affirmations in the mirror to feel the least bit okay with the way that I look, which takes hours. All my loved ones tell me not to be so high mantinence but if I’m not I feel disgusting. What do I do?

Title: Contamination OCD is taking over my life and I hate it
Text:
Contamination OCD is taking over my life 

Hi, i’ve been struggling with OCD ever since 2015, back then it was mild now it has gotten so severe. I think that everything has germs Im not supposed to touch or cross-mix and I wash my hands after everything in fear there are dirty germs on them. Most of my fear of germs stem from bathroom waste, so I’m not necessarily too obsessive about clutter and messiness, but more fearful about germs from the bathroom spreading through my house and getting on me. I have other forms of OCD, and other rituals/idiosyncrasies that I follow but this is the main one that is quite literally taking over my entire life, to the point it interferes with work, having friends and healthy relationships.

What can I do? I don’t want to live like this anymore.

Title: Replaying conversions
Text:
P.T.S.D, O.C.D and ADHD. what a miserable combo. I live with my landlady and I've been isolating and avoiding here for a week. Today, we crossed paths and she asked how I'm I doing? And said are you resting? So that triggered something, I went to full people please mode, overshared everything happening in my life and at the end I realised I said too much and stopped myself and said "I just have severe anxiety" "let's hope for the best" and walked to my room.

It's been an hour and my brain keeps playing the conversation again and again:(

Edit: I just realised my adhd meds (methylphenidate short acting) makes my O.C.D symptoms way worse. My psychiatrist recently said I have pure O.C.D too.

Title: Anyone else have ocd regarding sex (consent?) TW
Text:
I've always had ocd. Recently found out I'm AuDHD too. Thoughts usually ranged from harm, sexual orientation, death and germs. Its awful, but something I guess I just learned to live with. I never got proper help until the last few years.

About 4 years ago, around this time of year I experienced a sexual assault. This has really increased my symptoms to the point where its unbearable.

I've been with my partner for nearly 3 and half years, and when I'm having a bad episode I obsess over miscommunication we've had, and times we've done things when we've been drinking. I worry I wasn't in a good state, and then due to the passage of time I question what happened. 

My boyfriend refused the first time I wanted to while drinking as was worried I'd not be happy. Another time we did (We weren't in a proper relationship at this point, just seeing each other) and he said I was pretty persistant (which has then lead to the thought that I'm some sort of monster/deviant) and got upset thinking he didn't fancy me.

We ended up trying (I have vagimosis) and he from what I remember was very respectful, asking me if I was okay. I had to stop because of the pain. And I think I then cried afterwards because I felt like a freak due to my condition. He comforted me.

I think I remember the next day not being the happiest, I think just because of my values when I'm sober would mean I'd have wanted it to be special. My upbringing there was a LOT of influence from my family about when you should/shouldn't have sex, and I think I've really put a lot of pressure on myself.

Anyway, overtime I've started worrying I wasn't okay to consent, and I'm not sure if I fully remembered *everything* that night. There was (I think another night) where we were drinking and we were talking Bout having children and what they'd look like. My boyfriend said he wanted them to have his colour of hair, and I cried thinking he hated my hair (I'm sure you've guessed I maybe wasn't in the best place then).

I'm worried that was the same night. At first my boyfriend thought so too/wasn't sure but now he says he thinks they were different nights. He wants me to try and not worry about it. When I'm doing REALLY well I don't think about it much, but right now I'm thinking bout it like it's SA.

Like surely that's not a good state to be in right?

It got so bad that I asked my boyfriend if we don't do anything while intoxicated or which alcohol involved at all. He's respected this 100% and even stopped me when I've tried to go against this rule, even after we've had no intimacy in a long time and I was all over him. He could have taken advantage of that but didn't.

I'm struggling right now. Does this all sound dodgy? Or does it sound like ocd/trauma?

I don't know if I'm ever going to be the same person again after what happened. I never used to be like this. I reported the SA, after it ate me alive for 3 years and nothing was done. Sometimes the thoughts make me feel so awful.

Title: ocd therapy advice?
Text: So I’ve been seeing an OCD therapist for a bit and have been dealing with a bit of frustration regarding treatment. During our sessions I usually discuss if I’m struggling with rumination and the like. I wanted to discuss a past action with my therapist last week and if/how to make amends but they felt that if they said “what you did was terrible” then I would freak out and if they said “it wasn’t all that bad” I would think they’re lying (which is true). However, i’m not so much looking for verification on how good/bad my actions are but sometimes I feel that I want to say what has happened in order to get advice on how to process it specifically. Sometimes “just don’t ruminate” isn’t helpful enough for me. This happened once another time where I couldn’t speak about specifics (I can’t talk specifics at all rn when it pertains to my OCD, i can say themes and such but I can’t say exactly what happened when it comes to real event ocd). While I certainly understand how this can lead to a confession compulsion, is this excessive? Maybe it’s bc of my OCD, but I feel a bit frustrated that I can’t say what’s on my mind in the way that could be most helpful to me. I mentioned that this was frustrating and they acknowledged this, but I still feel unsatisfied with this. Is what I’m asking for really just a compulsion? Thoughts?

Title: acceptance of thoughts
Text:
I researched a lot about rOCD specifically and I relate to a lot of the symptoms. I heard about a way to heal is to let the thoughts exist but don’t engage it in. How do you not feel guilt or let it pass? Every-time I do it I still feel anxiety.

Some thoughts I have:

I seen comments that OCD is a bully and we should just ignore it. It reminds me of the south park episode of when the nanny 911 comes to discipline eric cartman. (tsst season 10 episode 7). “Im not validating his bad behavior with either negative or positive response.” Basically letting OCD act out but not responding. 

What are some way I can do that? I don’t think mindfulness works for me because it causes more rumination for me.

Title: What does "success" look like in terms of therapy?
Text:
Apparently I've had OCD my whole life and just never knew what to label it. Never went to the doctor for anything growing up due to money issues, so I just thought it was all quirks. Then I started looking into this subreddit and realized it was every bit of what I've been going through for most of my life.

But now that I have insurance, I'm thinking of starting to look for therapy or whatever can be done to reduce it. It's definitely gotten worse over the years, but I mask it fairly well from others. For my own sake, but I'd like to improve things for my own sake.

So... what exactly does it look like when you've gone through therapy and treatment after awhile. Months, years, whatever. Is it common to be able to avoid the triggers and live a mostly-normal life? Or is it like when you are an addict, get clean, and you hear everyone say "you're going to think about it every day, forever"?

I'm just curious about realistic end-goals for myself. If the impulsive thoughts to check or do things can legitimately go away. And if I can just... be normal. Or relatively normal, anyway!

If any of you have been through it all and gone through treatment, I'd really like to hear what life is like afterwards. Thanks!

Title: ocd assignment!
Text:
hi! just to be clear, I suffered with chronic ocd a few years back. 
Despite occasional ups and downs, I consider myself recovered, through hard work with lots of acceptance and research. I am now doing a psychology assignment in college where I get to pick any psychological disorder. I picked OCD, of course. Part of the essay need to discuss at least 2 psychological perspectives. Anyone know any good websites or articles that discuss theories or viewpoints maybe the biological theory, cognitive behavioural theory or psychodynamic theory?

Title: why won't OCD just leave me alone?
Text:
i love my bf so much then why do i get fucked up thoughts? i feel so guilty. i would do anything for my bf, he is one of the most important people in my life. i don't want to lose him but these thoughts are so disgusting.

why do i feel responsible for these thoughts when i have no control over them? please tell me it will be okay in the end. i am trying my best but I can't help but feel guilty. i wish i could control my thoughts. i love him alot and it physically hurts to have these thoughts.

Title: OCD controlling another job once again.
Text:
I’ve been lacking structure severely lately and work has been the only thing keeping me going, but I’ve made it too much a priority and obsessive with lists and what to do on a daily basis with little gratification. 

It’s now turning into a full on burn out and I can’t balance my pets, relationships, and I just want to self sabotage. I’m even forgetting my medication and therapy appointments. I’m unsure what to do because what the chaos is stemming from is coworkers being promoted from seniority or them leaving for school. So I’m working horrible and inconsistent shifts. 

Any advice? I usually obsess over my homes cleaning, pets well being, my health as well, but everything is crumbling around me and I’m putting so much on myself. I feel tired all the time and like I’m drifting through a pointless life.

Title: Can’t ever win with intrusive thoughts/OCD
Text:
Sometimes I get an intrusive thought that is so absurd that I initially laugh in my mind at the absurdity of the thought. However I really can’t win, because the OCD then convinces me that my laughing at the thought actually means I either approve of it and that secretly these thoughts are my desires. 

It’s like the only proper reaction at the intrusive thoughts is to be horrified by it and if I’m not horrified by the thoughts that means I approve of them. 

It’s exhausting! If I’m unfazed by the thoughts the OCD will blame me and if I’m disturbed by the thoughts the OCD still blames me lol.

Title: People who have the theme of SA and SH and accidentally touched someone when dealing with an intrusive thought about them how did you feel?
Text: B

Title: None of the medications are working!
Text:
I was diagnosed with OCD, GAD & ‘unspecified psychosis’ in march and was put on sertraline and olanzapine. Took those for about three months and developed a tolerance pretty quickly. I also gained a ton of weight, which didn’t help my self esteem. 

Stopped those, and was sent to the hospital. The stubborn psych there had no idea about my previous diagnosis (even though it was listed) and said I had bipolar and put me on a mood stabilizer + two antipsychotics. He also refused to give me SSRI’s or any anxiety medication.

Now my thoughts are worse than ever, and I can’t help but feel that my ocd has become unmanageable. 

Anyone have tips that can help ?

Title: I think that I have developed a fear of silence.
Text:
Every time there's a quiet place, it just lets my mind wander all over the place and to take over. This already is already bad for someone with OCD. 

Whenever there's silence, my mind just goes on and doesn't stop no matter what.

I have always found that "taking a walk" actually doesn't help because it's just me doing nothing, giving my mind all the time to just think of whatever it wants.

Walks (unless there's music though) are NOT calming nor are they helping. It's just as bad as if i was in my room, without any background noise. 

Unless I'm very deeply into something that I'm passionate about that can make me busy, I just can't find myself being able to stop.

Whenever i close my eyes in a quiet place, that's all it takes for my mind to wander off to things that i might not wanna think about.

It's not even nearly as bad as it was before. But it still kind of bothers me that quiet places bring this out.

I get nervous whenever it's quiet for longer than a few seconds because i know what will happen. I have always hated sleeping and now I hate it even more. 

i avoid any longer walks or nature because it's completely quiet. even when i go out on a bike, it's just as bad. nothing takes my attention away and my mind wanders off.

and I'm aware of this. i constantly try to avoid complete silence but there are times it doesn't work like when I'm in public or in a building like school where earbuds are not allowed.

I don't need advice or anything, i really just wanted to share and see if anyone feels the same. thanks for reading.

Title: First time using fluoxetine.
Text:
So I tried ERP and I failed (mainly bc I did it alone). I failed to off myself, luckily I have concerned parents and forced me to have medication. I’m on 20mg fluoxetine now. 

I’ve been searching for side effects and I mainly saw that takers are definitely feeling sleepy. I don’t know if it is bc of the drug but I feel like I’m flowing in water bc I’m so sleepy or if it’s due to my lack of sleep (mental compulsion of being scared to take the meds by morning). 

Anywho, I’m curious to ask some of you guys, why’d you quit SSRIs? Is there any bad effect? bc I’m planning to take it for the rest of my life. In my country, fluoxetine is not expensive.

Title: my compulsions arent visible enough
Text: ive been diagnosed with ocd for almost 3 years now and it feels like nobody will ever understand just how bad it is because my compulsions arent as obvious as they are for most people. i dont wash my hands multiple times, i don't count loudly, i dont lock my door or check my windows multiple times, im not an organized person, or anything similar to how ocd is often portrayed in media or explained by doctors. my compulsions pretty much go unnoticed to others, despite my intrusive thoughts and obsessions being super intense. i want to be able to express how terrible ocd feels for me but i think nobody will ever truly get it if my compulsions are seen as something that everyone does. i could explain what my intrusive thoughts feel like, but i think they would consider me a pervert or stop talking to me. i just want someone in my life to sympathize with me

Title: Mental breakdown over cat video.
Text: The title may seem silly but I have a morality obsession. I worry about being a bad person so much that if I did even a remotely bad action or think something bad I obsess over it for hours upon hours. I was watching a cute cat video compilation and I saw a video of a cat with wobbly cat syndrome walking down the stairs and my brain told me, "why didnt you laugh at it?" or "you shouldve laughed at it" and I freaked out because I didnt want to be the kind of person to make fun of disabled animals. My head hurted really bad and I threw up. I talked to my mom about it and she told me she didnt want to be pulled into it. Like my anxiety wasnt valid. Later she did apologize which made me realize how serious this is.Im ok now, but how do I develop healthy coping mechanisms for next time?

Title: Can you do ERP if your compulsions are mental?
Text:
My OCD is more intrusive thoughts and rumination. I work in a hospital and I had a persistent thought/ memory that I had deliberty killed a patient on shift by falsely writing I had seen him when I didn’t.

I completely believed it and was preparing to unalive myself because I become incredibly guilty and depressed. It went on for around 7 months.I told my manager who told me that he didn’t die on my shift and that my documentation was correct. I had about a weeks relief before almost making a mistake during inserting a cannula and the whole process started again. I ruminate and try to figure out if I did hurt someone then find out I didn’t and so forth so it jumps on to the next mistake and so forth. This has led me to becoming burnt out as it’s been going on since 2020. I’ve spoken to counsellors who suggested ERP but said I can’t do it because I can’t expose myself to killing a patient. So I’ve not had any real OCD therapy besides talking through my fears. I ended up with crisis team by mistake I was sent there after ending in hospital because I mentally couldn’t deal with anything anymore they said I’m resurrance seeking and basically kicked me out 

I don’t do any physical compulsions that I know off. I keep believing that I’m going to prison for hurting a patient so I’ve been watching Prison shows to prepare myself and I only do things that I will be able to do in prison like go to gym. 

I hope this makes sense :( crisis team said I have OCD traits so do I even have OCD?

Title: really scared
Text: whenever i get intrusive thoughts i always tell myself “its okay its not your fault because you were not like this before and it means that you arent a bad person you just started experiencing this and you are not what your brain tells you” however recently i was ruminating and now my brain is telling me” you were never like this before because you developed these thoughts because you are a bad person now and you experience this now because youve changed to be a bad person and this is actually the real you” and im really scared that this is true. i know im not a bad person deep down in my heart however this thought is very much convincing me. any advice would help thank you

Title: Help. What behavior should I work on?
Text:
I recently began working with a therapist who specializes in OCD. I like her a lot. She listens to me, she doesn’t make me feel badly about myself, and she’s taking things slowly which is very much what I want/need. During our last session, she asked me to think about an OCD behavior I’d like to tackle. I’m supposed to let her know what I decided during our next session, which is this upcoming Wednesday. Most of my behaviors revolve around cleanliness and include:

•Showering as soon as I’m home any time I leave the house. 
•Washing/disinfecting anything that enters the house (groceries, clothes, etc.).
•Disinfecting the house after visitors leave (since I can’t have them shower after entering the house lol).
•Regularly disinfecting door knobs, cabinet handles, and door switches. 
•Disinfecting areas that have been touched by “unclean” items (such as the counter where the mail is placed).

I’m having trouble deciding what to tackle because, even though I realize these behaviors are a result of my OCD and I want to improve, I also can’t fathom the mere thought of not doing these things. It just feels impossible and horrible to not do these things. I know I want to get better, but I also can’t imagine doing so if that makes sense. 

Any thoughts and/or advice will be greatly appreciated.

Title: Is OCD taken seriously?
Text:
I mean of course OCD isn't as famous as for example ADHD so it makes sense that it's not taken as seriously but i mean i'm in my end middle school year and i struggle to close my bag ( i spend at least a few minutes at the end of each class trying to close it meaning i then am late to the other class... thanks OCD ) . And when i'm at home just to change clothes and sometimes it helps to put some music on that way it's a bit harder to hear those intrusive thoughts but at school i mean if i hear someone say a name i just restart the whole "ritual" i feel like if it would help a LOT if whenever i tick i could put earbuds on and listen to some meditation for 30 seconds and it'd help more than taking some pills...

  
welp thanks for reading this far and yes i realize i'm not at all the most OCD person on here but i know i'm not the only one dealing with this and i hope that somewhere on earth we're allowed to put some meditation on to be able to OCD in peace... thanks lasses and lads we're not alone out there but we sure do feel like it

  
Hope you all get to have a great almost OCD-less day ( or night ) and that you all get better!

Title: have anyone else experienced this or something similar?
Text:
hey i just wanted to share what i am experiencing currently and if anyone has experienced anything similar? 

before reading this : i will be talking about cosmetic surgery and body image but nothing in detail! 

i’ll give context with the backstory and then share what i am dealing with :)

backstory: 
I am a 20f and I have struggled with OCD (mostly checking and contamination) since i was 12. 
In June of 2023 I officially started the consultation process for a surgery i have always wanted (for many reasons) …. a breast reduction. 
After finding my surgeon and dealing with insurance I was able to officially schedule my surgery for December 20th, 2023. 
My surgery and recovery was the best experience possible. My total time of recovery was 2 months with restrictions, everything past that was pretty normal! 

The problem is…. I can’t stop thinking of that day. It’s almost 1 year post op for me and I CANT STOP THINKING ABOUT IT. and not in a good way. 
My other types of ocd, i’ve learned to manage and control my ocd. 

This situation though, is definitely OCD based. 
I have told my therapist about this and he said, “ you went into pre-op, extremely uncomfortable and unhappy with your chest and it was a complete 180 turn. You went from a huge size to a normal comfortable size. You have been waiting for this surgery for years and now it’s over, you did it”. 

I agree with what he said but all i want to do is re-do the surgery over and over and over again. I want to have this surgery done every 2 weeks. I want my stitches back, I want to be watching shows non stop, I want to be in post-op recovery again. 

Everyday I want to wake up with my pre-op boobs and then wake up with my post-op size. 

I don’t understand why I can’t get over this but I know it’ll be much harder to get over this because my surgeon is not gonna do a 1 year post op surgery again. so it’s over. i just don’t know how to stop thinking and obsessing over it. 
i’ve wrote about my feelings, sketch my before and after boobs. i just don’t know what to do. i’m stuck in this loophole of wanting to have the same surgery done every 2 weeks.

Title: race ocd is making work difficult
Text: i have race ocd really strongly right now, and i’m in a hotel front desk position. every time i have to check in a person of color, my brain FREAKS OUT with the intrusive thoughts and anxiety. like, i’m so worried they’re going to see me as racist i forget how to act. i have no idea how to smile or be naturally friendly, so i do my best to fake it, but i worry it comes off fake or forced. today i checked in a Latina woman, and i was getting really frustrated with my brain so when i asked for her id, i think it came out weirdly loud and accusatory. i was really frustrated, but with myself not with her. i had a intrusive thought like “you should be accusatory when you ask for her id” and i think it affected how i acted. for the rest of the conversation i was overly friendly to try to make up for it. im nervous i took   out my frustration with ocd on her. sometimes i get so tired of fighting my brain that i just give up on being any more friendly than my job requires to everybody, but i worry i do that to guests of color more, even though i try to be aware. i especially worry i come off as rude with customers who can’t speak english or can’t speak it well. i worry in the past i’ve gotten frustrated with the language barrier and been a bit rude, and i worry about doing that now. has anyone else experienced anything similar? this whole paralysis by analysis is driving me insane and i worry because of it i *am* coming off racist.

Title: Racist or offensive intrusive thoughts?
Text:
I don't hate anyone for race, gender, nationality, or anything else nor do I ever want to. My intrusive thoughts want me to say slurs and the thoughts tell me that if I pretend it's a tic, (I have tourettes) then I'll be fine. My thoughts will repeat a slur over and over in my head, telling me to say it. I don't want to say slurs! But my thoughts tell me that it would give me relief to say the n word for example. What do I do?

Edit: Thank you for all your support, it really helped me understand my OCD and how to deal with it. <33

Title: Does it ever get better?
Text:
