Title: Help with existential ocd
Text:
Hi all,

I need help and advice. I'm struggling with intrusive thoughts today. I worry there some hidden, sinister purpose behind our existence and that science, especially with all the weirdness we constantly find within quantum mechanicsmight soon expose this horrific truth.

I know this is just my imagination but I'm overcome with dread and anxiety about this. Please help.

Title: I don’t know how to tell my parents I got diagnosed with OCD
Text:
So two weeks ago I was diagnosed with OCD (not a surprise) and I’ve been working with the therapist for a long term treatment plan. I’m 22 and everything is free with my insurance. BUT, I haven’t told my parents. 

I know it’s like omg you’re 22 etc be an adult but I really love my parents and I know they love me, but as an Asian I can’t really predict how their reaction is going to be and I’m really scared about telling them. Fun fact I’m an only child so I know my mom is going to lose her shit and she usually thinks it’s her fault if anything’s wrong with me. Which is why I’m hesitating. 

Any advice on how to approach this topic with Asian parents is welcome. 

Thank you.

Title: Need some support
Text: Down in the dumps right now and needing some support. Sometimes feels like no one else knows how this feels. I don’t know one person in my life that struggles with OCD like I do. Just needing some positive words right now

Title: Going off of antidepressants and am scared about how it'll affect my OCD
Text: I didn't even know I had OCD until after almost 2 years of being on antidepressants but they helped me so so much without me even realizing. Now I'm getting weened off of antidepressants for other reasons (fatigue, messed w other meds) and I am scared. I remember how intense my breakdowns have been, how I would deep clean everything once a week and then break down from exhaustion (hoarder and messy mom). I once broke down crying for 3 hours because my mom put milk on the wrong (and labeled) shelf in the fridge. Im scared.

Title: Days becoming cursed
Text:
I have this thing that if I wake up and if the first thing I think of is a bad thought my whole day is ruined. Or if I think about a future date and a bad thought pops up then my day in that date will be ruined/cursed because the first thought I had when thinking of that date was a bad one… And my mind tells me that even if I forget about it on that day, it’ll still be cursed.

Did anybody ever have something like this? How did you beat it?

Title: Hopelessness about the future
Text:
Is it normal to feel hopeless that nothing will be able to get you out of your situation? Especially if you are convinced that what you have isn't OCD and actually the real thing? (for me it would be pedophilia instead of POCD)

I am hoping to get connected with a psychiatrist very soon but part of me keeps saying that it will be hopeless and that this work will be for nothing, that I'll just end up being diagnosed with pedophilia instead of POCD. I know ERP is the thing to treat OCD but I just have this looming dread over me that my worst suspicions would end up being true, it just feels like my past of being very sexually active and involved with porn (sometimes getting to the extreme) is working against me and every day is working against me while I'm trying to stay positive...

Title: OCD making me doubt who I am.
Text: I don't even know anymore every day I deal with a new obsession and lies and false intrusive thoughts wtf is this illness  I don't know if anyone elses OCD does this but for some reason today out of nowhere for the first time ever my OCD is putting these lies in my head that you have been a racist and discriminatory person all your life and now I am feeling so much anxiety thinking what if Ive been a racist or discriminatory person all my life even though I know that I am not a racist or discriminatory person at this point I am so exhausted am I always gonna just live like this always anxious always dealing with a new obsession every day, does it ever get better how would it get better I have had therapy but it has helped a slightly but I am no where near a point where I feel better.

Title: Does anyone else feel stuck sometimes like their thinking is wrong
Text: I just feel so uncomfortable right now because I can’t think right. I don’t even know what thinking correctly would mean but I know I’m not doing it. I just keep racing between thoughts because nothing feels right and trying to distract myself but nothing feels right and I’m just trying so hard not to obsessively scratch a deep line into my skin and idk what to do please help any advice is greatly appreciated thanks

Title: Any experiences with self-help groups?
Text: I am searching for a therapist since spring but cant find one. My doctor now told me to look up some self help groups near me...i have never done anything like that, can someone share experiences, good or bad?

Title: I overcame a phobia today 🥳 [TW: medical procedure]
Text:
While I have not had an OCD diagnosis, I have dealt with severe phobias, gory intrusive thoughts, and rumination for most of my life. Back in June I met with a psychiatrist, and while she did not share a specific diagnosis, after our intake session she started me on Zoloft and I have been feeling so much better. After that I found this sub and have been a long time lurker, learning more about OCD and feeling more seen than I ever have before.

Anyway, today I overcame a phobia I’ve had for as long as I can remember and I had my blood drawn at the doctor! This phobia has been so severe that for the last 15 years (I’m 31 now) I have not been able to have this simple procedure done. The last time I did, it was against my will and was not even a full panel, and before that I had only had it drawn maybe twice that I can remember. 

It feels a little silly sharing it with lots of others since this is seen as something so routine, but I am so proud of myself and how far I’ve come with my medication/treatment to be able to do this. It’s wonderful to feel one step closer to living a “normal” life and removing what were previously hard and arbitrary boundaries.

I hope others in this sub can appreciate this win!

Title: Contamination specific question
Text:
Does anyone else with contamination find themselves spitting often in the shower or in the bathroom?

I feel like I’m constantly spitting when I’m in the shower because I feel like I’m getting dirty water in my mouth. Even sometimes just using the bathroom, I feel the need to spit in the trash because I could have gotten particles of stuff in my mouth. 

I’ve heard this compulsion from like one other person and just wanted to know if anyone dealt with it. 

After a while you start to get a sore throat and dry mouth so it really sucks. This is my next thing that I’m gonna work on stopping now that I’ve been trying to use paper towels without having to throw away like the first foot of paper lmfao. 

If you don’t deal with this feel free to share other weird bathroom or self care things you do because of your OCD

Title: Feel liked I've jinxed myself and now I'm not safe to get help or take meds
Text:
Finally told someone just how bad the OCD had got over the last year, on Monday. GP asked CMHT (for the about the 10th time since May) to review my meds especially to be put on something for the depression, anxiety and OCD as currently only on PRN Quetiapine. CMHT has agreed to start me on Fluoxetine - not yet picked up or started taking.

Since then so many things have gone wrong. Arranged to meet with someone 4 times this week and multiple things each time, have gone wrong to stop this happening and I feel like it's punishment for snitching on my brain. And now I'm too scared to take the medication I've been asking for, for over a year, because I feel like that's gonna jinx me further and I'm scared of what's going to happen and I don't know what to do. I've had enough of all this. My mental health has severely deteriorated this last year and the OCD really has destroyed so much which is why I've been fighting to get the prescription but now I can't take it and I can't tell anyone and I'm scared. I can't do this anymore.

Title: Medication and Experiences (OCD)
Text: Hey everyone. I tried to make a post earlier and not too sure what happened. Anyway I am 23 years old and have struggled with OCD since I can remember. I have tried almost every medication with no luck so far. I am currently on 40mg Paxil and today my doctor prescribed me 5mg Abilify to take with the Paxil since the Paxil alone didn’t help at all. I am also on lamictal for my bipolar. My main question is does anyone else use this medicine combo (Paxil+abilify) I’m really nervous to start taking my abilify before I hear how it was for others or if it’s safe together. I have two kids so don’t want to mess up my ability to be a good mom.

Title: I was diagnosed with OCD today so...hi 👋🏽
Text:
I feel...relief that I'm not awful and that these thoughts Are Not Me really. It's my actions that define me. Not my intrusive thoughts that disgust me. 

I feel seen yknow? 

My therapist was so helpful and said that they had a feeling but me describing how the thoughts race and how I hate myself confirmed it (among other things) 

I feel....better- even if I feel bad about the thoughts I have. My therapist wants to work on treatment and such starting next week. 

I'm gonna be okay. I think. I've considered journaling about it, which is why I wanted to make this post. Do you all find journaling about your thoughts to be helpful or hurtful?

Title: Has anyone had an obsession over careers and things you aren’t passionate for? And also obsessing and looking up to people you don’t care to much about?
Text:
I have had pure OCD my whole life and in the past 2 months I’ve only just found out about it. This last 2 months has been up there with one of the hardest things I’ve had to get through but I’ve been making amazing progress. A lot of my fears are starting to go away and have already gone and although I feel as if I’m in so much more mental torment than before, I feel the strongest and most free I’ve ever felt from it. It’s strange but a lot of people here will understand what I’m talking about. It’s the anxiety you get but the compulsions and obsessions fade.

Anyway. There been this one obsession that is incredibly annoying and I’ve looked everywhere and I can’t seem to find anything on here or on the internet about it but I’m sure some of you guys have probably had this obsession. To get to the point, I’ve had this random and strange obsession with Elon musk and i don’t know how to shake it.

When ever I think about my future goals and what I want to do I always feel like I’m not being “useful” enough. I’m always comparing myself to him or I have this little voice in the back of my head that makes me feel “not as good as Elon musk” 

At the moment I am studying to get a diploma in personal training in college and might go on to do a degree because I love training people and I love the science that goes into it. Since I was 14 I’ve loved the gym and I’ve always had a love for science before then. I love bodybuilding and have only just been able to come back to the gym after a year of recovering from open spine surgery which fueled my want for science even more. I wish to be successful in my business and look to bring my 3d and filming skills into it. 

During my recovery I had a short phase of constantly thinking about the scientist Oppenheimer and how I wanted to make some huge contribution to science even though I never really liked physics but then it just went. 

But this is worse. Since Elon musk owns 6 businesses, is the richest man alive and is probably getting us to mars in our lifetime makes me feel like I’ve got even more to achieve. I’ve never cared about being an entrepreneur or something to do with space. I mean everyone would love to be an astronaut in zero g but Jesus Christ. So would everyone like to be a ripped bodybuilder but not everyone on earth devotes their life to it! It’s this obsession with not being useful to humanity. If I’m not as useful as him what’s the point of my existence. Very dark I know and I know that’s not how life works. I used to think the guy who did my surgery was top one percentage god like person who helps people (which he is, he’s helped thousands of people with scoliosis like me!, couldn’t be more thankful!) but now my ocd has distorted me to think a being someone in that level is no where near as good enough as being Elon musk. It’s ridiculous I hate it! I look at people like Jeff bezos and Steve Jobs who have affect our lives more than Elon I would say but my OCD doesn’t bat an eye. Maybe it’s because he’s cool and relatable as I’m just going through being a dumb edgy teenager. 
I sometimes get the thought “if it was me or Elon to die, everyone would pick me because my use to this world isn’t as substantial as him!” I know that’s not gonna happen and I know that’s not the sole meaning of life. But then I question the meaning of life that is a whole other can of poo I’m not opening. I know that’s if that was the case, the whole world wouldn’t be alive and only a few people would live, all the farmers and nurses would be gone who hold up the world. It’s like cogs in a big machine but my OCD just can accept that. It’s paradoxical and stupid. I am aware that polarised thinking (all or nothing) is a big part of OCD but my god this sucks.

Anyway as well as a question that was a vent, but it has to come out somewhere. If I tried explaining it to anyone else it would just come out as unintelligible garbage.

Glad to get that off my chest!

Hope people here find this useful and I’m still making great progress and I’m feeling optimistic for the future. Just remember, don’t pray for easy lives (compulse), pray to be stronger men! (Resist)

Sorry for bad grammar it won’t let me change it for some reason.

Title: Regarding eating meat
Text: This has never happened before, i was just eating this red bean beef chinese food and it has rlly red sauce on it. Then an intrusive thought came into my head saying “what if you’re eating human meat right now” then i instantly got turned off eating the rest of it. What the hell? I love meat so much i love my red meat and its freaking me out and making me feel like im a cannibal or something. This could just be a lil OCD fling but im anxious that my disordered eating might come back like how i use to have when i was a child. I refused to eat most things because i was too anxious to eat anything. Any advice?

Title: Obsessions Related To Trauma
Text:
I have trauma around SA, so it's like OCD is latching onto those experiences and twisting it. 
I keep having graphic intrusive thoughts about harming someone in that way or being traumatized like that again. 
It's making me so mentally exhausted and feel disgusting.. 
I would never do that to anyone, but my brain keeps screaming that I will.. when I was hanging out with a friend recently, I suddenly got one of these thoughts and it just kept replaying so I had to be away from her for a bit. 

I feel so sick..

Title: My health related OCD is getting worse
Text:
Recently my health anxiety has gotten worse. I watched a video where a doctor mentioned cancer rates for young people are on the rise and now I'm afraid of getting it. I'm even afraid of typing that for fear of manifesting it. I vape (trying to quit) so I'm afraid I've fucked up my lungs. 

I know it sounds silly, but I also have a fear of getting anthrax and some brain eating parasite. 

I always feel like something is wrong in my body, and there's this ever present dread of something bad about to happen. It's pretty tiring.

Title: Other than therapy and medication, what has helped you?
Text: Sometimes I wonder if there’s more I could be doing to fight this. If you have any advice on managing ocd outside of therapy and medication, please let me know.

Title: ERP Advice
Text: Dont try to bullseye your intrusive thoughts and do ERP to just to those, the better aproach is to just expose yourself to all your thoughts. This way your OCD wont make you obsess over whats an intrusive thought and what isnt. Plus your wanted thoughts wont suffer cause you wont have a problem exposing yourself to those anyway.

Title: Idk what im feeling
Text: I have suffered from rocd for about 8 months and at first I had terrible anxiety about everything related to my relationship and urges. I’m diagnosed with ocd and GAD and  started therapy not too long ago. My anxiety has gone away along with the intrusive thoughts and nothing gives me reassurance that the love is still there. I also don’t have any love feelings, I feel as though they have all left me completely or they are very short lived and don’t feel strong enough. Recently I have felt disconnected from my boyfriend and I even had bad anxiety over it and was freaking out at first. Now I just have this feeling of wanting to be close to him again and laugh like we used too but also have thoughts/feelings about being single even though I’m wanting feelings back for him. Almost everytime I do erp around breaking up during therapy I cry or start tearing up and feel sad about it but I still feel like I want to break up. Even though those thoughts and feelings are there around breaking up I still don’t do it and feel like part of me is begging me not too. I just don’t know what to do or what I’m feeling. Advice would be nice!

Title: Intrusive thoughts are too much
Text:
Got diagnosed with ocd when i was in primary i dont get like school therapy anymore since i been more discreet.My obession is white stuff so when i see a white spot on the floor or bird shit or anything else like that i have to touch it or step on it.I want to stop but the i know the thoughts will come at me so i just do it. I recently got this thought about if i dont unfollow someone on tiktok my brain will die.If i do unfollow them theyll ask me why but if i dont i have these thoughts. My mom knows i have it and ive been better but i relapsed recently and its so bad so she asked and i just feel ashamed

Its almost to the point of psychosis and i think im going insane. I had an ED during my ocd spike in primary and its also starting to come back i went from 30kg(underweight for my age) to like 50 in 2 years but im starting to drop again.My brain is so messed up i been thinking about kms alot for like 3 months now
also i didnt know what tag to put so i just put crisis since that seemed the most fitting
i dont wanna seem whiny with my other post too but i just want to vent since i cant talk to anyone about it irl

Title: is it a good idea to remove insta and Pinterest as its causing compulsions.
Text: i know this would be a pretty straightforward answer except for one thing. my ocd is themed around activism and my compulsion is to share as much as i can and help as many people as i can. i of course want to keep helping people but i also know this is ocd. what do i do?

Title: Is it bad that I seek reassurance
Text: I know it’s a rule that reassurance only makes it worse but for me it helps me a lot cause I know that it’s normal and my thoughts aren’t who I am

Title: Weekly Wins & Positivity
Text: What is going great in your life? What are you super excited about and want to share? Got a funny OCD moment to share? Let's smile, laugh and share some positivity!

Title: Would confessing this to my partner count as reassurance seeking?
Text: I am afraid of cheating. I was on tik tok and saw someone’s profile who I found attractive. When you view someone’s profile it notifies them that you did. When I viewed this person’s profile, I had the thought that I would like them to know I did, but then I’ve been spiraling about whether that was a real thought or just a fake intrusive thought. Then I engaged in a checking behavior where I would go on attractive persons’ profiles and will myself to think and feel that I wanted them to know I viewed their profile. But then the thoughts and feelings actually felt too real while I was doing it such that I have been spiraling about whether that checking behavior itself was cheating. I’m afraid of feeling guilty for the rest of my life if I don’t confess. I don’t know what’s real and what’s my OCD. Would confessing this to my partner be bad for my OCD?

Title: Guys I need help, my chronic jaw pain is making my OCD spiral out of control leading to suicidal thoughts
Text:
I’m already seeing a jaw pain specialist but he can’t see me for another month.

Every fucking time I feel jaw pain, my body reacts with anxiety, i experience super negative thoughts like “you’re going to live with this pin forever”, and super depressing mood. Sometimes, if I don’t address the pain, my ocd won’t stop bothering me about it. And this is where it gets scary. I start to feel like there’s no way out of my pain. Like how a claustrophobic person feels when they need to get out but can’t. And this is where the suicidal ideation starts,

What I’ve done so far with my OCD is saying “I may or may not live with this pain forever” and some acceptance therapy like “if I end up living with this pain forever, then so be it”. This helps. I can’t even take my ocd meds like Clomipramine cause there’s a chance it can make my jaw pain worse (med induced clenching). But I am taking Ativan for when my ocd gets dangerously tense.

What else do you guys think will help me cope more?

Title: Ruminating journal/had a triggering event in a public space
Text:
This is essentially just to say that I had a pure ocd related event, less intrusive thoughts and more ruminated in a public space and needed to vent it out as part of my compulsion. Thought to place it here. Essentially, I don't want anything "negative" to happen to me and I think writing it out here both eliminates that possibility and makes it seem less real when deeply thinking about it. 

Letting it be known that what I experienced is just ocd and "announcing it to the world" in this way is sort of calming and is just sort of part of my compulsion (please don't delete). 

Anyways, you can contribute any of your ruminating experiences below.

Title: Expressing frustration.
Text: As of recent, I found myself in a frenzy of frustration. I truly do not believe that it can be separated from the OCD, as much as I wish it could. Lol I feel silly. I thought contamination was the only thing, but it is not. I yell with abandon, squeal with past events in mind and just feel unstable. One night a few days ago, in some sort of delirium I took to recording my voice, as a rememberance of that night. I was afraid during that time, that I would have to move again. Now that is a touchy subject for me. I no longer feel secure and believe I will not for a long time coming. I find myself somewhat obsessed with whatever I do... Just so weird to say. It doesn't seem normal. Then my voice was slurred, I started speaking of inadequacies that have been haunting me for far too long. Ewww... like I cannot get over it.

Title: Anyone else just wish their ocd just changed themes already ?
Text: Like holy shii hurry up

Title: Making an app to help people with OCD
Text:
Hi all,

So my partner has OCD and I see first hand how hard it can be to handle on a daily basis. I want to build an app that can help her and anyone else who can benefit from it. I’m on here looking for ideas that would make this app as helpful as possible. 

I don’t want this to be something to replace CBT and other traditional methods as I don’t think thats feasible. I want this to be something that can help ease the burden of the day to day. 

Any ideas and suggestions are welcome!

Title: i feel like i’m going insane
Text: hi, i've never used this before but i've been kind of spiraling about my mental state for the past 2 or 3 months (and low key in the background for at least a whole year (when i had a friend say something about me maybe having ocd) but as of late it's intensified ("coincidentally" around the time when i moved away for college so..)), i am terrified that everything about me is just a mental illness. i have never been to any kind of therapy, im not diagnosed with anything, but my hypochondria has become focused on ocd and i keep coming back to it in everything i do, every thought i think is being over analyzed through this lense, ive always been conscious of my thinking which i know is not normal bc ive talked to people about this and they're like "..no i don't think about my thoughts while having thoughts i just have thoughts.." but it's got like some sort of motive. and lately ive feeling more and more stuck within myself and ive tried all these mindfulness practices and it works for like a second but right after im just back to fighting through my thoughts to have just a little bit of breathing room. i don't want to talk to my mother about it bc she's like the same way as me and she's done therapy stuff before and it didn't end well, and i feel like if i have ocd she also has it so then i would have to say "hey i think maybe we have OCD" and when i write it out it doesn't seem bad but it's like this overlaying dread that always hovers over me, and i just can't stand it. no one knows how much of a hypochondriac i am bc i feel so annoying when i ask any sort of question even though all i want to do is ask people if im dying, if this mole looks like cancer, if my forehead feels hot with a fever, but i always stop myself from asking for any kind of reassurance and find myself fishing for it in other ways and when i don't get the reassurance i want from that i just start spiraling even more. whenever i get really horrible thoughts i always think that i faked that thought and im just a delusional hypochondriac trying to reason with irrational insanity. i know i really probably should talk to someone about this but i just don't know how and i feel like im not allowed to because my problems aren't tangible and maybe they're not real, but i just can't seem to let go of things or accept certain facts but im really trying, it's just not sticking. i'm sorry if this feels like the ramblings of a loon.

Title: I'm sorry if this is a repeat but does anyone else get intrusive thoughts (while talking to people) that they're going to say something extremely hateful and rude even though you don't want to at all??
Text: Every time I'm enjoying a conversation i just get this thought that I'm gonna ruin it all and be evil to that person. I don't want to but I'm convinced I'm going to and it's so hard to stay focused once it sets in.

Title: Eyebrow rubbing
Text:
I cannot stop rubbing my eye brows and I notice it gets worse when I’m stressed. It’s to the point where I barely have any hair left and people around me point it out when I do it and idk what to say. 

Does anyone else have something similar?

Title: Anyone want to be friends?
Text:
I’m 36/F and 🏳️‍🌈 
I’m married and I live in Texas. 

I’ve been married for 2 years and we’ve been together for 4 years. 

I went through a divorce in 2020 and lost all the “friends” I thought I had.

Well it’s been 4 years and I’ve found it so difficult to make quality friends. I want friends who can call me when they need to vent and who will actually respond to my texts. Friends who WANT to do things together.. and plan stuff. I don’t care if you live in the same state as me.. traveling is a thing and we can always make things work.

I work full time but would love to start making time to take friend trips and stuff.

I’ve been diagnosed with OCD since I was 12. I was raised (and homeschooled) by my mom who was bipolar, manic depressive and schizophrenic. 

I’d love to pick your brain and have you pick mine and see if we can be friends! 

Message me!

Title: Question about groinal responses
Text:
I had some questions about groinal responses
I was wondering if they can come at complete random? Without any intrusive thoughts or stress (at first- like only feeling the stress after the response)?
Because I feel like I've had this. And it made me feel so stressed afterwards , it was a random reaction to something that I would NEVER find attractive, in my head I hated the idea so much and i know i have no desire, but i felt like an awful person. Has anyone ever had this? 

Edit; I just wanted to add that it was random, I thought I was fine I felt nothing then BAM! out of the blue. That's the part that's killing me. Then after that I kept scrolling back to check myself/prove to myself that this is just false, which I know only would make it worse. So I've stopped trying to prove to myself  but this memory is getting to me.

Title: About 11 years ago I said that if a certain event happened than that could mean that I was my worst ocd fear
Text:
Basically about 11 years ago 

I said that if my ex appeared on my friend suggestion list on FB. Than that would mean that I am an evil person.

That’s my ocd fear. My ocd constantly try’s to make me fear that I would become and evil person.

So I said that if that happened than that would mean it was true.


Well a few weeks ago a profile appeared on my friend suggestions.

It had a different name but when I was with her she would make fake profiles. I later realized she had a bf at the time when I was talking to her so she would make fake FB profiles so she wouldn’t get caught.

Well this profile really looked like it was created by her. It had her last name on the profile link even though the profile had another name. She also had a picture where faces are cut out but in the picture it looked very similar to her and her mom.

There’s a chance that it could have been somebody else but I’m almost 95% sure it was her.

Now my OCD is in overdrive because of this. I suffer from really bad ocd because of this fear. Being able to say well she hasn’t appeared on my friend suggestions comforted me but now that that happened I don’t know how to make the thoughts stop

Title: I just realised the absolute insanity that OCD is, yet am unable to fix it because of frustration because of my autism. How to deal with that?
Text:
I am not saying that everyone with OCD is insane. That is obviously discriminatory. I am saying that \*my\* OCD is insane. And I realized, my OCD, my anxiety is the result of frustration with autism.

It dawned on me after taking sertraline for 2 weeks. I noticed that my mind suddenly slowed down and I felt like I could think clearly for the first time. I realized the following: What, on earth, have I been doing?

I have a sheer endless amount of obsessions: Ranging from: My home is contaminated, the air, the furniture, there is mold everywhere (there isn't), perfectionism, my sleep isn't good enough, my monitor, chair isn't good enough. My obsession is the strongest with sleep, because to me, I \*think\* that if my sleep is bad, my obsessions get worse. So I tell myself that because I slept badly, that my obsessions are the worst today. But my obsessions include my sleep, so it leads to an endless cycle of me obsessing over my sleep, over my mattress, my bedding, the air quality at night etc. etc.

But now, my mind just slowed down. And I realized that I don't need perfect sleep. Good enough sleep is good, too. Maybe there is mold in my home. But even if, the human body is able to handle small amounts of it. Plus, other people wouldn't even worry whether something smells weirdly in their home. They just do stuff without worrying about strange things.

With that mindset in mind, I didn't engage with my compulsions for a day. I felt soul crushing internal pain from not engaging, it felt so, so difficult. But after a day it got better. The obsessions are still there. I can ignore them better now though.

Another thing I noticed however: I am autistic. Sertraline doesn't make me un-autistic. Sertraline doesn't fix my overstimulation. Not even Sertraline can stop me from having anxiety when I go to uni, along a street with thousands of cars, smell, narrow streets, noise, bad air quality, to a place where thousands of people are crowded in narrow buildings.

But I am also easily under-stimulated. I am someone who loves doing new things, meeting new people, learning new stuff. Etc. Where I currently live, the only comfortable is my home. And uni. Travelling inbetween is a nightmare regarding anxiety response, over-stimulation and all that. It doesn't help there is only one (1) street to uni I can choose, and it is by far the worst one, directly through an area with lots of industry and all the things I mentioned.

Stress is the #1 factor in my life triggering my OCD. I need to change my living environment drastically, because right now, I \*hate\* my place. My home is the only place looking not ugly in this city. And that leads to frustration. Frustration leads to restlessness. After a nice weekend of feeling relaxed, I go to uni, thinking nothing can stop me. But then I get the worst overstimulation of my life, I go home and my mind is racing from adrenaline, from anxiety. It doesn't help that my home is also situated nearby an industrial side with actual air pollution, noise from traffic etc. So I go to uni, which is overstimulating, travelling is overstimulating, and my home is also overstimulating regarding environmental pollution. You can imagine how I feel then.

Now imagine that for days, weeks, years. Every single day I have to force myself to endure this stress to go to uni. Every single day. What is more frustrating is that I love uni. The courses are great. It's the rest that is horrible. So I am motivated to go to uni, only to then find myself getting a near panic attack every day from travelling.

Of course if you have to endure stress daily you will start feeling horrible when you go home. You worry about your sleep, because if you sleep well, your stress tolerance for the next day is even lower. You worry about the air, because you need to be able to think properly for your homework. And more.

I had this first realization of my autism being the cause of my OCD after taking sertraline for a month. I had vacation. I felt like I could change the world after taking it for 4 weeks, nothing could stop me. I was keen on making new friends when I returned from vacation, picking up new hobbies, fulfilling my work schedule for university.

The first day, I went to uni filled with motivation. That was until I stepped out of my apartment and went to take the bus to commute to uni. I realized my anxiety returning as soon as I saw the street with thousands of cars, as soon as I noticed the air pollution, the narrow streets with narrow sidewalks in hilly areas. Then I took the bus, which was crowded to the brim, which further increased my anxiety. I commuted to uni, looked outside the windows and saw the dozens of construction sides, the dust on the street from the insane amount of air pollution. I went to the lecture hall, which was filled with hundreds of students, pushing themselves through the entrance doors. Later, I went to the canteen which was filled with even more students, noise everywhere from people talking, me having to wait in a full line for half a hour, people pushing around. Later, I went home, again the same busses filled to the brim, went home, noticed the air pollution again, the construction noises. My mind was racing, I felt like I have experienced a near death experience. I felt so anxious, so stressed. Nothing has changed to pre Sertraline.

From that day, I knew what my problem is: My problem is autism. If it takes one, and I repeat one day for my OCD to return simply as a result of stress, I know what the problem is. Autism. When I am stressed is where my obsessions are at its peak. I go home from uni, and think about, say, throwing everything away I own. Because why not?

I envy American universities because they offer an actual "campus like" experience, away from the insanity that cities are. Where I live, universities are just like schools. Sure, there are accomodations. If you get such, otherwise you have to search for living space in the private sector in the cheapest, most ugly areas of the city.

I need to remove this stress factor from my life. I am a hard working, ambitious person. I am not lazy. I love studying for university, I love living a healthy life. But my body, my autism is setting me limitations. Limitations which I cannot ignore. When not even Sertraline helps, you know you need to change something in your life.

Whatever it is, I am not willing to live the rest of my 60+ years with daily stress. I have a right, just like every other human, to live a life without daily anxiety, a life without stress, a life without suffering. And I am more than willing to pursue that goal. But it is hard. It is hard with the autism, it is hard with my current living locations, with my feeling of isolation where I live. But I am willing to fight through this. I have to, because the alternative is worse: Daily anxiety, daily compulsions, obsessions, and more.

It doesn't help that my family doesn't understand my autism. It doesn't help that my psychiatrist doesn't understand my autism. It doesn't help that anyone from the mental health sector I talked with understands my autism. They only focus on the following: My OCD, and my anxiety. They say that it is an expression of a restless mind, an expression that I want to meet people, that I want to do things that are fun, an expression of wanting to explore new things. They are right. But they don't understand it is my autism that makes me unable to enjoy friendships, relationships, hobbies, going outside. They don't understand my overstimulation, because they are normal. Nothing against normal people. I wish I were like them. But they will never be able to understand my viewpoint because they never worry about, e.g., street noise when commuting.

My OCD, my anxiety is a result of me being unable to fulfill my desires: Friendships, hobbies, relationships, not having stress daily. As a result, I get restless, frustrated and worry about weird things because my mind is frustrated. I am overstimulated, but also easily understimulated. If anyone has any idea how to approach this contraction, let me now. I feel the most comfortable when I sit for hours infront of my computer, because the pixels offers me an infinite amount of stimulation, yet I don't have to worry about other stimulation around me. But real life expects me to go outside, which I respect. But I don't know how to deal with this overstimulation. This might be more appropriate for autism subreddit, but I think maybe someone with OCD and autism has experience here and can share their experiences and how they approached it?

Title: My brain has been playing on a loop, graphic images of my fellow queer friends and loved ones being  hurt since election day.
Text: I've been able to function but I've had to check in with each and every single one of them multiple times a day. If not I am filled with an anxious dread that I'm responsible for them getting hurt.

Title: I always need validation to continue on
Text: Hello, so I have been diagnosed with OCD since I was 5 years old, I’m 24 now. I have my processes. I must place things or do things at work in a certain order or else I can’t focus or essentially forget the steps because someone said another way was easier, but it impedes on my system of thought. I’m a surgical assistant at an oral surgeons office. We had a patient move while under light sedation and their blood draw catheter came out. They bled like a fountain. I stepped in when I realized what was happening, I removed the tourniquet (the rubber band kind they tie on your arm) and applied pressure to the bleeding to cause it to cease. None of my coworkers said anything about that operation or how I reacted during it. I’m fairly new and I have always been someone to seek validation. If I don’t know that I’m doing well with whatever task, then I don’t know if I’ll be able to continue without messing up. I feel like I did everything right. Do I take them not saying anything or correcting me as me doing a good job of handling the situation??

Title: Why do antidepressants leave me withdrawn, agitated and unmotivated?
Text:
For some background, around a year ago I suffered an horrific OCD flare up (a condition I've greatly suffered from since early childhood) which was largely purely obsessional. It revolved around recurring thoughts people were conspiring against me (I knew in my mind it wasnt true but I still had to perform rituals to 'cancel out' what they were doing) and that I was weird to other people and everything I said they were judging me relentlessly. This caused me to become severely anxious and withdraw from seeing friends. These new symptoms were in addition to the rituals I'd had all my life.  I tried Nicotine to ease the thoughts which helped somewhat at the start and evolved into further worsening of the intrusive thoughts. I'd wake up early with butterflies in my stomach and recurring intrusive thoughts. My girlfriend got pregnant around this time which added to the worries and likely flared it up further. I never wanted children because it would have been disastrous for me mentally and I was right. 

Fluoxetine:

I visited the doctor who tried Propanolol and Fluoxetine after he discovered my resting heart rate was 102bpm. The Propanolol helped slightly but after 5 weeks of treatment the Fluoxetine caused serious disassociation, panic attacks and anxiety i didn't even know was possible. 

Mirtazapine (Remeron):

A new doctor then decided to put me on Mirtazapine, which essentially wiped me out for 48 hours after taking my first dose. All was going well aside from weight loss and lethargy and my dose was eventually titrated up 15,30 then 45mg. I was on this dose for nearly a year (up until 6 weeks ago). For anxiety it worked well but it didn't put my back to my previous baseline of it being manageable, it really only changed the compulsions to cleanliness. I started getting nasty thoughts, hated everyone around me and felt no emotional connection to my newborn son. Everything my girlfriend did irritated me beyond words.

I fantasied daily about leaving her for someone better and felt a lot of built up resentment towards her and anything she's ever done. I threw her out of the house and my newborn son for a week after an argument and felt zero remorse. I hated her and everyone around me being near me. I slept on the sofa for 7 months before I eventually wanted to end my life through sheer hopelessness. My family told me I was evil on the tablets and completely different. I'd talk with my mother daily on the phone for an hour prior to the medication and enjoyed talking to her - now I'd swear down the phone at her and ask her why she's bothering me. 

I was lethargic, slept until mid afternoon, didnt help with the baby and had no energy whatsoever. My muscles ached like I had arthritis. 

Oddly enough, all of my focus issues went away that I have had all my life. I rediscovered my hobbies, enjoyed work and became work obsessed. Jobs I could never start got done and I was decently productive. This is making me push my doctors for an evaluation for ADHD. 

6 weeks ago,  the doctor agreed it wasn't normal and said I could just withdraw cold turkey which was agonising for 2 weeks. I couldn't concentrate, my business has suffered as a result and I've lost a lot of weight through lack of appetite/nausea. 

Escitaloprám (Lexapro):

After agreeing I could just quit, the doctor instantly put me on Escitaloprám (Lexapro) 5mg.

Week 1:
Nothing to report 

Week 2:
Instant mood uplift, feel elated, more social and hypersexual (possibly result of quitting Mirtazapine?)

Week 3/4:
Much the same as Week 2, less intense 

Week 5/6:

Unable to sit still and restless, girlfriend and people irritate me, no motivation to do anything, can't concentrate, major brain fog, much reduced OCD symptoms (basically in remission), total loss of sex drive, hopelessness, nausea and headaches. 

Tried quitting nicotine cold turkey but withdrawals unbearable. 




Why do I react this way to antidepressents? I think at this point I'm done and need to quit it all.

Title: Constant, Compulsive, Torturous Thoughts.
Text:
I’m being plagued right now by the constant thought that one day - I will be dead and my two children will be old men. I worry that one day, one of them will grow old and die, too - leaving the other a little old man who will be alone with nobody to look after him.
I worry about them being elderly, possibly in a retirement or a care home, and being assaulted and harmed by people working there.
I worry about them being old, walking with a stick and someone burgling them and leaving them attacked and defenceless. I worry about the way in which they’ll die one day, that I won’t be there to help them. It’s getting in my way so much so I can’t enjoy my evening. 
I’m not medicated at the moment - I haven’t been in almost 6 years. I felt better without it. I can’t ’worry tree’ or rationalise my way out of this one. I’m not sure what to do to stop the thoughts. Has anyone else had thoughts like this one?

Title: Does anyone else use ChatGPT for reassurance checking?
Text: I can’t count how many times since ChatGPT first became widely available I’ve asked it how I should decide on a certain topic (i.e. changing my minor in college) or whether I’ve “chosen the right path”. I also ask it all sorts of existential questions about aspects of my future career, how I should spend the rest of my life in general, and what I should do when I get old (I just turned 25 LOL). Does anyone else do the same? I think the reason I ask the AI nowadays is otherwise I’d be asking my parents 100x a day.

Title: 28 and realizing I have had OCD my whole life
Text:
Within the last few months I have developed a compulsion where I must knock on wood after an intrusive thought. Intrusive thoughts are largely health related regarding me and my loved ones. This compulsion must be done with 10 total knocks, in a very specific rhythm, and if I mess it up I reset it by wiping it away. It has to be real wood. Recently I have developed the fun twist that if I think about any human, any person at all, that they will suffer a horrible fate or death unless I can do the entire sequence without thinking about them. It is too the point where I can see anything, like a towel, and think of the person who invented the towel and now they are going to die. That person likely isnt even around anymore. Have you ever tried not to think about something? Of course you all have. 

This one is my biggest one. It started as such a (what I thought was) a lighthearted "haha, knock on wood!" and slowly developed into what it is now. And it keeps changing and adding on. My fear is what else is coming next. 

I must set alarms a specific way, I must have the earliest and latest at least an hour apart. There is an alarm every like, 2-3 minutes, just to be safe. I set my alarms, and then I have to, without blinking, in one swipe, swipe up and down the length of the alarm list twice and make sure I "catch" the alarm with my finger and the earliest and latest do not eave the screen. Following this, I must then hit the little toggle switch ten times up and down in a nice rhythm without messing up. If I mess that up, the alarm app gets cleared and I start the toggle switch again. Once I did that, then I have to do it 4 times on the toggle. Theres a few other little things in this process. It's normally followed up by a ten knock on my wood dresser. 

  
When I leave the house I must say goodbye in a certain way to my dog and cat, and then my partner. If they do not say the goodbye back to me in the same way, I just cannot leave the house. Luckily my partner is very, very understanding and we work with disabilities and mental disorders etc, so it has not been a huge issue. 

I tried to tell my therapist about it and I was told "welllll, everyone sometimes does the whole knock on wood thing. its like a social norm thing". I explained to her that I keep a wood block in my car because if I think about crashing my car I have to knock on that damn wood or else its gonna happen. I never brought it up again. 

I started seeing a psychiatrist. I've only been a few times, and I have mentioned it. There are other medication related things were focused on right now, but addressing the OCD is on the docket. I'm terrified.

My earliest compulsion I remember was related to hand washing and counting. My brother has autism, and he had a hand washing thing too, so for years I thought I was just copying him as a kid, but I know now I really was distraught if I couldn't do it. 

I am in this field. I work with this and other disorders like it. I work with clients who have this. I went to school, I understand the brain and the science. I know it is all lies. So why can't I do it?

Title: im so scared about the future
Text: im genuinely so terrified about what's going to happen.  the last few weeks have been hell because ive been off my ocd meds so the election just made it ten times worse. i keep telling myself that i accidentally chose the wrong party and voted for trump instead on accident and that its all my fault. i can't stop crying and its hard to sleep at night and the intrusive images and thoughts r just getting worse. part of me wishes i could just kill myself but im terrified of the after life cause like,,,idk what it is like what if i go to hell or get reincarnated into an even worse life. the main thing that is stopping me is my girlfriend and the fact i have homework due soon which is stupid sounding ik. i feel like such a burden to my gf like how could i be doing this to them.

Title: How to stop!
Text:
23F 

I have gender OCD sooooo fucking bad and it's killing me. LSS: I'm a girl, and I'm a lesbian. I've always felt a little off about being referred to as she/her but I've always seen myself as a woman/girl. I've never seen myself as a man. But, I've always wondered etc. I wished I could shapeshift to experience being a man, love men's clothes etc. but I'm just NOT a man. I know that I'm a woman inside and that I don't like men physically either. 


BUT THIS BITCH (my brain) KEEPS TRYNA CONVINCE ME OTHERWISE. 

"What if I am trans and I'm lying to myself" 
"What if I was born male" 
"I want to be a man don't I?"
"Maybe if I transition I'll like men" 
"I'll get on T....no I won't I don't want to....I should try" 

I'm constantly ruminating, constantly flip flopping. I'm probably driving the FTM community insane. Then it recently hit me that this is a compulsion. I'm so exhausted. How do I get my brain to officially STOP going crazy over this? I KNOW MY GENDER AND WHAT I AM. but my OCD just isn't convinced.

Title: Are less "obvious" and/or less talked about obsessions/compulsions very common?
Text:
Just wondering. When most people think of OCD, they can only imagine the stereotypical stuff in extremes, where every obsession is followed by a visible compulsion. Even I have a hard time not imagining that, sometimes...

But unless you are very close to me then you probably wouldn't even be able to tell what type of stuff I worry about, or that I worry about it at all. I don't wash my hands until they bleed or go out in a hazmat suit, I mostly just research/ruminate/avoid. 

I don't really feel like I can relate/be related to, even my brothers OCD of the exact same type is 1000x more obvious than mine. Everyone takes him seriously because he washes his hands. I just get insulted and called a germaphobe and told to stop overreacting.

And that's just for my one obsession that actually IS common, the rest I feel like are kinda weird because you really only hear about the same few types. I looked up if anyone else had the same less-talked about obsessions as me and only found one or two people... Yeah that felt a bit isolating.

Title: How long did it take for you to feel the full effects of medication?
Text:
I know the test is 6-8 weeks but a few people on this sub have said 3 months, 6 months, etc.

How long did it take for you to feel the full effects of the medication you’re taking for OCD? 

My real question: How did you know when it was time to give up or push through?

Title: Can comments from others trigger OCD and send you into a downward spiral? As someone helping a sufferer, what can I do?
Text:
Warning: this is long, and I apologize in advance. I will clarify anything needed in the comments.

Context: This is an anonymous account I made. I am my wife's husband. This story is about my wife, daughter, and my daughter's friend. My wife has been diagnosed with Religious OCD/scrupulosity and she has been in a downward OCD spiral for nearly 10 days now after receiving a text from my daughter's friend's mom. It's severely impacting our marriage and her relationship to our children.

For even more context: my wife did not grow up in the best environment. There was no father present, only a distant and sometimes angry stepfather, and her mom is emotionally immature. She has also been plagued by OCD and depression for many years. However, as a kid, she was never treated. She was not treated until after we were married. And it wasn't until recently (within the last year) that we found what I think is the right combo of meds so that she finally started to receive the treatment she needs.

Apparently what happened (I was not there) is that my wife was letting our daughter and her friend (hereafter referred to as "L") play together. My wife already has what I consider to be an inordinate attachment to L because she - for some reason - views L as herself when she was young. She thinks L comes from a very similar family type (working, absent mother, angry supposedly abusive step-dad). I know L's family a little bit, and I honestly don't think that's the dynamic at play. L is very well behaved, obedient, and respectful. But L also likes to tell stories, and my wife pretty much believes whatever L tells her I think because she views L as a copy of herself and the situation she grew up in. So she's always trying to "save" her.

So, what happened that day was apparently L's step dad came and picked L up and was angry with L because my daughter and L were playing with neighborhood kids that L was not allowed to play with.  According to my 9 yo, L's stepdad apparently said something to the effect of "Get in the fucking car!" when he pulled up to get her. Again, I don't know. I was not there. I have met the stepdad before and he seems like a nice guy. But I wouldn't put it past him to have an outburst of anger. All parents do. Especially when L was playing with kids she knew she wasn't allowed to play with (my wife did not know L was not allowed to play with these kids).

Some further context is needed: due to OCD and depression, before we found the right med my wife was prone to very angry outbursts. She was easily frustrated and had a very short fuse. This was also, I believe, a product of the environment she was raised in as her mom was the same way with her. So, in the past, my wife has gotten very frustrated when our kids would not listen and has all-out yelled at them when L has been over to spend the night. This was so bad once that it brought L to tears and made her afraid. And she called her mom and begged to go home. I had to get on the phone with the mom and smooth things over. So, L's mom knows my wife has emotional issues.

So, back to what happened. After my 9 yo tells my wife what happened, this sends my wife into a tailspin and she goes into "savior" mode. She send's L's mom a loooong text about what stepdad supposedly did and said. L's mom replies effectively telling her to butt out, that stepdad did not curse, and that my wife needs to focus on her own family. She told my wife that she does not think her concern for L is "genuine", especially when she has "angry outbursts at her husband (me) and children". She also said she thinks my wife is trying to be an "instigator".

My wife did not take this well and it has led to her for, I kid you not, the past 10 days now, being stuck in an OCD rut. Before this, she was on top of the world. She was on the right meds and I honestly had never seen her better. Nothing bothered her and she was making phenomenal progress. Now, it feels like she's been completely knocked off the ladder and starting all over again yet making no progress.

For some reason, this event has triggered the following:

\-Extreme religious OCD - fearing that L's mom revealed my wife's "true self" and that God has been mad at her all along and she's going to go to hell

\-Extreme PTSD (I guess? I don't know what to call it) - constantly telling me stories about bullies in school and what happened to her

\-Extreme rumination on past events

\-Little to no sleep at night

\-Catatonic and easily forgetting things in the day

\-Constantly asking for reassurance from me (which I take care not to provide so as not to feed the OCD cycle)

\-Constantly praying and asking for forgiveness for supposed passed "sins"

\-Near constant crying due to be filled with regret for past "mistakes"

Honestly, she's gone from like a 9/10 down to a 0-1/10. And all in barely over a week. At first, she was trying to fight it. I could tell it was getting to her but she was determined to not hold on to it. To just let it pass. But as the days have worn on, she's only gotten worse.

We reached out to her psychiatrist who suggested she double her dose of Lamictal from 25mg to 50mg, which she has done and we're on day 2 of that now. Lamictal has been a life saver for her. It literally is what brought her up to the 9/10 she was before so I'm hopeful this increased dose will work in time.

But, what else can I do? Can a single comment in a text from a friend's mom really trigger this kind of OCD reaction? I'm at a loss. I'm trying to help her, but she is effectively incapacitated and I am having to shoulder all the work at home. It's been very difficult. She sees her talk therapist again this coming Wednesday and I'm hoping he can help her as well.

But, are there any coping strategies we could try? Should we ask if her other meds should be increased? In addition to the Lamictal 50mg, she's currently also on Vyvanse 50mg and Zoloft 25mg. And, like I said, prior to this incident, she was at 9/10 functioning on those meds. She was like a 100% normal person. Everything that she is doing now, which she had done in the past prior to starting her current meds, was NOT PRESENT AT ALL. She was living a normal life. So it's very disheartening to see this happen.

Thank you all for reading. I'm happy to clarify anything in the comments. I'm just a husband and father who is already  stretched thin and completely stressed out by this and I'm trying to help in any way I can.

Thank you for reading and for your support and advice.

Title: Weird intrusive thought
Text:
I have had the urge to watch Toy Story all day, so I’m watching it now. 

I know it’s likely just my brain craving  nostalgia and comfort after the events of this week, but my brain also keeps telling me this is the last movie I’m going to watch before I die, so I can’t really enjoy it. Like I’m going to die tonight or tomorrow and I’ll never see anything again. 

It feels so real and I’m really sad. I’m stressed in general because I’m officiating a wedding for a family member this weekend, so I’m sure that’s contributing.

I just wanted to watch this wholesome movie but my OCD is ruining it. 

Anyone experienced anything like this?

Title: Why are intrusive thoughts so evil
Text: I suffer with horrid intrusive thoughts. It’s gotten to the point where I’m scared to have my cats lay on my lap because my intrusive thoughts attack my relationship with them. The OCD says the most disturbing shit. It’s not me. No matter how much I know it’s not me, it feels so real. OCD has taken everything from me. I’m at a loss at this point. It feels like it’s never gonna get better.

Title: is not reaction to thoughts something good??
Text: i don’t know what to do. what if i changed? what if i became the person i was scared to become? what if some kinda trauma effected me? what if my brain manifested it? what if i gave up the denial and finally accepted that i’m a horrible person?
